loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Humberto tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, Oscar se dedica al negocio de transporte, posee dos trailers en el cual transporta granos basicos, cemento y hierro en todo Honduras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas para uno de sus camiones.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos ya que viven en la casa de su madre.
Su pasatiempo favorito es viajar en su camion.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar Humberto is 50 years old, married, and has four children. He manages a transportation business and has two trailers that are used to transport grain, cement, and iron throughout Honduras.

His loan will be used to buy tires for one of his trucks. Oscar dreams of owning a home so that he can provide a better quality of life for his children. They currently live at his mother’s house.

His favorite hobby is traveling in his truck.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his truck.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge dedicado al servicio musical ya hace mas de una década el cuenta con sus instrumentos para brindar este servicio que por cierto lo realiza muy bien ya que es un músico muy reconocido en su rubro, debido a los problemas económicos solo el y su hijo se encuentran en el país ya que su esposa se fue a trabajar al exterior. De todos modos el Sr. Jorge tiene muchas mas fuerza ya que es mucha responsabilidad de criar a su hijo solo. El crédito que solicita el cliente es para poder comprar instrumentos de ocasión para equiparse mucho mejor. Y brindar un mejor servicio musical, es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Jorge makes music for a living, work that he's done for more than ten years.  He's a successful performer and he's became well known locally for his music.  Recent economic problems led his wife to leave the country to find work and he and their son live alone together.  Sr. Jorge has had to become still stronger because he now has sole responsibility for raising their child.  He's applying for a loan to buy new musical instruments so that he has the equipment he needs for his performances.  He's a responsible and hard-working man, grateful to the bank for supporting his music performance business.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments for performance business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casado, el tine tres hijos Zulma de 21 años y zeidy de 19 que asisten a la universidad y Rafael que asiste a primaria, el y su familia viven en el estado De Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos de uno de los ingenios azucareros llamado la margarita.

don Rafael nosplatica que hace el trabaja en el campo pero lo que gana no le alcanzaba para cubrir con los gastos del hogar asi que platicando con su esposa decidieron abrir una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes para ganar un poco de dinero extra y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. su tienda se encuentra en un pequeño local que tiene a en su casa con vista a la calle el cual lo abre todos los dias de ocho de la mañana a  ocho de la noche, el cual atiende sus hijos y su esposa. el necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, papel de baño, sopa, azucar, sal, dulces, galletas y refrescos para resurtr su tienda. el nos platica que siempre le ha gustado tener bien surtido su negocio para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que busquen y asi vuelvan a su tienda a comprar.

don rafael espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea terminar de pagar los estudios de sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad vida
texts.en:
Rafael is 45 years old.  He only finished secondary school.  He’s married and has three children: Zulma, 21, and Zeidy, 19, who go to the university and Rafael who is in elementary school.  He and his family live in the state of Oaxaca in a community called Tetela which is noted for being located in a sugar cane growing zone just fifteen minutes form one of the large sugar cane plantations called “La Margarita.” 

Rafael tells us that he works in the fields but what he earns there wasn’t enough to cover household expenses so, talking it over with his wife, they decided to open a little grocery store to earn a little extra money and provide better quality of life for their children.  The store is located in a small locale he has at home that faces the street and that opens daily from 8am until 8pm.  His children and his wife tend to it.  He needs the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, soup, sugar, salt, candy, cookies and soft drinks to restock the store.  He tells us that he always likes to keep the store well stocked so that his customers always find what they are looking for and will return to shop at his store.

Rafael hopes that his business will prosper with the loan because he wants to finish paying for his children’s schooling and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Feza

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married mother of two children aged three and six years, Feza has been operating a well-organized business selling a variety of clothes for five years. Open from 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. every weekday, she employs one person to help her.

Feza has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more child and adult clothing to sell. With the profits arising from the loan, she plans to save for her family's future, pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase child and adult clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zarbayim

texts.en:
Zarbayim  is 21 years old. She is married and has two children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. Her husband is master and works in construction.  She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. Her monthly profit is about 60 AZN. She currently has two cows and one bull. 

Now Zarbayim wants to expand her business. As her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. She is asking for 1000 AZN in order to purchase cattle. Zarbayim expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Letty has a food shop that sells a variety of viands and green bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make food to sell.

Letty is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Soa's Group
loans.use: to buy bamboo and materials to make more brooms.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 53 años; convive hace 10 años con Felicia, con quien tiene una hija: Joselin. En su casa propia ubicada en ciudad de Tarma. Desde hace 29 años comenzó a trabajar en una empresa de trasporte público, como chofer. Trasportando a los pobladores del lugar a diferentes ciudades. En ese tiempo sufrió un accidente quedando lesionado. Ahora está tramitando su pensión por tiempo de servicio. Según menciona en este tiempo de crisis le ayuda en los gasto del hogar, su esposa. Pues se dedica a la venta de cuyes y chanchos. Los cuales enseba y vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 400 soles por venta. Su principal problema son los gatos que paga mensualmente al colegio donde estudia su hija. Por ello hace poco incursionó en la fabricación de comida balanceada con el molino que posee. Elaborando harinas de quinua, maca, soya y demás productos. Cuenta que la va muy bien, pues compra sus insumos en Lima, para después moler las harinas, cuyo peso se duplica vendiendo sus productos por kilos a un mayor precio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera concretar sus objetivos pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Arturo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una tonelada de maíz morocho (híbrido), cuyo costo promedio es de s/. 3 soles el kilo.
texts.en: Arturo is 53 years old and he has been married common-law with Felicia for 10 years. They have a daughter together, name Joselin. They live in a house of their own located in the city of Tarma. Twenty-nine years ago he started out working as a driver for a public transport company, transporting the public to different cities. But he has suffered an accident and he was injured. He is currently receiving a pension for his time in service. He says that during this time of crisis his wife helps him with the household expenses. She has a business selling guinea pigs and pigs. She greases them and sells them in the wholesalers market in the city, obtaining a profit of S/.400 neuvos soles per sale. His biggest problem is her daughter's monthly tuition expenses. And for this reason he recently took up producing balanced foods with the mill he has. He produces various types of flour, such as quinoa, maca, soy bean, and other products. He says that it is going very well. He buys the ingredients in Lima and he later mills them to make flour, and to duplicate the volume. He sells them by the kilogram and at a better price. He is a member of the communal bank "Senor de Muruhuay" and it is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He hopes to achieve his objectives with the support from all of you. He promises to make his loan payments on time. Arturo, on receiving your support, will invest the funds requested in the purchase of a ton of the morocho variety of corn (hybrid). The average cost is s/. 3 soles per kilogram.

loans.use: to purchase one ton of corn.

loans.name: Unidas Para Vencer Group

texts.es:
Banco Comunal Unidas para Vencer esta integrado por diez socias que se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas en la Aldea de San Nicolas en el municipio de Juticalpa. La coordinadora de este Banco se llama Kenia Jacqueline, y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y sandalias, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y procreo tres hijos varones.

Hace seis años atras Kenia siguiendo el ejemplo de una de sus vecinas decidio dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada, y compro su primer fardo gracias al apoyo economico de su esposo y aunque no fue mucho, eso le basto para iniciar. Su negocio no tiene nombre porque realiza las ventas de forma ambulante, y de vez en cuando en su hogar cuando sus vecinos o amistades llegan a buscarla. La dificultad mas grande que enfrenta Kenia es la temporada lluviosa porque no puede salir de su casa y pierde de vender y tambien cuando da la mercaderia al credito porque a veces se tardan mucho en cancelarle. 

El prestamo que esta solicitando Kenia lo necesita para comprar un fardo de ropa usada y tambien comprar sandalias para darle un giro diferente a su negocio. Con el apoyo de este financiamiento ella podra surtir su negocio de ropa y de sandalias de diferentes colores y estilos para satisfacer a sus clientes. 

Muy contenta Kenia expreso que con los prestamos obtenidos en FAMA a podido ir mejorando su casa y tambien pudo comprar su refrigeradora y eso le ha a ayudado a ahorrar algunos centavos porque antes se le arruinaban algunos productos que necesitaban refrigeracion.

Su meta es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que culminen sus estudios academicos y su sueño es culminar las mejoras de su casa. Kenia tiene mas de dieciseis ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas para Vencer' community bank has ten members who are engaged in different business activities in the village of San Nicolas, in Juticalpa.  The bank's coordinator is Kenia Jacqueline and she sells second-hand clothes and sandals.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three sons.

Six years ago, following the example of one of her neighbors, Kenia decided to start selling second-hand clothes and bought her first bundle of clothes with the financial support of her husband.  Although it wasn't a lot, it was enough to get her started.  Her business doesn't have a name because she makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.  She also sometimes makes sales from her home when her neighbors or friends come to find her.  The biggest difficulty that Kenia faces is the rainy season because it means she can't go out and she loses sales.  She also has problems when she sells merchandise on credit because sometimes her customers take a long time to pay her back.

Kenia needs the loan that she is requesting to buy a bundle of second-hand clothes and also to buy sandals so that she can do something a little different with her business.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to stock her business with clothes and sandales in different colors and styles in order to satisfy her customers.

Kenia commented very happily that, as a result of the loans she has received from FAMA, she has been able to continue improving her home and has also been able to buy a refrigerator.  This has helped her to save a few cents because, before she bought the refrigerator, some products that needed refrigerating used to go off.

Kenia's goal is to continue supporting her children so that they finish their education.  Her dream is to finish carrying out improvements to her home.  Kenia has been working with FAMA for more than 16 loan cycles and she has made her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes and sandals

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 61 years old and married. She had four children; one of them is working and sometimes helps her with other expenses. She patiently sells rice to the people in her neighborhood. In a sack of rice, she usually gains a profit of 500 Philippines pesos (P). 

Evangeline is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy more sacks of rice to sell for additional profits.

In the future, Evangeline wants to establish a stall so that she will not be selling the rice on a house-to-house basis. She is getting old so she needs to operate the business in a stall for a more comfortable way of continuously generating income for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is known as a woman of faith and courage. She is now 49 years old and has six school-aged children. Despite being a widow, she has the strong determination to educate her children and give them a better life. She endures hardships and difficulties for she wants to continue sending her children to school. 

The main sources of her income is hog-raising, managing a variety store, and direct selling of AVON, Natasha and Boardwalk products. She has been in this business for almost 26 years and usually earns a profit of P8,000 a month which she utilizes for their daily expenses and allowances for the children. 

She aims to improve her business and make it a viable source of income but due to financial constraints, she wants to ask for an additional capital of P30,000 to buy additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages, breads, seasonings, lotions, body sprays and jewelry to sell in her variety store. 

Leonida mentioned that through this loan, she can increase her product offering and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues to work hard and strive to do well.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages, breads, seasonings, lotions, body sprays and jewelry to sell in her variety store.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 43 years old and married with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending. Dulce hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maravilla 2011 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARAVILLA 2011” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Alejandra es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa usada, artesanía en títeres, venta dulces, comercio de condimentos, venta de verduras.

La señora Alejandra,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias del mercado y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Maravilla 2011” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Alejandra, who is the president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling used clothing, making puppets, selling candy, selling condiments, and selling vegetables.

Sra. Alejandra says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from a local promoter. Alejandra currently has a business selling vegetables and has worked for several years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy vegetables. She acquires her inventory at the market fairs and then sells at other fairs. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Alejandra is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alejandra said that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en: Hoda is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her four children. Her husband is working outside the country and is barely helping her with the family expenses because of his limited income. That was the motive for her to start her own business working in producing handicrafts, needlework, embroidery, etc. in order to improve the family's financial situation. She has been working in this domain for the past 15 years; her work is based at her home. Additionally, she has given private lessons since 2004. Today, she’s asking to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy products for her handmade work. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy products for her handmade work.

loans.name: Sheeman's Group

texts.en:
Sheeman is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago, leaving her to care for their five children. Now her children have grown older and they do different kinds of work to contribute to the family's finances. Sheeman remains at home and does her household tasks. She is still very active at the age of 57.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her eldest son’s business of selling betel leaves and cigarettes. With the loan he will buy betel leaves and cigarettes of different brands. This will allow him to sell more and earn better profits. He started his business two years ago. Sheeman is confident that her son will utilize the loan in a good way to earn maximum profits for his business.

Note: In the picture, the woman holding a passbook is Sheeman.

loans.use: to buy betel leaves and cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Malkia Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has been running a vegetable business for one year now.  She works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy more vegetables to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Malkia," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kuti

texts.en:
Kuti is aged 50 years-old and has been in active farming for the last 20 years.  She also runs a retail shop in the local market with both being her sources of income for family upkeep. She is  married with three children aged 20, 17 and 11 years-old and all are schooling with the first born taking his post secondary education.

Kuti has made a request for a loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will boost her milk and enable her to buy better breeds as well as pay for education of her children.

Kuti appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but notes that poor state of roads in the area is a challenge to farmers when making deliveries to the market.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jerly

texts.en:
Jerly is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Jerly has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stock from AVON to sell.

Jerly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jerly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON to sell

loans.name: Gloria Libett

texts.es: Gloria originaria de León nos comparte su experiencia con su primer préstamo Kiva el cual le fue de mucha ayuda pues lo utilizo para comprar tela, hilo ,botones zipers  ya compro bastante material que necesitaba para hacer sus  pantalones, camisas, trajes de niños trajes de señora. Ha visto que su negocio ha prosperado es por ello que solicita un segundo crédito para comprar tela fina de mejor calidad. Debido a que le viene la época en que le solicitan trajes de graduación, birretes , trajes de caballero y necesita tela de muy buena calidad para satisfacer a sus clientes. Una vez cancelado su segundo crédito le gustaría adquirir una máquina de coser semi industrial para mejorar la calidad de sus diseños y hacer crecer su negocio para poder brindar oportunidad de trabajos a otras personas y de esta manera contribuir con su vecindario.
texts.en: Gloria, native of Leon, shares her experience with her first Kiva loan which was very helpful to her.  She used the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and enough material that she needed to make pants, shirts, children's suits, and ladies suits.  She has seen that her business has prospered therefore she is asking for a second loan to buy fine quality fabric.  Since the time is approaching when she is asked for graduation gowns, caps, and men's suits she needs fine quality fabric to satisfy her customers.  After paying off her second loan she would like to buy a semi industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her designs and expand her business to provide job opportunities to others and thus contribute to her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy fine quality fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Dolores Carlina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en una escuela para niños especiales. Su esposo es chofer de un gerente en la ciudad de Manta.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus hijos y su esposo se dedica a elaborar bisutería y adornos para fiestas elaborados en fomix, estas manualidades aprendió hace muchos años y ahora elabora estos productos y los envía hasta los Estados Unidos donde tiene familiares quienes la dan vendiendo. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta profesión y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales útiles para elaborar sus manualidades como perlas, mullos, cadenas, broches, fomix, silicón, etc. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en el transcurso de este tiempo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
In the residential area La California in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the communal bank Las Divinas meet every fifteen days. 

Here we meet Dolores. She is 42 years old and married, and she and her husband have 3 children aged 16, 14, and 11 years old. The two oldest study in high school, and the youngest in a school especially for children. Her husband is a chauffeur for a businessman in the city of Manta. 

In order to earn something of her own and to help her children and her spouse, she works decorating jewelry and ornaments with craft foam for parties. She learned this craft many years ago, and now  she makes those products and sends them to the United States where she has family members who sell them. She’s been doing this work for over 20 years, and it’s going very well. 

This loan is to buy materials used to make her crafts like pearls, beads, chains, broaches, craft foam, silicon, etc. She’s been with the communal bank for 5 years, and she like the help they’ve given her during this time. 

Her dreams are to keep advancing her business and that her children don’t lack anything.

loans.use: to buy pearls, beads, chains, broaches, craft foam, silicon, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells spare parts. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the 99,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of spare parts. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts

loans.name: Portocal

texts.en:
P. P. (literally translated, Orange Orange) is one of the leaders of the community in the Sliven Roma ghetto. His wife began operating a small food pantry 10 years ago while P. drove a taxi in the center of Sliven to generate the capital needed to support the business while it started. 6 years ago, he and his wife moved to a larger location and now continue to operate the small neighborhood grocery store. Now, the one-room store is big enough to employ P., his wife and two daughters, both in their 20s, and support their four children. P. has taken 8 bank loans to expand his business over the years, and has proudly repaid each one fully and on time. He is excited about the Kiva program, however, because it permits him to borrow money for dramatically less than he had been paying.

P. is a role model within his community, as his business is one of the very few that has been successful over time. He is known for his honesty and compassion, extending credit to families that would otherwise go hungry between paydays. With this loan he plans to increase his inventory and provide a working capital cushion.

The Roma, commonly known as gypsies, is a severely marginalized social group in Bulgaria and throughout the Balkans.

loans.use: Working capital (inventory)

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur H. is an Internally-Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He fled to Agsu 13 years ago. He is married with two children. For the past three years he has owned a small booth at the local bazaar where he sells men's and women's clothing. With this loan he wants to increase his current inventory and improve his business.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en:
Fofoga has a family of five. She operates her business from her home, selling popcorn. Her business is popular with village members, especially the younger people. She makes 50 packets of popcorn a day, and sells them for one tala a packet.

Fofoga does this six days a week, while her husband helps earn more money as a taxi driver.

She needs 1,250 to purchase more corn seeds and oven to expand her business and buy gas.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds, oven, and gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Selenia Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Selenia Yamileth and I have my own small business selling clothes, cosmetics and jewelry, both door to door and by special order. I have been in business for several years and it has allowed me to help with my family's living expenses.

I am requesting this loan because demand has increased and I would like to be able to offer a better selection of goods to my customers. In this business, more choices translate into better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Selenia Yamileth, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva , cosmeticos y joyas, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad. Gracias a los ingresos de este negocio puedo colaborar con los gastos de mi familia.

Actualmente necesito mayor inversión ya que la demanda ha crecido y asi poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes. tomando en cuenta que este tipo de negocio entre mayor surtido hay mejores son las ventas.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's jeans and shirts, and jewelry

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es:
Carmelina is 26 years old, single, and dedicates herself to making blouses. She travels to the nearest cities to purchase her supplies (San Cristobal, Comitan) where she also sells her goods to the tourists who frequent those areas. She belongs to Santa Barbara 5, a collective comprised of several women with similar businesses. They hope to purchase fabric and thread at wholesale prices to help reduce their costs and therefore increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

CARMELINA se dedica a bordar blusas de manta, soltera y tiene 26 años. Ella viaja para comprar su materia prima a las ciudades más cercanas a su localidad (San Cristóbal, Comitán) y posteriormente las vende ahí mismo, sus principales clientes son los turistas que visitan las ciudades. De esta forma ella solventa sus gastos. Pertenece al grupo llamado Santa Bárbara 5 junto con doña Dolores Méndez López (artesana), doña Maria Elva Aguilar Vázquez (artesana) y doña Elena Cristiani Hernández (artesana). Ellas invertirán en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor para abaratar costos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Akessa

texts.fr:
At 28 years of age, Miss P. Akessa is a seamstress in training. She practices her trade at the house, because her means don't permit her to open a shop. She doesn't have enough clients and her revenue doesn't cover her needs. She is very dynamic, stylish and conscious of her future. She wants to launch herself into a business selling jewellery. With the approaching holiday at the end of the year, she wants to go and buy the latest trends in jewellery in Ghana, but her savings are very meager. To do this, she is asking for a loan of $400. This will increase her revenues and allow her a financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 28 ans, Mlle P. Akessa, est couturière de formation. Elle exerce son métier à la maison car les moyens ne lui permettent pas d’ouvrir un atelier. Elle n’a pas de clientèle et les revenus de son activité n’arrivent pas à subvenir ses besoins. Très dynamique et soucieuse de son avenir, elle veut se lancer dans le commerce des bijoux mais de moyens non plus. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle veut aller acheter des nouveautés de bijoux au Ghana mais ses économies sont très maigres. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Buying and selling of jewellery

loans.name: Nazaket

texts.en: Ms. Nazaket is a low-income vulnerable woman. She is 42, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli city in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Nazaket owns a small herd of milk cows. She sells milk in the Saatli bazaar. Her family expenditures are increasing as her children grow. Nazaket plans to increase her number of cattle to make her income higher. This project requires investment. This winter, Nazaket applied for a $1000 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. She hopes this credit will allow her to change her family life.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Natalia's Group

texts.en:
Natalia, Elizabeth and MarieL. are members of the community bank “Retoño”. Elizabeth has been a member for almost four years, but Natalia and Elizabeth recently joined. As members of the community bank they have learned how to work more productively, to be responsible, to be punctual, and to save.

Natalia is 42 years old and has four children. She has been selling fruit at the airport for one year. With her new loan she plans to start selling soft drinks and candy as well.

Elizabeth is 26 and has three children who are 8, 6, and 3 years old. She and her husband run a business making hats. They have been running this business for several years. With her new loan she plans to start exporting hats to Bolivia.

MarieL. is 22 years old and has a three-month-old son. Previous to having her baby she owned a restaurant. At the moment, she is concentrating on raising her son. Maria will use her loan to help her brother who owns a “recreo” which is a business where there are a variety of recreational activities such as swimming, a café, and sports fields.

Natalia, Elizabeth and MarieL. need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, candies, shipping supplies, and helping their brother. They dream of owning their home, having machines for their business, and that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: Natalia, Elizabeth and Mariela need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, candies, shipping supplies, and helping their brother.

loans.name: Santos Evelia

texts.es:
Santos Evelia Rodríguez A. is 40 years old. She lives in Mache district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru. She has three dependent children.

Over time she has become a very successful businesswoman. Currently, she has an agriculture/veterinary supply store called “Otiniano”, where she sells plant medicines, fertilizers and insecticides (in both powder and liquid forms), pesticides, and other products for agricultural activities. At her business, she has installed a small vitrine in which she displays hardware products.

She studied Accounting, and when she finished her studies, she got a job with the municipality of Mache, where she worked for 6 years. She later married and started a family. Due to the need to stay at home to care for her children, she got the idea of starting up the business she currently has. Things have gone well for her, since she is the only person in the neighborhood who sells these products. She has always noticed the unmet needs of consumers and realized that there was no good place for visitors to stay in Mache, so she opened a small hostel.

She is one of the founding members of the “Mujeres con Futuro” (Women with a Future) communal bank, which she joined 5 years ago. The first loan she received was for S/. 300.00 and she used the money to start her agriculture/veterinary supply store.

With this loan of S/. 2000.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 1 box of Hieloxil, a product that is used to cure infections of potato plants and which is very much in demand during this season; 1 box of Tifón, which is for killing weevils; and 1 box of Extrafox.

Santos dreams of having another business location, which she would make into a large and modern hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Santos Evelia Rodríguez A. tiene 40 años de edad. Vive en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Tiene tres hijos que aun dependen de ella. A través del tiempo se ha convertido en una comerciante muy exitosa, actualmente tiene una Agro veterinaria llamada “Otiniano”, lugar donde se venden productos medicinales para la siembra, fertilizantes y exterminadores de insectos ya sea en polvo o liquido; pesticidas y otros productos especiales para el agro. En este mismo negocio a colocado una pequeña vitrina en la que exhibe productos de ferretería. Estudio la carrera de Contabilidad y al terminar sus estudios consiguió un trabajo en la municipalidad de Mache en la cual trabajó 6 años, posteriormente se caso y formó su familia debido a la necesidad de quedarse en su casa a cuidar de sus niños tuvo la idea de poner el negocio que actualmente mantiene y le ha ido muy bien ya que ella es única en la zona que vende estos productos. Siempre ha observado las necesidades no cubiertas de los consumidores y se dio cuenta que en Mache no existía un lugar apropiado donde puedan alojarse los visitantes y es así que abrió un pequeño hostal. Es una de las fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” hace cinco años que es socia de este banco comunal. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 con este dinero implemento su negocio agrícola. Con el préstamo de S/.2000.00 el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará 1 caja de hieloxil producto que sirve para curar los sembríos de papa el cual los agricultores solicitan mayormente en esta época, 1 caja de tifón que sirve para exterminar el gorgojo y 1 caja de extrafox. La señora Santos sueña con tener otro local en el que acondicione una ferretería moderna y amplia.

loans.use: To buy inventory of products for her business

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Xuân, 25 years old collects and sells scrap metal, her husband is a laborer. They raise few pigs at home. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Dương Thị Bình applies for a loan to buy scrap metal.
  • Nguyễn Thị Mỵ applies for a loan to invest in her noodL. business.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hường applies for a loan to invest in her business.
  • Ngô Thị Lợi applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock.
  • Nguyễn Thị Tình applies for a loan to buy pigkets.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thanh applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock .

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Xuân, 25 tuổi. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ sắt vụn, anh đi làm thuê, N.ài ra anh chị còn chăn nuôi lợn ở nhà. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để một phần thêm vốn đi chợ, một phần mua thêm cám cho đàn lợn nhà mình. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị Dương Thị Bình vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ sắt hàng ngày. Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỵ vay 2006000 đồng để mua thêm nguyên liệu làm bánh đa, mỳ để đi giao cho các cửa hàng trong xã, huyện. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hường vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ hàng ngày. Chị Ngô Thị Lợi vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ sắt và mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tình vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ sắt và mua lợn giống. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thanh vay 2006000 đồng để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi lợn, gà.

loans.use: For scrap metal, feed for livestock

loans.name: Tursunali

texts.ru:
Tursunali T. lives in Rudaki region. He is 48, married with 4 children. He does not have a high school diploma. But he is a farmer. He has a large plot of land were he grows vegetables. Now, he needs to harvest radishes, greens and potatoes. He sells these goods wholesale. In place of the harvest, he needs to plant tomatoes, cucumbers and cabbage. In order to do this, Tursunali needs to purchase and prepare seeds and fertilizer. This is why he would like to receive a loan, which he will repay within 12 months.

Туракулов Tурсунали живет в районе Рудаки. Ему 48 лет, он женат и имеет 4 детей. Образования не имеет . Hо занимается земледелием. Имеет большой участок земли на котором выращивает овощи. Сейчас он должен собрать урожай редиски, зелени и картофеля . Продает все оптом. На месте собранного урожая необходимо засеить помидоры , огурцы и капусту. Для этого нужно купить и приготовить семена и удобрения. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит, который сможет погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Srijana

texts.en:
Mrs. Srijana P. is 32 years old and lives in Bijeswori, a town in the Kathmandu Valley, with her husband and three children. Mrs. P.'s oldest daughter is 13 years old and in the seventh grade. Her middle child, also a girl, is 12 and in the sixth grade. Her youngest child, a son, is six and in the first grade.

Like many people in this area, she and her husband make a living running a small shop that sells various items such as snacks, gum and jewelery that are in demand among local residents. She has applied for a loan of $225, which she will use to buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell from her shop

loans.name: Sotheary Khat Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sotheary K. is the group leader of four in Trok Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife and a farmer. Mrs Sotheary K.’s field is now infertile, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to spread in her rice field in order to produce a better and more abundant crop. Her husband, Mr Sotha Soam, is a palm juice collector and subsistence farmer. Mrs Sotheary K. is 36 and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is enrolled in school. The remaining two are staying at home because they are too young to work or study.

Mrs K. will share this loan with the other members of her group. Mr Ky P. did not come to take the loan, but his wife came instead of him so she is presented in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to spread in her rice field in order to produce a better and more abundant crop.

loans.name: Chham

texts.en:
Mrs. Chham S., 40, is a rice wine maker and raises pigs to sell. She sells wine to her customers and then transports it to them. She has been in this business since 1998 and earns around $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Champa Phay, 50, is a farmer who earns around $4 per day. They live in Korktonlaop Village, Banteay Meanchey Province.

Because of her growing business, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to add to her savings to purchase a small truck to use as transportation for her wine to customers.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase a small truck to use to transport her wine to customers

loans.name: Maqboola's Group

texts.en:
Maqboola baji is the wife of Q. A. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the last 20 years.  She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son.  Her son is involved in a scrap business.  Her daughter is in 8th standard.  Maqboola baji's husband is a daily wage laborer.  Maqboola baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles, papers) to expand her son's scrap business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Rani baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle).  Humaira baji and Rafiqan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.  Parveen baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle).

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more scrap

loans.name: Zainab's Allah Karim Group

texts.en:
Zainab, 49, is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 8. She has operated her own food shop since 1999, working daily from 7 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. and earning a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Zainab is now requesting a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses operating a general shop, selling clothes, and retailing CD’s.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruits to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 33 años, es conviviente, en un año se casará con su pareja, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos.  Cuando era soltera trabajaba en la chacra de sus padres, pero ahora desde que tiene sus hijos pequeños está al cuidado de ellos, ya que por el clima se están enfermando constantemente. Por ello, ahora se está dedicando a cocinar el almuerzo y luego le llevarlo al campo a su esposo, y regresa de inmediato. En cambio su esposo trabaja desde las 7.00 a.m. hasta las 5.00 p.m. en sus cultivos de papa, han sembrado 3 hectáreas. Esta socia de un banco comunal de MFP, y está en su 7mo préstamo, ella se responsabiliza de los pagos puntuales. Con este dinero comprará 12 sacos de semilla de papa, fertilizante y abono, durante la siembra se abona para que coseche el producto sin gusanos
texts.en:
Mayela is 33 years old and currently lives with her partner who she will be marrying in one year. The fruit of this relationship has been 3 children. When she was single she worked on her parents small farm, but now she has small children who she cares for, particularly because due to the climate they are constantly getting sick. For that reason, she now dedicates herself to cooking lunch and then taking it into the fields to her husband after which she return immediately. In turn her husband works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. in their potato crop; they have planted 3 hectares. Mayela is part the MFP community bank, and is on her 7th loan, for which she takes the responsibility of making her payments on time. With this loan she will buy 12 sacks of potato seed, and fertilizer that they will use during the planting season so that their crop is free of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sr. Fanny tiene 46 años de edad, casada y habitante de barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua con dos hermosos hijas de 12 y 20 años de edad,  ambas estudiando, sus planes para sus familia es seguir apoyando a sus hijas para que culminen la universidad asegurándole un futuro mejor .Doña Fanny tiene un Cyber y alquiler de teléfono para llamadas locales e internacionales es un negocio donde los clientes vienen hacer muchas llamadas internacionales ya que su costo es bajo, con la solicitud del préstamo va invertir  en remodelaciones dentro y fuera del local. Para dar un mejor servicios Agracias a Afodenic lograra que su negocio este seguro y con una comodidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fanny is 46 years old, is married and lives in the Healeah neighborhood in the capital of Managua with two beautiful daughters who are 12 and 20 years old. Both are studying. Her plan for her family is to continue to support her daughters so that they may finish university, assuring them a better future. Fanny has an Internet cafe and rents telephones for local and international calls. It is a business where customers come to make a lot of international calls since the cost is low. With the request of a loan, she is going to invest in remodeling inside and outside her shop so that she can provide better services. Thanks to Afodenic, she will ensure that her business is safe and comfortable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to remodel her shop.

loans.name: Juana Tarcila

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal de San Juan,  es casada tiene 58 años, ella llega a estudiar en la universidad biología pero no termino por falta de dinero tuvo que dejar los estudios, tiene un hijo de 25 años estudiando arquitectura en la universidad  
Juana se dedica a la venta de comida criolla y arequipeña su pequeño restauran se llama “ Ña Juanita” nos cuenta que siempre le gustaba cocinar empezó cocinando por ayudar a la economía en su casa es así que ella descubrió su talento en la cocina  empezó cocinando en reuniones familiares  los domingos en su casa, cada domingo la familia venia con amigos es así como fue creciendo su clientela así estuvo por espacio de dos años, hasta que decidió abrir las puertas de su casa al publico hace dos años  atrás

Juana nos cuenta que el año pasado su negocio se quemo y ella casi pierde la vida y gracias a Dios pudo nuevamente abrir su restaurante de comida criolla y arequipeña    
Juana solicita un préstamo a Finca de 1000 en la compra de víveres para su restauran. Juana aprendió en Finca como administrar su negocio y su dinero, también aprendió estrategias para enfrentar a la competencia 
El sueño de Juana es terminar de construir su primer piso de su casa para ampliar su negocio y vivir en el segundo piso
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the San Juan community Bank. She is aged 58, married and started studying biology at university but she didn't finish due to a lack of funding which meant she had to leave her studies. She has a 25 year old son studying architecture at University. Juana sells regional food from Arequipa in her small restaurant called " Ña Juanita”. She tells us that she has always liked to cook and first began in order to help with the household expenses. This was how she discovered her talent in the kitchen. She began cooking for Sunday family gatherings in her house, as every Sunday the family would come with friends and in this way her customer-base grew for two years, until she decided to open the doors of her house to the public two years ago. Juana tells us that last year her business burnt down and she almost lost her life but thanks to God she was able to reopen her local food restaurant. Juana is asking for a loan of 1000 soles from Finca in order to buy provisions for her restaurant. Juana has learnt from Finca how to manage her business and her money and she has also learnt strategies for dealing with the competition. Juana's dream is to finish constructing the first floor of her house in order to expand her business and live on the second floor.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis G. is twenty-eight years old. She is single and independant. Mavis lives alone in a rented apartment in Bawalashie community near Accra. Most of the inhabitants of Bawjiase are either in farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Mavis is a trader and trades in foodstuffs. She sells items such as cassava, charcoal, maize, etc. in the local market of Bawalashie where she lives. Selling for the past six years, she has lots of experience in how to win customers. Mavis is an achiever and her focus is on saving enough to expand her stock. She wants to use the loan to buy  an increased stock of cassava, plantains, maize, etc. to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called ‘To God Be the Glory’ Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cassava, plantains, maize, etc.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio G. tiene 50 años de edad y está casado con la señora Luzmina González de 46 años, ellos son padres de 6 hijos.
El señor era agricultor y vivia en otra ciudad, hace 8 años vendió su terreno y compró una casa en Caaguazú en donde está viviendo actualmente, y monto su propia micro empresa, consistente en la venta de articulos de bazar y mercería para lo cual adquirio una camioneta todo terreno,con el cual realizaza su venta.
El dinero del prestamo será invertido para la compra de remeras, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos, por la temporada de verano. Más adelante quiere tener su propio local de ventas ya que cuenta con cliente formada.
Desea un pais en donde haya más justicia.
texts.en:
Rogelio G. is 50 years old. He is married with Luzmina González, 46, and they have six children. He is a farmer and was living in a different city. Eight years ago he sold his land and bought a house in Caaguazú where he is now living. He opened his own small business selling bazaar articles and merchandise for which he acquired a small all-terrain truck with which he makes his sales. The loan will be used to buy T-shirts as demand is high because it is Summer. In the future he wants to have his own store from which to sell as he has a good customer base. He wants a country where there is more justice.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy T-shirts

loans.name: Sara Elia

texts.es:
La señora Sara Elia tiene la concesión de una tienda de abarrotes, saben que con empeño, constancia y esfuerzo lograran todos sus objetivos, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el señor Andrés Cárdenas que labora como locutor de una conocida estación de radio.
Juntos como una familia unida y estable solicitan este crédito para la inversión de mercancía en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sara Elia has a grocery store franchise. They know that with hard work, perseverance, and effort they will achieve their goals. She relies on her husband, Andrés Cárdenas, for support. He is a radio announcer for a well-known station. They are applying for this loan together as a united and stable family. She will use it to invest in goods for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary S. is a Tanzanian micro-business entrepreneur, a married woman with two school-age children. She runs a beauty salon at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. Maximum sales are found within the weekend, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. She has been in the business for three years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost  the business.

loans.use: To boost the business

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: La Joven Martha Beatriz Pérez tiene la edad de 38 años, el estado civil casada. Martha tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Martha es la venta de mercadería en general y además posee un negocio de auto lavado. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que solo así puede ofrecer sus productos a diferentes clientes. Los propósitos de Martha son de invertir lo suficiente para su negocio. Es por eso que solicito este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de ropa, calzado, ropa interior y otros. El sueño de Martha es proporcionarle a su vivienda las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz Pérez is 38 years old and married. She has three children who attend school. Martha sells general merchandise for a living and also owns a own car wash. She has operated this business for more than 8 years, which is why she decided to go into selling clothes. Her business is does not have a fixed location, which allows her to travel and provide her products to a variety of customers. She intends to invest just enough in her business. She requests this loan for work capital and thus be able to buy clothes, shoes, underwear, etc. Her goal is to make improvements on her home in order to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: 20-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Xuân H. Thị is a 30 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Xuân is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 20-Quảng Hưng.

Xuân is married and has 1 school-aged child. To earn a living, Xuân owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Xuân has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Xuân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2442600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 3079800 VND which will be used to purchase additional baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Hồ Thị Dậu is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

2. N. Thị Luyến is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

3. N. Thị Hương is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. H. Thị Hoà is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Dunia Mayela

texts.es: La Señora Dunia M. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el barrio Reparto Carolina en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es electricista Automotriz  le ayuda económicamente tiene dos hijos. Siendo unos de los motivo por lo cual tiene planes de establecer una tienda surtida que le genere mayores utilidades.Doña Dunia tiene su venta de ropa y a la misma vez vende comida de encargo y para todo el público en general.Inicio vendiendo la comida en el trabajo de su esposo después presento prendas de vestir para dama, caballero y niños.Ahora tiene diferentes puntos de ventas, que le genera ganancia pequeña comparada a las que quiere adquirir.Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar mayores cantidades de productos como: zapatos, perfumes, cosméticos y emprenderse a vender electrodomésticos.

loans.use: Comprar perfumes, cosmeticos y zapatos

loans.name: Gaydullaev

texts.ru: Гайдуллаев Аловаддин проживает в городе Истаравшане. Занимается продажей различных  красок и стройматериалов для ремонта. Стаж работы в этой сфере деятельности 5 лет. У Аловадина магазин рядом с вещевом рынком, что позволяет ему иметь множество покупателей. Кроме этого Аловаддин вместе со своим отцом занимается евроремонтом домов и квартир. Кредит хочет получить для закупа различных красок и стройматериалов.
texts.en:
A. Gaydullaev lives in the town of Istaravshan. He sells different kinds of paints and building materials for home remodeling. He has five years of experience in this type of work. A.'s store is located next to the clothing market which lets him have many customers. Besides that A. together with his father make European style remodeling of homes and apartments. He wants to get a loan to buy different paints and building materials.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of paints and building materials

loans.name: Vilma Susana

texts.es: Vilma Susana R. D. R. resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas. Vilma trabaja en su propio microbus desD. hace 6 años transportando niños y niñas D. diferentes colegios y escuelas públicas del los alrededores. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual podrá comprar todos los repuestos necesarios para su vehiculo, ya que Vilma como mujer responsable desea brindarles un excelente servicio a sus clientes, en el cual puedan viajar D. una manera muy segura.
texts.en:
Vilma Susana R. D. R. lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband and two daughters. Vilma has been operating her own minibus service for 6 years, taking children to the different public and private schools in the area. She is requesting a loan with which she can purchase all the spare parts she needs for her vehicle. As a responsible woman, Vilma wants to offer great customer service so that her passengers can travel safely.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for vehicle

loans.name: Benkadi  1 De Toura Peulh Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 1  est un groupe  de femmes mariées du  quartier Peulh du village de Toura de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et au moins 8 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes  excelle principalement  dans  la culture d’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   BENKADI 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  le prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième   prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35000 à  25000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 1 is a group of married women of the Peulh neighborhood, in the Toura village of the city of SAN (Segou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) who live in large extended traditional families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc... They average 43 years of age and have at least 8 children. They mostly grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 1 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, 2 years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 1 group count on turning a profit of XOF 35000 to 25000 (ca US$ 75 to 55) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Irene es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Irene vive en el distrito de Chiara en donde tiene un pequeño restaurante, en donde también vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Además se dedica a la crianza de cuy.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y gaseosas.
Los sueños de Irene son ahorrar mas y tener una polleria en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Glorious cooperative bank. Irene is married, 34 years old, and has 2 children. Irene lives in the Chiara district, where she has a small restaurant in which she also sells groceries and beverages. She carries out these activities with her husband’s help. She also raises guinea pigs. Irene needs a loan of 2,100 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and sodas. Irene’s dreams are to save more and to have a poultry store in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar and sodas.

loans.name: Tanenkasu Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Aminat T. and Mummy T.. They named their group Tanenkasu. This will be the fourth loan they are receiving from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have been very helpful to these entrepreneurs. With previous loans, their businesses expanded, their profit margin increased and consequently, their standard of living also improve. They have repaid their last loan successfully and they now want a new loan. They are requesting a new loan of Le 1,500,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

Isatu K.(middle) is the leader of the group. Isatu was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone, fifty-five years ago. She is married with three children and two foster children. All of her children are now grown-ups, her foster children are still attending schools.  Isatu sells market food and has been a businesswoman since she was a child. With this loan, she will further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest her business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан Исоев проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Хасан более 18 лет работает бухгалтером в фирме. Вот более 4 лет вместе со своей семьей занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Hasan I. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. Hasan has been working as an accountant at a company for over 18 years. Together with his family, he has also been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years. He raises and sells livestock. Hasan is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Maritza Felicita

texts.es: Maritza Felicita M. tiene la edad de 56 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Maritza tiene 2 hijos que trabajan por cuenta propia. La actividad económica de Maritza es la venta de repuestos de automotrices. Doña Maritza es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 16 años que  se dedica a este negocio. Doña Maritza dio inicio su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos. Además ella realizaba la compra de una manera mucho más favorable para después ella realizar su venta, la mayoría de sus clientes son los carreteros.  El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de llantas, válvulas de aire, mangueras, retenedores entre otros. El deseo de Maritza es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza Felicita M. is 56 years old and married. She has two children who work on their own. Maritza sells automotive parts. Maritza is an enterprising and tenacious woman so she enjoys her job very much. She has been working in this business for 16 years. Maritza started her own small business with a desire to improve her standard of living since she needed to raise her children. Through intelligent economical choices in her initial purchases, Maritza was able to capitalize on her profits upon the resale of her products. The majority of her clients are drivers. The money will be used for capital to purchase items such as tires, air valves, hoses, retainers among others. Maritza’s wish is to provide her children with the necessary education so they may one day be competent professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. has one child. He has received junior high education.  John sells car pair parts such as engine, break paddle, gear box, fly wheel, rim and so on at castle near yamoransah, which he has been doing since 2005.  John uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. John will use the loan to purchase more oil filters for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to plough back into his business.

loans.use: John will use the loan to purchase more oil filters for sale.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 38 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a mobile photographer in the Kiambu district. Most of his customers are within the Kikuyu area. He has been in the business for about 10 years and gets a profit of about 20,000 Kenya shillings a month.

Fredrick is the founder of his group and wants to use this loan to buy a digital camera in order to meet the demand of his clients and upgrade to the current technology. He hopes to open a big photo studio in Nairobi town one day soon.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a digital camera for his photography business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna S. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Lorna is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn N., 40, is married and lives with her two young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who is able to make US$10 in revenue a day. She usually buys rice from growers and resells it to the market wholesaler. Her husband is a cow dealer and makes an average US$3 of profit per day. Vorn N. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase rice from growers to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Teresa Consuelo

texts.es:
Teresa A. es una socia activa y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 35 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien tiene un locutorio. 
Teresa se dedica a la fabricaciòn y venta de calzados por lo que cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa y paralelamente vende joyas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió del Movimiento de Manuela Ramos fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò hormas para zapatos.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en dos partes: una en materiales para la fabricaciòn de zapatos y otra en la compra de paquetes de minutos para su locutorio. La meta de Teresa es tener una tienda de abarrotes, vender al por menor y ampliar su taller de calzados.
texts.en:
Teresa A. is an active and hardworking member. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 35 years old, is the mother of two young children, and has the support of her husband who has a call center.

Teresa makes and sells shoes and has a small workshop in their house. She also sells jewelry. She has been part of the “Las Libertadoras” communal bank for the past year. The first loan that she received from the Movimiento de Manuela Ramos was for 300 PEN, which she used to purchase shoe lasts.

Currently, Teresa needs a loan of 1200 PEN, which she will use in two parts: one for shoemaking materials, and the other for purchasing packages of minutes for their call center. Teresa’s goal is to have a grocery store, to sell retail, and to expand her shoe workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoemaking materials and also packets of minutes for their call center

loans.name: Dayra Lorena

texts.es: El negocio de la señora Dayra es la venta de cosmético y otros productos. dicha actividad la señora Daría la realiza desde hace 3 años aproximadamente cuando ella empezó a vender fue por razón de que su salario como docente era muy bajo y a consecuencia de esto de sus bajas entradas ella toma la iniciativa de vender cosméticos  y  le ha ido bien desde que inicio su apertura. Ella solicita un financiamiento en la institución para poder trabajar  y lograr poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica y debida a que el comercio es mucho mayor y sus ganancias incrementaron muchísimo. Por lo que sueña con tener una mejor forma de vida.
texts.en:
Dayra's business is selling cosmetics and other products. She began her business about three years ago because her salary as a teacher was very little. So, she took the initiative and began selling cosmetics, and this has gone well for her.

She is requesting a loan to enable her to continue her business and obtain greater financial stability, as her business is growing and her income is greatly increasing. Her dream is to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nop

texts.en: Nop C., 56, and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $1 each day. They live with two of their children in Takeo province. Besides farming, her husband also sells natural medicine. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nop C. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa, tiene 38 años, vive en el Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , Departamento de San Martin , la socia  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” , presenta estudios de secundaria completa  y tiene 03 hijos , 01  que aun estudia y depende de ella .

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de Comidas Preparadas y lleva 05 años en el negocio, se encuentra ubicada en  su misma casa  un lugar muy amplio y acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que diariamente acuden. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró ingredientes para el preparado de sus comidas como, arroz en kilos, menestras, verduras, aceite y parte del dinero lo invirtió en utensilios.  

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.
