Con este crédito  de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosita como le dicen de cariño , se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante, su sueño es tener un restaurant  y implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is 38, and lives in the Juanjui District, in the Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martin Department. This member belongs to the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”. She finished secondary school and has 3 children, 1 who is still in school and is her dependent. Rosa has been working selling prepared food for 5 years. She sells from her house in a roomy and well-arranged area, where she can take care of the customers who come every day. She tells us that she has good daily sales, because her tasty food is well-known and very popular. With her first loan of 300 new soles, she bought ingredients to prepare her food, such as kilos of rice, vegetable stew, vegetables, and oil, and part of the money she spent on cooking utensils. She continues in the same business and is very happy with the way the work has turned out. She is the one who personally takes care of her customers, with the charisma and cheerfulness that characterize her. With this loan of 1,000.00 soles, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of her food, such as kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, quantities of chickens, vegetables, and also some utensils to help her better attend to her customers. Her affectionate nickname is Rosita. She is full of life and with a desire to get ahead. Her dream is to have a restaurant and start her own well-stocked grocery store. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping in starting her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her food: kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, quantities of chickens, vegetables and some cooking utensils

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del Banco Comunal de la ALDEA TIERRA COLORADA del municipio de Momostenango, del departamento de Totonicapán, están conformados por  MUJERES todas se conocen bien desde hace más de 10 años este grupo está conformado por once integrantes, las señoras que integran este grupos se dedican a varias actividades tales como;  venta de ropa, confección de mochilas, otras a la elaboración de canastas, venta de juguetes, manías, venta de canastas, venta de frutas y  otras dos se dedican a crianza de animales, todas ellas  decidieron formar un grupo para realizar contactos con vendedores mayoristas del lugar donde viven, el propósito es lograr obtener mejores ganancias sobre las ventas que realizan, al mismo  tiempo ayudar a sus familias ya que son de escasos recursos económicos, acudieron a la Asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo para incrementar el capital de negocio con la que cuenta cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank ALDEA TIERRA COLORADA in the municipality of Momostenango, in the department of Totonicapán are all women who have known each other for more than 10 years. There are 11 members in the group and they work in a variety of activities, including: selling clothes, making backpacks, basket-weaving, selling toys, selling baskets, selling fruits, and raising animals to sell. All of them decided to form this group to make contact with wholesalers in the area where they live. The goal is to increase their earnings on the sales they make and to help their families because they have such limited economic resources. They approached the ASDIR association for a loan in order to increase the business capital that each one of them relies on.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say Y. is an older village woman who lives with other family members. She lives in a rural area of the capital of Phnom Penh, where she cultivates a rice crop to make a living. She is married, and blessed with four children. Three are married and living away from home, and the other one is single. One of her daughters works as an employee of the garment industry. Also, Say Y. relies on additional main cash that is earned by her husband, who buys and sells animals. Say Y. would like to take out a loan of $900 for her husband to improve his animal sale business.

loans.use: To improve her husband's animal sale business.

loans.name: Dorcas Charo

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 28-year-old woman married to Ronald. She lives in Kibokoni-Malindi where she targets her customers from Malindi. She is a tailor and she has had a tailoring business for the last seven years. Dorcas, who also does some hairdressing on the side, earns a monthly profit of Kshs 17,800. 

Dorcas, who has her first loan, was introduced to Kadet by the group's secretary. She plans to spend the Kshs 10,000 to buy material (for making clothes) for her customers so that they don't have to source them from other places. She plans to utilize the extra income from this loan to build rentals on her plot and to provide piped water to her family.

A hardworking woman, Dorcas hopes to develop the rental houses on her plot fully with water and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase materials for tailoring

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Helen is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business buying seafood products like fish, squid and shrimp and peddling it in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 17,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu M. is 49 years old, widowed and has six children, three boys and three girls. One of her children is in college, two are in secondary school, and the remaining three are in primary school. She lives in the town of Waterloo, where she makes a living selling drinks in a type of local shop called a baffa. Musu has been a good client of LAPO Sierra Leone. She has taken out and repaid five previous loans, all of which she used to expand her shop and care for her children. She has applied for a new loan of 2,000,000 Leones to buy more drinks to sell, and to earn enough money to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy additional drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Orquideas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Orquídeas inicia su ciclo 43 con 18 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. Golosinas, comidas, abarrotes en general, panes, pasteles, cosméticos, verduras y fabricación D. ladrillos.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Asunción presidenta del Banco Comunal, Asunción es conviviente, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Asunción viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. ropa variada, actividad que realiza 3 veces a la semana, además reparte en los negocios. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. chompas, blusas. Los sueños D. Asunción son mejorar su negocio y que su hija culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 12,300 soles.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Orquídeas” (Orchids) is starting its 43rd loan cycle with 18 members. The members engage in different businesses selling candy, food, groceries, bread, cakes, cosmetics, vegetables, and bricks.

Such is the case with Sra. Asunción, the Communal Bank president. She is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Asunción travels to different fairs in the region to sell different types of clothing. She engages in this activity three times a week and devotes the rest of her time to other parts of her business. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of sweaters and blouses. Asunción dreams of improving her business and seeing her daughter finish her studies and become a professional.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 PEN, 450 PEN, to 600 PEN for a grand total of 12,300 PEN to the entire Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters & blouses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Victoria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan A. vive con sus tres hijos en una casa en alquiler que esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Juan A. es propietario de una movilidad con la cual trabaja en una línea de transporte de pasajeros; es así como obtiene sus ingresos y la esposa ayuda con labores casa.
El crédito solicitado es para hacer un mantenimiento general a su herramienta de trabajo.
Esta es la cuarta  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juan A. lives with his three children in a rented house located in La Paz’s Tembladerani neighborhood. He owns a vehicle with which he provides public transportation services. This is how he earns income; his wife helps out working as a domestic employee. The funds will be used for general service maintenance on his vehicle. This is his 4th loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted yielded a favorable rating so he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Zeinap

texts.en:
Zeinap L. is currently in the business of selling fried fish and bread in the evening in the street and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to fry and sell.  Zeinap is 21 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

n 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Tsetsegbal

texts.en:
Tsetsegbal B. is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of four children. She lives with her children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, on their own land. Her older son Batmunkh is an electrician. Her oldest two daughters, aged 16 and 17, attend university. Her younger daughter Battungalag is 13 years old and attends secondary school. 

Tsetsegbal currently operates a household products business at a local market called Asait in Ulaanbaatar. Since Tsetsegbal started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her daughters' education fees. 

Tsetsegbal is an open person who has very good communication skills. She says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good profession for my children."

Her business is very important to her. In June of 2010, she started to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction material to build the house.

loans.use: To purchase construction material to build a house

loans.name: Jesus Hector

texts.es: El señor Jesús Héctor cuenta con dos trabajos, uno es en una empresa donde trabaja todos los días y el otro trabajo es de fin de semana, el Señor Jesús Héctor lucha por darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.   El requiere de la impermeabilización de el techo de su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias intensas que han Caído en la cuidad se ah dañado considerablemente. El señor Jesús solo quiere lo mejor para su familia. Y agradece sinceramente el apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Héctor has two jobs: he works in a company during the week, and has another job for the weekend. Jesús Héctor struggles for his family to offer them better life conditions. The loan he is requesting will be used to waterproof the roof of his house, as the heavy rains that fell on the city have severely damaged it. Jesús only wants what is best for his family, and he is sincerely thankful for the offered support.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof the roof of his house.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis R. Z. labora para MATECSA en el área de mantenimiento, se entiende en la reparación y soldadura todo tipo de trabajo de soldadura en maquinarias etc., tiene un hijo es casado.
Considero que los préstamos que CEPRODEL  me ha otorgado me han servido para mejorar mi condición  de vida la de mi esposa y las de mi hijo. asegurar mi propiedad y así sentir mejor la seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
José Luis R. Z. works as a maintenance man for [a company called] MATECSA, where he repairs and welds all sorts of machinery. He has one married son. “I believe that the loans that I have gotten through CEPRODEL have helped me improve my quality of life, that of my wife, and my son. They have helped me to secure my property and made my family feel more secure.”

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
"Gina C. is a married woman who lives in Atis St., Poblacion, Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  Feeds and Rice Retailer and an Egg and Balut(fertilized duck eggs) supplier businesses. Her husband Joel, who is 41 years old, works as a retailer to earn his living.  They have 3 children who are between 4 to 14 years old. 

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,900 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing  24,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more addtional capital for stocks of rice and feeds to resell so that she could continue to save up for the future to have an additional business (a grocery). 

Gina C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital for businesses

loans.name: Fiailoa

texts.en:
Fiailoa F. is 61 and married with 10 children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Fiailoa has one year of experience in this business.  Fiailoa needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fiailoa joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fiailoa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
Nataly D. L. C. es una joven D. 25 años y es la propietaria del estadero llamado “Estadero DonD.  Nataly” vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores D. 3 y 6 años D. edad, en el barrio Pastrana del Municipio Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar.
Su negocio inició hace un año, cuando Nataly alquiló un local y puso a funcionar un estadero D. ambiente familiar, allí venD. toda clase D. refrescos y bebidas frías,eso si,  amenizada por la buena música del Caribe.  Nataly Inició su actividad emprendedora para apoyar los ingresos familiares, pues su esposo ofrece el servicio D. moto taxi en este municipio donD. es usual este tipo D. transporte. Este negocio ha tenido muy buena acogida y su clientela va en aumento, especialmente los fines D. semana,  días en los que salen las familias a divertirse y disfrutar D. la cercanía con el mar, además D. un ambiente agradable como el que se vive en el “Estadero DonD. Nataly”. Este es el primer crédito D. Nataly con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea comprar al por mayor bebidas y refrescos para evitar comprarle a los intermediarios, que le venden con sobrecostos; con su compra directa, se estaría ahorrando $105.000 COP mensuales por encima D. lo que paga cuando compra a los intermediarios, pues semanalmente adquiere 30 cajas D. bebidas y cada caja se encarece en $3.500 COP.y por esta razon no ve sus utilidades, pues no son representativas.
Su sueño más adelante es mejorar sus instalaciones locativas y brindar así un mejor servicio; su mayor desafío es la competencia, porque cuenta con locales mucho más cómodos,  pero Nataly. responD. a su debilidad con una excelente y personalizada atención, por eso tiene clientes fijos que la reconocen y que   prefieren pasarla muy feliz con su familia en su sencillo estadero
texts.en:
Nataly D. L. C. is just 25 years old and already owns a snack bar called “Estadero DonD. Nataly.” She lives with her spouse and two children, who are 3 and 6 years old, in the Pastrana neighborhood of Puerto Colombia, very near the ocean. She started the business a year ago when she acquired the locale and started a family-oriented snack bar. She sells all kinds of refreshments and cold beverages maD. more appetizing by good Caribbean music. Nataly started her entrepreneurial activity in order to contribute to family income because her husband works as a mototaxi driver in this municipality where this type of transportation is the norm. The business has been very well received and her customer base is growing, especially on weekends which is when families go out to have fun and enjoy being near the ocean. Besides, they enjoy a pleasant atmosphere at “Estadero DonD. Nataly.” This is Nataly’s first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use it to buy beverages and refreshments avoiding buying them from middlemen who sell them at higher prices. By buying direct, she will save $105,000 COP a month compared to what she spends when she buys from middlemen. She buys 30 cases of beverages per week and each case she buys from them has a $3,500 COP surcharge so she earns little or no profits from them that way. Her dream for the future is to improve the locale’s conditions thereby providing better service. Her greatest challenge is competition because there are similar locations that are more comfortable. However, Nataly’s answer to her shortcoming is to proviD. excellent, personalized customer service. This is why she has regular customers that recognize this quality of hers and prefer to spend a pleasant time with their families in her less flashy establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages at wholesale in order to avoid purchasing from middlemen who sell at higher prices.

loans.name: Wina Lyn

texts.en: Wina Lyn B. is from the village of Del Pilar, Baliangao. She is 22 years old and married with an infant child. To make a living, Wina Lyn grows assorted crops to sell. Wina Lyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Wina Lyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wina Lyn is requesting her first loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used for corn production. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For corn production

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace wants a loan to buy more local alcohol and beer for reselling in her bar. She is a 31-year-old married woman with four children living in Kyenjojo,Uganda in a semi-permanent house. She brews alcohol locally and sells beer. She dreams of brewing local alcohol on a large scale and expanding her bar with better standards.

loans.use: To buy both local alcohol and beer for reselling in her bar.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Traoré est âgée de 32 ans,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec son mari, ses enfants et autres ménages au quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait du poisson. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière,  depuis maintenant 10 ans elle évolue seule en menant  la même activité, au marché château et jouit d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise, qui est très prisée sur le marché « les capitaines de Niono »
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso,  elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 12 paniers de poissons frais auprès des pêcheurs. Madame Assitan Traoré vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Traoré is 32 years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband, children and other couples in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region).

She did not go to school for social reasons and thus went into business at an early age with her mother, who sold fish. After several years at her mother's side, she began developing the same activity by herself. She has been doing this for ten years now at the Chateau market and has a large customer base. Her sales strength is due to the quality of her goods, which are very popular at the "Capitaines de Niono" market. With a view to increasing her business in order to make more profit, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan, with which she is planning to buy twelve baskets of fresh fish from fishermen. Mrs. Traoré sells for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband to cover the family's expenses. Her ambition is to build a house for them to live in.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en: Prudencia S. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Prudencia is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Prudencia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Prudencia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Prudencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prudencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Prudencia is requesting a new loan of 41,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Prudencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria, es socia del Banco Comunal Obelisco, es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos. Maria se dedica la preparación y venta D. Chicharrones en el distrito D. Quinua. Aprendió D. este negocio D. sus vecinas, vio que preparaban y vendían bien, así que un buen día decidió abrir su puesto.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. chanchos y carne, para la preparación 
D. chicharrones.
A Maria le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, porque le dan créditos para trabajar  y aprenD. mucho en las capacitaciones. Su sueño es poder abrir un recreo y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
María is a member of the Obelisco (Obelisk) communal bank.  She is married, 50 years old and has five children.  She makes and sells chicharrones (fried pork) in Quinua district.  She learned this business from her neighbors.  She noticed what they maD. and that sales were good so one day she decided to open her own stand.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy pigs and pork to make the chicharrones.

María enjoys the communal bank meetings because they give her loans to work and she learns a lot during the training sessions.  Her dream is to open a café and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy pork.

loans.name: Katia Deyanina

texts.es:
Katia es una mujer muy dedicada a su hijo,  siendo madre soltera, posee su propio negocio una pulpería que con ayuda de su mama y con financiamiento en Afodenic, sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad de productos, lo que ha venido a incrementar su clientela.
A pesar de que no cuenta con ayuda del padre de su hijo, no ha sido un octaculo para lograr salir adelante, lo mejor es que sus padres la han apoyado, viviendo aun con ellos y creciendo con su negocio.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la inversión de productos de consumo en la compra de carne, pollo, productos lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos enlatados, ya que se vende más, y rota más su dinero. Siendo su objetivo aumentar sus ganancias para lograr satisfacer sus compromisos personales.
texts.en:
Katia is a single mother who is devoted to her son. She runs her own grocery store and with the help of her mother and financing from Afodenic, she has been able to offer a greater variety of products which has increased her sales and her clientele.

Even though Katia does not receive support from the father of her child, this has not stopped her from moving forward with her life. The best thing for her has been the support of her parents, who she still lives with, and the expansion of her business.

Katia will use this new loan to purchase meat, chicken, canned goods, sweets and dairy products, as the more sales she makes, the further her money goes. Her goal is to increase her income to meet her personal commitments.

loans.use: Purchase meat, chicken, canned goods, sweets and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finance a wedding party for his sons

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Doña Maribel es una mujer casada, tiene un hijo de 14 años que estudia la secundaria, doña Maribel vive en la comunidad de San Agustin Mextepec, municipio de San Felipe del Progreso Estado de México, el esposo de doña Maribel tambien trabajan y ambos hacen la lucha diario para mejorar su situación economica y poder seguir dandole la educación a su hijo, la casa en donde vive doña Maribel y su familia es prestada, porqué vive con su suegro el papá de su esposo pero se llevan muy bien y no se nota la diferencía.

En esa misma casa doña Maribel puso una tienda donde vende fruta y verdura, abarrotes, dulces y galletas, este negocio lo atiende entre semana, los fines de semana que son los sabados y domingos, sale a vender al tianguis que son dias de plaza en la terminal de San Felipe del progreso, en la terminal doña Mribel pone un puesto en donde vende calcetas para dama y calcetines para hombre, de diferentes texturas y colores, tambíen vende ropa interior para la mujer, doña Maribel nos comenta que son tiempos dificiles pero le hace la lucha a todo para sacar dinero y con la ayuda de su esposo que nos cuenta que es muy trabajador se siente con más apoyo y la llena de entusiasmo para salir adelante y no ver las cosas dificiles si no al contrario.

En el negocio que tiene en el tianguis nos comenta que hay dias en que se vende bien y otros no tanto, pero no se desanima puesto que dice que el negocio es así, lo pesado de salir a vender en el tianguis es poner y recoger el puesto, sale de su casa en San Agustin a las 5 de la mañana para estar en San Felipe a las cinco y media de la mañana y empezar a poner el puesto, a esa hora por lo regular ya estan los demas comerciantes, a mas tardar a las 7 de la mañana la gente ya esta comprando en el tianguis.


La meta de doña Maribel es no deber dinero y que la mercancía que compre sea propia, por ejemplo ahora solicito un prestamo pero lo tiene que pagar y por eso trabaja muy duro, y siente que la mercancia no es de ella, quiere ahorrar y con el tiempo tener un patrimonio y no deber dinero.


Con las ganancias aparte de querer ahorrar tambíen le sirve para ayudar a su esposo para la comida o el gasto de su hijo con la escuela.

El esposo de doña Maribel es muy trabajador y hace de todo, cria animales para vender, es albañil y tambien comerciante los fines de semana y doña Maribel se siente muy apoyada y cree en salir adelnate pronto con un esposo como el de ella.
texts.en:
Doña Maribel is married and has a 14-year-old son who is in high school.  She lives in San Agustin Mextepec in San Felipe del Progreso, Mexico.  Maribel's husband also works hard and both of them make every effort on a daily basis to improve their economic situation and to give their son the best education.  Maribel and her family live with her father-in-law and they all get along well.

Maribel has set up a grocery store at home where she sells fruit, vegetables, groceries, sweets and cookies.  She works at this business during the week.  And on the weekends she sets up a stall at the San Felipe del Progreso market where she sells women's stockings and men's socks in different textures and colors.  She also sells women's underwear.  Maribel says that these are difficult times but she does all she can to earn a living.  She says her husband works hard and gives her a lot of support and this makes her even more enthusiastic because otherwise things would be too difficult.

She says that sales from her stall have good days and bad, but she says business is like that.  The hardest part is setting up and taking down the stall.  She leaves the house in San Agustin at 5:00 a.m. in order to reach San Felipe by 5:30 a.m. and start setting up.  At 7:00 a.m.people start buying at the stall.

Doña Maribel's goal is not to owe money for the goods she buys.  She is requesting a loan now but is determined to pay it back with hard work. She wants to save and over time have her own money and not owe to anyone.

In addition to saving money she wants to use part of her earnings to help her husband with food and school expenses for her son.

Maribel's husband is a hard worker and does all kinds of jobs.  He raises animals for sale, works as a bricklayer and also sells on weekends.  Maribel feels very supported and believes she will be successful with a husband like hers.

loans.use: To buy stockings, socks, and underwear for men and women

loans.name: Mauda Yanery

texts.es:
La profesora Mauda Yanery de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de  2 hijos ambos estudian en la UNAN Managua;  labora como docente de primaria desde hace 17 años, apesar que son bien humilde ha luchado para que sus hijos sigan estudian para que lleguen a ser excelente profesionales y superar las dificultades economicas que se les presentan en el Camino de la vida.                                                                                    

Solicita nuevamente el apoyo de Kiva en su 8vo crèdito para areglar una habitaciòn y asi gozar de un lugar mas acogedor.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus dos hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios y trabajen para que sean hombre de bien para la sociedad y gozar de salud .
texts.en:
Teacher Mauda Yanery, 38, is a single mother of two children, both of whom are studying at the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua, Managua campus.  She has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for the last 17 years.  Despite being quite humble she has fought so that her children continue studying to become excellent professionals and be able to overcome the economic difficulties that might arise along their road of life.

She is once again asking for Kiva support in her 8th loan to fix up a room in order to enjoy a cozier home.

Her greatest dream in life is that her two children continue their university studies and work to become upstanding citizens and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To fix up a room.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 37 años es una esforzada madre soltera de 3 hijos; a los que cuida y educa con mucho esmero, pues son su razón de vivir. Juntos viven en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío de Huallquin. El trabajo al que se dedica está esforzada mujer es la “agricultura”. Desde que tenía 20 años, comenzó a producir la tierra sembrando papa, arveja y olluco, los que después de fertilizarlos, limpiarlos y cosecharlos, son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Pero durante los meses que están sembrados sus productos, ella se dedica a la venta de papa por kilos en las ferias que se realizan en el mercado modelo de Tarma, cada jueves y domingo. Las ganas de salir delante de está mujer son impresionantes, y ve en sus limitaciones la motivación de salir adelante para poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer renovado”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia muy querida, por su trabajo y responsabilidad. Gladys cosechará papa de la variedad “yungay”, por ello con el crédito comprará 6 sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá entre sus sembríos para su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Gladys, 37 years old, is a courageous single mother with three children, who she cares for and educates with great care - they are her reason for living. They all live together in her parents' house in the hamlet of Huallquin. This spirited woman works in agriculture. Twenty years ago she began to work the land sowing potatoes, peas and ullucos; after fertilizing them, washing them and harvesting them, they are then sold in the city's wholesale market.
Yet, during the months when her products have already been sown, she sells kilos of potatoes at the market fairs in Tarma every Thursday and Sunday. This woman's desire to make ends meet is impressive, and her ultimate motivation is to get by and make her children into professional people. She belongs to the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer Renovado", and this is her sixth loan with MFP, where she is a well liked member for her work and her sense of responsibility. Gladys will sow the "Yungay" variety of potato, for which she will use the loan to buy 6 sacks of organic fertilizer to scatter over her fields when they are sown for the next harvest.

loans.use: To purchase six sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Erlinda is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month in these activities.

In 2011, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, de 53 años; es una mujer luchadora. Enviudó hace 20 años, desde ahí tuvo que encargarse de sus 9 hijos. Ahora ella vive sola con su hijo Maicol, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Con el trabajo arduo que desarrolló por más de 20 años en la agricultura, le sirvió para brindar a sus hijos la educación necesaria para surgir en la vida. Ahora contenta menciona que invierte sus ganancias en los estudios superiores de su menor hijo Maicol. Sus principales sembríos constan de arvejas, habas y maíz, los cuales cuida constantemente; pues le agrada verlos crecer sin mayores dificultades. Además de alimentar constantemente a los 2 toros que posee, con los cuales realiza el arado de la tierra. Ahora ella planea trabajar cada día con más ahínco; pues está deseosa de ver culminado los estudios de su menor hijo. “Me sentiré más tranquila mirando a mi hijo con una profesión”, afirma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe en cada siembra. Maximiliana, tiene sembrado habas, por ello con el crédito comprará abono para esparcirlo entre sus cultivos de habas y arvejas, que cosechará en el próximo mes.
texts.en: Maximiliana is 53 years old and is a fighter. She widowed 20 years ago and since then she has had to take care of her nine children. She now lives alone with her son Maicol. They live in their own home which is located in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo. The hard work that she has developed in more than 20 years in agriculture has helped her give her children the necessary education to get ahead in life. She now happily mentions that she invests her earnings in her son Maicol's higher education. Her main crops consist of peas, lima beans and corn which she watches constantly because she likes to see them grow without any major difficulties. She also constantly has to feed the two bulls she owns which she uses to plow the land. She now plans to work harder every day because she is eager to see the culmination of her youngest son's studies. "I will feel more relaxed seeing my son with a profession," she says. She belongs to the community bank “Señor de Muruhuay”. This is her third loan with field partner MFP and she is thankful for the support that she receives every growing season. Maximiliana has planted lima beans and with the loan she will buy fertilizer to spread it among her crops of lima beans and peas which she will harvest next month.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Hever Anthonyn

texts.es:
Hever, es un joven de 25 años de edad, reside en Usulután, donde vive con sus padres, el es soltero y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, trabaja como panificador y vendedor de pan desde hace 5 años.
El solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su motocicleta y también para la compra de lámina para su vivienda, dicho préstamo la ayudara a Hever para mejorar las condiciones de su medio de transporte, también mejorar su vivienda.
El en el futuro, se imagina siendo dueño de una panadería, la cual él administre y de empleo a más personas.
texts.en:
Hever is a young man, 25 years old, who resides in Usulután, where he lives with his parents. He is single, and he works preparing and selling bread. He has worked as a bread baker and vendor for 5 years. 

He is requesting a loan in order to repair his small motorcycle, and also to buy sheeting for his home. This loan will help Hever improve the condition of his means of transportation and also improve his home. 

For the future, he can imagine himself as the owner of a bakery which he manages himself, giving jobs to more people.

loans.use: to repair his small motorcycle and also to buy sheeting to improve his home.

loans.name: Lucy  Fanny

texts.es:
Lucy es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Paredones que se ubica a 10 minutos del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside, conoce a la perfección este rubro por eso cuenta con clientela fidelizada, también visita la Cuidad de Chiclayo quincenalmente para ofrecerlos en los mercados. Adicionalmente ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio.

Lucy desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus aves y animales para incrementar su negocio, así también desea comprar abarrotes para su bodega. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 30 year old mother.  She is married and lives with her family in the Paradones settlement, 10 minutes from the Mórrope district.  This is an agricultural district located in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour from Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals and coral birds such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens behind her house.  When they reach a good stage in development, she sells them to merchants who visit the zone.  She is an expert in this field, so she has faithful customers.  She also goes to Chiclayo every two weeks to sell in the marketplace, and has a small store that she runs out of her home.

She would like to buy balanced feed for her birds and animals.  This will allow her to grow her business.  She also wants to buy groceries for her store, so she has seen fit to request a loan for 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
Gabina  56 años de edad, vive con su esposo en el balneario de Pimentel – Chiclayo, en una casa propia  de material noble (ladrillos) ubicada a la salida de la zona urbana del distrito.

Gabina  vende a los pobladores de Moshoqueque (distrito ubicado a media hora del balneario de Pimentel) unos deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos hechos con su rica sazón. Gabina cuenta con un puesto fijo en el mercado de Moshoqueque y es allí donde sus clientes se sientan gustosos a comer sus ricos potajes. Ella tiene más de 7 años trabajando en esto y ha ido comprando poco a poco sus cosas personales, tiene buenas referencias de vecinos de la zona y de parte de sus compañeros comerciantes en el mercado Moshoqueque.

Gabina solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para destinarlo a la compra de insumos para elaborar sus comidas y además realizar algunos gastos personales para su familia, como artefactos. 

Gabina es una cliente que ha ido creciendo económicamente  y esto le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida con el paso de los años. Para Gabina este representa su crédito número seis, todos los anteriores los ha cancelado con bastante puntualidad.
texts.en:
Gabina, 56, lives with her husband in the Pimentel-Chiclayo sea resort in a house of her own made of substantial materials (bricks) located at the exit to the urban part of the district.

Gabina sells delicious breakfasts and lunches prepared with her unique touch to residents of Moshoqueque (a district located half an hour from the sea resort of Pimentel).  Gabina has a fixed stand in Moshoqueque’s market and this is where her customers happily sit to enjoy her delicious preparations.  She’s been working in this for over 7 years and it has allowed her to little by little buy her personal items.  She has good references from neighbors in the area and from her fellow merchants in the Moshoqueque market.

Gabina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to buy ingredients for her meals as well as for some personal, family expenses like appliances.

Gabina is a client that has been growing economically and this has allowed her to improve her quality of life over the years.  For Gabina, this represents loan number 6.  She repaid all the previous ones with quite a bit of punctuality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Gloria del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 55 años. Ella tiene una pulpería la cual inicio hace siete años vendiendo fresco y comida, con sus ganancias y los préstamo fue surtiendo su venta primero compró  golosinas, chiverías, gaseosa, luego invirtió en granos básicos actualmente vende hasta accesorios de celular. 
Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería para seguir surtiendo su pulpería. Esta clienta inicio con Adim en crédito grupal en el Grupo Ciudadanos del Reino y ahora inicia su crédito individual.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria del Carmen, aged 55, is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She owns a small grocery store, which she opened seven years ago and where she sells refreshments and food. In the beginning she used her earnings and loans to buy candy, milk products and soda; later she invested in staple grains. Currently, she also sells accessories to cell phones.

She will use her loan to buy goods to stock up her store. Gloria del Carmen became a client of the microfinance institution ADIM as a member of the Group "Ciudadanos del Reino" (Citizens of the Kingdom). This is her first individual loan.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store with staple grains and accessories to cell phones.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, está casada y tiene 6 hijos mayores D. edad e independientes.
Lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años, tiempo que lleva su negocio, ella tiene una pequeña bodega en el cual trabaja junto a su esposo.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará:  1 caja D. leche, 1 caja D. aceite, 1 bolsa D. fideo, 2 tiras D. nescafe, 1 caja D. té, 1 bolsa D. sal, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 saco D. arroz, 2 racimos D. plátano, 1 ciento D. limones.
Su esposo es jubilado y para acompañar a su esposa la ayuda en su negocio.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos  por todos estos años que viene otorgando los préstamos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is married and has six adult children who live independently.

Rosa has been working with Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Throughout the time she has been in business, she has managed a small store with her husband.

With her new loan of 2000 PEN, Rosa will buy one case of milk, one case of oil, one bag of noodles, two packs of Nescafe coffee, one case of tea, one bag of salt, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, two bunches of bananas, and one hundred lemons.

Her husband is retired and helps her with managing the business. Thanks to the loans Manuela Ramos has provided over the years, Rosa has been able to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells biscuits, noodles, detergents & bread. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy bread, canned goods & beverages. In the picture are Marlyn and her younger son.

Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Sharrif

texts.en:
Sharrif is aged 42 years, married with four children, and he lives in rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a family house and educate his children.

Sharrif has been a dealer in electrical appliances and also repiars them,he has been in this business for fifteen years and business is now at its boom stage, however  he has a challenge of bad debtors and his dream is to own at least a garage and  diversify into motorcycle business. Sharrif needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Las fuertes lluvias que se han presentado en Colombia se han convertido en un gran obstáculo para Hernando, un emprendedor de 57 años de edad que ha vivido toda su vida en el campo y ha aprendido a sacarle provecho a la tierra, pues en el espació que le cedió su jefe cultiva moras y lulos para obtener ingresos adicionales que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus tres hijos, pues aunque es separado es consciente de la obligación que tiene con su familia. 

Hernando necesita de un préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y así poder fumigar su cultivo para mejorar la producción y ofrecer productos de buena calidad y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The heavy rains that have fallen in Colombia have become a great obstacle for Hernando, a 57-year-old entrepreneur who has lived his entire life in the countryside and has learned how to live off the land because on land his boss passed on to him he grows blackberries and ‘lulos’ (a high altitude subtropical fruit common to the Andean regions of Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru also known as ‘naranjillo’) in order to earn extra income that will make it possible for him to improve his quality of life and provide a better future for his three children because, although he’s separated, he is conscious of the obligation he has toward his family.

Hernando needs a loan to buy seeds and manure and to be able to fumigate the crops to improve production and offer good quality products and thus to obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and to fumigate.

loans.name: Redilla

texts.en:
Redilla is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children. She and her husband are both farmers. They live in Banga, South Cotabato, where their farm is also located. Rice is the main crop that they grow on their land. Redilla works hard to improve their business.

Redilla requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a successful business. She also hopes for her family to have a peaceful life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary Junia

texts.en:
Mary Junia is 46 years old and lives in a rural area of Ilagan with her four grown-up children. She describes herself as being cheerful, cooperative, and likes to be friendly.

For three years, she has been making charcoal and selling it in the town market. She is doing very well with her business.

Mary Junia asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 and plans on using the loan to buy more wood and other raw materials needed to make charcoal. This loan will help her make more sales and allow her to have a better quality of life with her kids. Her desire is to watch her children grow healthy and watch her business grow.

loans.use: to buy wood and fuel for making charcoal

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía, de 22 años, es una joven muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos Rivao de 05 y Carlos de 01 año de edad, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Rosalía abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida de productos de primera necesidad tales como arroz, leche, variedad de cereales y menestras ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos más consumidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su entorno vecinal, lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el lapso del día. Rosalía solicita el crédito para poder comprar  lo nesario para su bodega. Para el bien de sus ingresos económicos,espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos  programados. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más sacos de arroz, azúcar conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en: Rosalía is 22 years old. She is friendly and hardworking young woman. She lives in her own home with her two beloved children, Rivao, 5 and Carlos, 1. They are the main reason she works so hard. Early every morning, Rosalía opens her store to serve her neighbors. She is a very deft saleswoman and knows how to treat her customers and she always convinces them to buy something more. Her store is very well stocked with basic necessity products such as rice, milk, some cereals and vegetable stews. She always takes care to buy the products that are the most popular. What she likes the most about her job is talking to customers and finding out about things that are happening n the neighborhood. She has been doing this activity for 3 years and she thinks the hardest thing is being on her feet all day long. Rosalía is asking for the loan to be able to buy what she needs for her store. For the good of her income, she wants to expand the fixtures in her store to be able to sell more products. This is her second loan with MFP and she feels very happy to know she will have financial support. This way, she will feel sure that she can buy what she she has ordered and she is willing to make the payments on time. With the two thousand nuevos soles she has asked for, she will buy more sacks of rice, sugar, preserves and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, preserves and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more merchandise to supply her store.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is 28 years old and earns a living by farming and raising pigs. She earns about $2 per day while her husband works in construction and earns about $4 a day. They have one child, who is 10 years old and attends school. Every month, she spends about $30 on food, $6 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use when traveling to work. Minh used to work in a factory, but had to change occupations when she had a child and needed to stay closer to home. In the future, she would like to enlarge her herd of pigs and build an enclosure for them to live in.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 7 children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (sister-in- law). She sells charcoal at her home counter at the shop that she rents. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the past 10 years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and ever-increasing prices of charcoal. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her retail charcoal business into a wholesale one. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is married with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Georgette is 52 years old and has 5 children who are in school.

Georgette has a room rental business in the Philippines. Georgette requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the upkeep of the rental rooms.

Georgette has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Georgette would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for  the upkeep of the rental rooms.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из Павлограда. Она занимается торговлей на центральном рынке своего города, реализует постельное белье и покрывала. За счет бизнеса Ирина имеет возможность содержать всю свою семью, помогать детям и постепенно развивать бизнес все дальше. 

Ирина планирует вложить заемные средства в размере 10 000 гривен в закупку разнообразного постельного белья, теплых одеял и пледов для последующей реализации в своем киоске. Имея богатый опыт торговли этим товаром, Ирина понимает, что скоро начнутся праздники и именно поэтому она хочет поменять товар и пополнить свои запасы. Со временем Ирина планирует открыть вторую торговую точку и тем самым расширить свой бизнес. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Irina is from Pavlograd.  She is involved in sales at her town's central market and sells bedding and bed covers.  This business allows Irina to support her family, help her children and gradually develop the business further.  Irina plans to invest the 10,000 hryvnia loan into a purchase of bedding, warm blankets and flannel covers for subsequent sale at her kiosk.  Having a rich experience in sales of these products, Irina understands that due to approaching holidays, she needs to update her merchandise and refill her inventories.  With time, Irina plans to open a second retail outlet and thus, expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bedding, warm blankets and flannel covers for subsequent sale at her kiosk

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah is a 57-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife. Unfortunately, he did not have kids, but this was not a reason for him to become dispirited. Despite his older age, he works hard to support his wife. Salah has 41 years of experience working as a hairdresser and opened his own beauty salon in 1975. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to redesign the interior of his shop. In the future, he plans to hire a full-time employee to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to redesign the interior of his shop

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessperson who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing for her family.

Evaline has operated as a water vendor for the past three years; her potential clients are the local area's residents. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of starting a vegetable grocery.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase stocks of vegetables like tomatoes and onions to start a new vegetable grocery. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of vegetables like tomatoes and onions to start a new vegetable grocery.

loans.name: Santos Erodita

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo, dos hijos y una nieta.

Ella junto con su familia tiene más de dos años de trabajar en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y fríjol, de esa forma ella brinda el estudio a sus hijos.

La señora Santos solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una camionada de arena y 20 bolsas de cemento, para cementar el piso de su casa ya que en invierno se moja por que es de tierra. Con esto ella, obtendrá los materiales que necesita para mejorar su vivienda y sus nietas podrán jugar con seguridad en su casa. Santos desea continuar trabajando en la agricultura, para ayudar a su nieta que esta en la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Santos, aged 53, lives with her husband, two children and a granddaughter. She has been working for more than two years with her family in agriculture, growing corn and beans. This way her children can study.

Santos came to the microfinance institution Fundación Campo and applied for a loan to buy a truckload of sand and 20 sacks of cement to get a concrete floor in her house, because today it is made of compressed earth and in winter humidity creeps into the house. She will buy the required materials to improve her home and her granddaughters will be able to play safely in it. Santos wants to continue working in agriculture to help her granddaughter who is studying at the university.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of sand and 20 sacks of cement to get a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosemarie has a beauty shop that provides hair cuts, manicure and pedicure. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy the materials needed for the beauty salon.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed for the beauty salon

loans.name: Kosso-Lou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KOSSO-LOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Céline Abèkè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Céline Abèkè est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Céline Abèkè a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Céline Abèkè est mariée à un certain Walilou. Le couple a quattre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Céline Abèkè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Céline Abèkè vend  des bijoux de façon ambulante. Céline Abèkè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Céline Abèkè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KOSSO-LOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Kosso-Lou group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, in order to elevate the level of their business. 

The representative of the group, by the name of Céline Abèkè, is the one who has her hand raised on the photo. Céline Abèkè is 33 years old and lives in Bénin. Céline Abèkè stopped school at the primary level. Céline Abèkè is married to a certain Walilou. The couple has four dependent children who all go to school. Céline Abèkè lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together. 

In order to take care of the diverse family responsibilities, Céline Abèkè sells jewelry as a street vendor. Céline Abèkè gets her supplies in a market of Bénin and in Nigeria. In seeking to satisfy her clientèle and to grow her turnover and her income, Céline Abèkè is requesting a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Kosso-Lou group.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past three years.

Lolita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is from Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Nina is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Nina runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products used in the local community. Nina has been in her business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nina is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Nina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela is married with 4 children. She started with a small business making ice cake and selling the local school before she joined SPBD. She still needed capital to increase her supply of ice cake daily because of the high demand for her product. She joined SPBD program in 2005. Ela has not only been able to supply her services to the community but she has also managed to open a grocery store for her family and their village people.

She is now on her 4th loan of $600 which she’s used to buy more stock for her store and do an extension on her house. She can sell more to satisfy her customer savings than coming all the way in to town to shop for their needs. Her family has more space and room in their house for relaxing and doing leisure activities. Ela is making a clear profit of $50 weekly other all expenses.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for ice cake

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana S. lives in Agsu city and owns a small store where she sells food and household products. She is a 56-year-old widow with four children. With this loan she wants to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Qudsia

texts.en: Qudsia is 24 years old and living in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married. She has five children. She took her third loan to expand her business. She spent that money on the land where she grows food to buy some items that help her family. She wants to make her life better than it is now. She wants their children to be in school to study and to be a success in the future. Now she is very happy with her business.

loans.use: Buying Materials

loans.name: Miraga

texts.en: A. Miraga is 44 years old, is married and has a big family of 5 members. He is the owner of a small food and textile shop in Imishli. He began his business in 1996 when he first opened a food market, and then a textile section in his shop. He now wants to borrow 1200 USD to purchase a refrigerator system to keep food cool.

loans.use: Going to purchase a refrigerator for food

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina Y. T. is 21 and along with the rest of her women's group, weaves huipiles, the traditional women's blouse of highland Guatemala. She can weave and then embroider four of them in a 15-day period, and then she sells them in the market in Chimaltenango for about US$70 each. This will be her second loan with Friendship Bridge, and she says that having the capital lets her make just a little progress on the economic front, making just a little more profit, since she doesn't have to struggle so to save up to purchase the yarn.

Paulina's group, the "Flor de Pascua", or "Easter Flower" group, takes their loan commitment very seriously. They receive their loans as a group and are jointly accountable for them. They're very proud of their repayment record.

Paulina, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face. Paulina's theory is that they are lacking some type of vitamins, but she is not sure what it might be.

Here is a video of the women of Paulina's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
I have been selling clothes and shoes for over 15 years. This business is my family's only source of income and it employs myself and my son. We sell our products in specified locations in Nuevo Laredo city. We are requesting a loan in the amount of US$500.00 that will be used to purchase merchandise for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya más de 15 años vendiendo ropa, y calzado. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos ni hijo y yo, vendemos en ciertos lugares de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $ 500.00 Dlls. Para la compra de mercancía de temperada de frió.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Belarmino

texts.pt:
Belarmino is not officially married, but he lives with a woman who has 8 children. He joined the loan program in 2006. This loan that he will take is the fourth. He wants to use this money to purchase more basic goods to stock his store. Belarmino's children are studying except for the 3 youngest, who are not yet old enough to go to school. Since he has many children, he plans to apply his business earnings to fix up his residence, since as the children grow, they will need more space. Belarmino's wife is not employed, and takes care of the home and works in the family field.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Belarmino nao esta casado oficialmente mas vive maritalmente com uma mulher com quem tem 8 filhos. Ele entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Este emprestimo que ele vai tomar e o quarto. Ele quer usar este dinheiro para comprar mais produtos de primeira necessidade para rechear a sua tenda. Os filhos de Belarmino estao a estudar exceptuando os 3 mais novos que ainda nao tem idade para ir a escola. Por ter muitos filhos ele pensa aplicar os rendimentos do negocio na reabilitacao da sua residencia uma vez que os miudos estao crescendo certamente que precisarao de mais espaco para se acomodarem. A mulher de Belarmino nao esta empregada, cuida dos afazeres domesticos e trabalha na machamba familiar.

loans.use: Belarmino wants to use the money to purchase more products for his store.

loans.name: Mohammad Salim

texts.en: Mohammad Salim lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he lives with his own family. He has a clothing shop. He is a hard-working and energetic man. For more than 5 years, he has operated a store in Kabul where he sells men’s and women’s clothing. During this time, he attracted a lot of clients. Now he wants to expand his business, so he requested an individual loan to buy new designs of clothes to make a good income and help his family. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To buy new designs of clothes

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús H. E. started selling shoes and clothing in the municipal market of Chinandega 7 years ago. She started her business when her husband was retired because of his older age. Because of her spouse's retirement, their income shrunk and they were unable to pay for all of the house expenses. She does not own the place where her store is located, and the place lacks a roof, so when it rains her products get wet and she is often exposed to the sun.

Because of this problem Mrs. H. approached CEPRODEL 4 years ago to benefit from the credits. She advises us she has prospered with these loans as she has diversified the sale of clothing offering more brands and styles. Her next step is to invest in the construction of a small shop of her own in the municipal market.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Teresa de Jesús H. E. desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos en el mercado municipal de Chinandega. Inicia su negocio a raíz de que a su esposo por ser mayor de edad lo jubilan y por tal razón sus ingresos serian menos y no cubrían con los gastos de su hogar. A pesar de que el local donde vende no es propio, en momentos de lluvia sus productos se mojan y además expone su piel al sol por el mismo hecho de no tener techo.

Por este problema es que la señora H. acude a CEPRODEL desde hace cuatro años para ser beneficiada con créditos y según cuenta ha sido prosperada en su negocio por lo que ha diversificado su venta de ropa ofreciendo mas marcas y estilos. Su próximo paso es invertir en la construcción de un local propio en el mercado municipal.

loans.use: Purchasing of merchandise for the business / Compra de mercadería para el negocio

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Назиров Акбар житель района Файзабад.Возраст 45 лет. Женат имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается откормкой и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков на рынке , откармливает около 40-45 дней. За это время бычки подрастают .Затем клиент продает их на тех же рынках по выгодной ему цене.  И так каждые 50 дней.Основными покупателями клиента являются мясники , которые скупают бычков на мясо, что позволяет обеспечить население свежим и полноценным мясом. Опыт работы в этой сфере у клиента около 5 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить свой оборот , путем покупки нового бычка.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Dobrinka

texts.en: Dobrinka was born in 1975 and is the single mother of two children. She supports herself and her family by farming, and earns an income of about 900 KM a month. She has applied for her first loan, which she will use to buy a cow and seeds for her greenhouse.

loans.use: To buy a cow and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat Y., 56, is widow with three children; two sons and one daughter. All of her children are married. Two live outside the family home and the youngest one lives with her. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sinat has sold silk products since 1997. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village and the nearby province for resale in other provinces. Before stating this business she wove silk at home.

Mrs. Sinat is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase silk products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk products for resale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a working mom. She runs a business selling women’s clothing at the Dneprovskyi market in Kherson, Ukraine. Tatyana started her own business 5 years ago.
