She is disciplined, accurate and thoughtful in planning and managing her business and is a businesswoman who can handle any challenge with natural enthusiasm and determination.

Tatyana has benefited from the lending services provided by HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine and has established a reputation for honesty as she has worked with our organization. She has requested a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase some new clothing items to sell. This loan will provide further assistance to Tatyana as she seeks to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing items to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a hard working, single mother of humble origin. She has raised her family and the children who are still under her care by selling hardware at the 16 D. Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Es una persona muy trabajadora, madre sola, D. clase muy humilD. saca adelante a su familia, y los hijos que tiene aun a su cargo, vendiendo articulos D. ferreteria en la feria 16 D. julio los jueves y domingo,

loans.use: Purchase hardware

loans.name: Natanamwaki

texts.en:
Natanamwaki is 48 years old, married, and has made a living selling vegetables for the last two years. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

In the past, Natanamwaki took out two loans from BRAC Tanzania and used both to successfully expand her business. Now she has applied for a new loan to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a small entrepreneur from Uzhgorod where she sells women's clothing items in one of the local markets. Nina used to work as a hired employee in a company. However, she couldn't support herself after her retirement and had to find another source of income. This is how she started her own vending venture. Today her business has grown a lot. It has been characterized by affordable prices and consistent expansion within the past 5 years. Nina is constantly working on further business expansion.

Nina is hoping to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase her stock of assorted merchandise and her sales as a result. On the individual level she is hoping to do some repair work in her house which has been a need for her family for awhile. Nina is a very skilled entrepreneur. She can easily adjust to all seasonal trends which helps her meet clients' demands and satisfy different customers' tastes.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Mwanakhamis

texts.en:
Mwanakhamis is a widow with three children aged between 39 and 26 years old. She has been a charcoal and coconuts seller since 1999. Every day she works from 7.30am to 3.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwanakhamis is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal and coconuts in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts  for re-sale.

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en: Sanja was born in 1974 and she lives in Doboj, a small city in northeast Bosnia. She has one child and a husband who works outside of Bosnia, building homes. Sanja is interested in fashion. She designs, tailors, and sells her own clothing. Her customer base is currently her relatives and friends, but she has started to fill orders from third parties.  To help her business grow, Sanja requests a 1,200KM ($850 USD) loan from Women for Women International with which she will buy materials for tailoring new clothing from her new designs.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Yola Yobani

texts.es:
La señora Yola Yobani tiene 25 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 1069 en Río Seco, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de T., departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió 2 años de educación superior en el Instituto Pedagógico Oxford, pero se casó a los 18 años y tiene dos hijos quienes son niños y requieren mucha atención.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de gaseosa en el restaurante de su hermana, el cual se ubica en Río Seco en la calle Cóndor Canqui 899.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300, cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comida rápida  que vendía diariamente en las noches.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en gaseosa, cerveza y otros.
Yola sueña con tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Yola Yobani is 25 years old, belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Decisiones" and lives on 1069 Astopilco street in Rio Seco, in the district El Porvenir, in the province of T., in the state La Libertad, Peru. She studied for 2 years of superior school in the Oxford Pedagogical Institute, but married when she was 18 years old and has two sons that require a great deal of attention. Her business consists of selling sodas in her sister's restaurant, that is located in Rio Seco, on 899 Condor Canqui street. Yola invested her first loan of 300 soles ($100 that she repaid in 4 installments), in buying fast food that she sells daily, at night. With this loan of 500 soles ($175), that will be repaid in 4 installments, she will invest in sodas, beer, etc. Yola dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sodas, beer, etc.

loans.name: Fanesa

texts.en:
"For richer and for poorer, our family will stay together." Fanesa always told herself this although they have always been poor.

Fanesa is 33 years old and married to Samuel, a farmer in the village. They are blessed with a 10-year-old son named John who is already a grade IV student. The family lives in a place where people are united and very cooperative.

Fanesa's goal to improve her family's life gives her the strength to be more diligent in life. She and her husband are working together in cultivating their farm, but they lack the money to sustain their farming needs, so she would like to request a loan of PHP10,000 (USD$225). This will be a great help to her family not only in maintaining their farm but also in sustaining their immediate needs.

Fanesa hopes to have an increased income during her next harvest so she can start to save for the education of their son and for the repair of their house. She believes that everything is possible if we commit everything to God. She prays for the success of her business and to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional capital to support her farm.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
Luisa es casada, tiene  62 años y cuatro hijos  D. 30, 29, 23, y 20 años, 3 hijos están casados y el menor va a empezar a estudiar. Ella tiene un restaurante que se llama “Cusqueña” desD. hace dos años, trabaja con dos D. sus nueras, venD. todos los días almuerzos y por las noches venD. salchipapas, pollo brosther, sándwich,  venD. en un local cerca D. su casa.
DesD. que esta en Finca se ha superado porque antes solo vendía salchipapas y ahora ya tiene un restaurante.

Luisa solicita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes, gaseosas, platos descartables, va arreglar su ambiente D. trabajo.
Luisa sueña con hacer crecer en su negocio, poder arreglarlo y también poder arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the communal bank Teresa D. Calcuta. Luisa is 62 years old,is married and has four children ages 30, 29, 23 and 20 years. Three of her children are married and the youngest is starting school. She has had a restaurant called "Cusqueña" for two years where she works with two of her sisters-in-law. She sells breakfast everyday and in the evenings sells "salchipapas", chicken and sandwiches at a stall near her home. Since joining FINCA her business has improved. Previously she only sold salchipapas and now she has a restaurant. Luisa is asking for a loan in the amount of $650 which she will invest in purchasing groceries, soft drinks, disposable plates and in improving the restaurant's atmosphere. Luisa's dreams are to expand her business, improve her business and to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing groceries, soft drinks, disposable plates and improving her restaurant's atmosphere.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La Empresaria de nombre María Mercedes S. Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña María tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y tiene la edad de 6 años y cursa el 3 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como guarda de seguridad, sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio para que sus clientes se encuentren  satisfechos  sus sueños son de construir su casa para que dejarle un lugar donde vivir a su hijos ya que para el es muy importante que todos convivan juntos como familia ya que el le enseño mucho valores para que sean hombres y mujeres de bien para que sirvan a la sociedad sus deseos son de mejorar su nivel de vida para su familia ya que con su negocio solo logra obtener estabilidad para el pago de ciertas deudas en sus deseos esta el viajar al extranjero ya que así podría trabajar para enviarles a sus hijo lo necesario.

Su actividad económica es una pulpería en la que ofrece productos como: granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y pan, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 6 años, Doña María inicia su negocio porque poseía unos fondos propios y vio la oportunidad de establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación ya que el lugar donde esta ubicado su casa de habitación es en un nuevo reparto por lo que decidió comenzar con pocos productos como: gaseosas, golosinas y leña por lo que sus clientes eran pocos ya que el lugar no estaba poblado de muchos habitantes y así con lo poco que vendía logro incrementar su inventario que le serviría hasta el día de hoy  ya que por medio de esta fuente de ingresos es que ha obtenido lo necesario para la manutención de su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo consignado para la compra de mas productos para su pulpería y satisfacer rápidamente la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Businesswoman María Mercedes S. Gutiérrez is 34 years old and married. María has 3 children of whom only one son is her care: he is aged 6 and in the third grade in primary school. Her partner works as a security guard. Their aim is to expand her business so that Maria's customers are satisfied and their dreams are to construct a house in order to leave a place to live to their children as it's very important to her husband that they all live together as a family. Her husband has already taught the children many important lessons on how to be good men and women serving society. Their wish is to improve their family's quality of life, as they have only managed so far with their business to secure stability through the payment of certain debts. A further desire is to travel abroad as there she would be able to work and send back money to her sons to cover all the necessary expenses. Maria's economic activity is to run a grocery store in which she offers good such as: basic grains, sweets, natural juices and bread. Her business is located in her home, and she has run her business for 6 years. María began her business because she possessed some of her own funds and saw the opportunity to start-up a business in her house. As the place where her house is located was a new delivery point, she decided to start with a few products such as soft drinks, sweets and fire wood. As a result she had few customers as the area wasn't very populated but with the little she sold she was able to increase her stock which would serve right up to the present day when as a result of this source of income she has been able to obtain all that's necessary for the maintenance of her family. The loan is for wok capital designated for the purchase of more products for her grocery in order that she can quickly satisfy customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mohamad has been working as a car mechanic for eight years. He also sells used and new spare parts. Mohamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his garage. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because he has a good reputation and has experience in his domain. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. In the future, he plans to purchase the garage.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann E. is already 42 years old, happily married to Donato E., a "tricycle" transport operator; they are blessed with 12 children. Two of them are already married while the remaining 10 are still young. They are Ronald-18, Regielyn – 17, Bernadeth – 15, Jessa – Ann - 13, Reynald – 11, Angelica – 9, Fernalyn - 8, Reah-Mae – 6, Raymond - 4 and their youngest is Princess - 2 years old. They live in a rural area of Minante 2 Cauayan city. They are just tenants; the lot where their house is located is not their own. She is thankful to their landlord for supporting her family. They live simply and they believe that “a family that prays together stays together”.

Mary Ann plans to borrow money for her business expansion amounting to PHP 5,000. It will be used in the repair of their motorcycle which they use in their business. According to her, some of the amount will also be used as starting capital in a poultry business because she plans to raise broilers so she can help her husband to generate more income for their family.

Mary Ann worked as a flower gardener before, however, they were not able to sustain this business, but now she realizes its importance and really regrets its loss. She hopes that someday they will be able to surpass the hardships in life that they are experiencing. She will always find a way to send all her children to school for she believes that it is the only treasure that she can give to them.

loans.use: motorcycle repair and business capital

loans.name: Mujeres Con Proposito Group

texts.en:
Yesenia N. M. is a bank coordinator for the bank of Mujeres con Propositos. She is 33 years old and lives with her 36-year-old husband. They have three children: 12, 8 and 6 years old. Fifteen women from the bank are now looking for their second loan.

Yesenia has a business selling candy to students at a school in her neighborhood. The school has about 120 students and she visits it twice per day. Before her first loan she had sales of about 500 pesos per month, but after receiving a loan from Esperanza, her sales have increased to over 2000 pesos per month. With a new loan, she hopes to increase her business even more.

Yesenia is herself a student. She has been studying at a university in the evenings for the past four years to become a teacher. She will finish her education in a year and will be able to work as a teacher then. She wants to continue selling candy, but hopes it will be possible for her to have her own colmado (small shop) one day.

In her spare time Yesenia likes to read and mentioned Juan Bosch as her favorite author. She hopes that she will be able to help her children so that they too will have an opportunity to study at the university.

On behalf of Yesenia N. M., Mujeres con Propositos, and all of us here at Esperanza International: thank you for your support!

loans.use: buy more supplies to sell in business

loans.name: Melesio

texts.es: Melesio tiene 56 años, es padre soltero, reciente su esposa lo abandonó y le dejó con sus dos menores hijos. Él tiene un bote motor donde, junto a su cuñado, se dedican a la pesca en el río Ucayali, y venden sus pescados en el puerto, a los revendedores, o a veces tienen pedidos de una empresa que requiere mayores cantidades para procesarlos. En esta actividad ya lleva 30 años y le va muy bien; adicionalmente, Melesio trabaja también en la tala de árboles madereros, y con ambas actividades reúne el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y ha notado que trabajar con su banco comunal es muy provechoso, porque entre todos los integrantes se apoyan mutuamente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la pesca.
texts.en:
Melesio, 56, is a single father. His wife recently abandoned him, and she left him with their two youngest children. He has a motor boat. Together with his brother-in-law he fishes in the Ucayali River. They sell their fish at the port, to resellers, or sometimes they have business orders that need large quantities to fill. He has been doing this for 30 years, and he does well. Melesio also works cutting down wood-yielding trees. Through both activities he is able to get together enough money to sustain his family. This is his first loan with MFP. He has observed that working with his community bank is beneficial because all of the members support each other. The loan is to buy fishing materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fishing materials

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
In this picture, the one with a great big smile is Mrs. Gemma O., 43 years of age, who is married to Ernesto O. (right) and a resident of P4 Bañadero, Ozamiz City. The couple runs a restaurant business. They are blessed with twin daughters who are currently studying at public school.

The couple decided to engage in the eatery business a period of years ago because they were living near a college in the area. They also accept boarders and cater events to earn an additional income. Other income comes from their corn garden and vegetable garden in their little farmland. Through these endeavors, the couple has been able to purchase personal properties, like a motorcycle and appliances for the home.

As an active member in good standing of Paglaum, Gemma enjoys the benefits of savings and insurance, and she has been able to receive many loans. Now she is applying for P20,000.00 as additional capital for her eatery business. She is hoping that she and her husband can give their children a better education, as well as to become a successful entrepreneur herself.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital for her eatery business.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn T. (pictured) is 27 years old and her husband is 34. They are good parents who are very responsible to their three children, all of whom attend school.

This humble couple currently earns their income by catching fish, which they then sell. They get up while the sky is still dark to go to fishing on Tunle Sap Lake, where the fish are plentiful.

Currently, the family can't catch as many fish as they could previously because their fishing tools often break. Thus, Rorn T. is applying for a loan to be used to buy additional fishing tools for their fishing ventures.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida H. is fifty years old. She is married with five children; currently three of her children are in school. She works very hard with the passion of providing brighter future opportunities for her children.

Vida is a petty trader who has been selling yams for twenty years now. She buys tubers of yams from Komkomba market in Accra and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more tubers of yam and sell them little by little to avoid price hikes from the current food crisis in the country.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La señora Aydee, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Juleñita”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil soltera, sin hijos y tiene estudios Universitarios (Físico matemático), vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru  Jr. Ilave 716.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, gelatinas, golosinas y manjares, etc. al por mayor para llevar al Cuzco 

Su deseo es crear una empresa grande tipo mini market.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Aydee belongs to the “La Juleñita” Communal Bank, which is located in the Juli district of the Chucuito province in the Puno area. She is 30 years old and single, does not have any children and has had a college education (Mathematical physics). She lives in the Tupac Amaru Jr. neighborhood at no. 716. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years, with an initial loan of 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy groceries. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles for the wholesale purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, gelatin, candy and manjar (sweet filling made of condensed milk) to take to Cuzco. Her wish is to create a large business in the mini market style. She likes discussing savings and punctuality at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, gelatin and candy

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 55 years old, married, and has four children, three sons and one daughter, all of whom are still in school. She and her husband work very hard to support their family, which lives in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Felicia makes a living selling undergarments for women in her community and in nearby towns. She buys her goods in the capital, Accra. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more goods in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells sarongs and also sells meats in the market. This is one trade she has be able to combine for the past 10 years. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting for the loan of N80000 to purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora A. is from the village of San Juan Quezon, Isabela. She manages selling generic medicines in their village. She went to this type of business because she knows it is of big help to her and to others in need for immediate medication of common illnesses. She wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional business capital for her business improvement.  

Aurora A. is already 49 years old, as a resident in their rural area, she wants to have a good health thus maintaining her selling of cheaper medicines. She knew that it is very difficult living in rural areas because far from clinic or hospitals. That reason pushes her to start her business too. She is proudly saying that her business is not just for her but it is also for the goodness of community people in their Barangay.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed A. is married and has two children. He has been through senior high education.  Mohammed sells and repairs television set, electronic parts and so on at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2004. His wife is a trader.  Mohammed uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Mohammed will use the loan to purchase more television set for sale and spare parts for electrical appliances to enhance his repair works. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mohammed plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Mohammed will use the loan to purchase more television set and spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
A married father of four, Mr. Zaher was born in 1979 in Palestine. His wife is a housewife, so he alone is responsible for the family expenses.

Zaher has a small restaurant and he would like a loan of $3000 to invest in tables, chairs and utensils. With this money he will be able to expand his business, earn more profit and in turn help his children complete their school studies and continue studying at the university.

Contribute to the growth of his business and he will be grateful.

loans.use: Invest in tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: God Power Group

texts.en:
Kuku W. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Power. She is 32 years old, married with children aged two and eight, but they are not schooling due to a lack of financial support. Kuku is a second grade drop-out due to poverty, and she started fending for herself through business. She and her family live on the V.P Road, a community that has both middle class and poor Liberians, south of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Kuku has been retailing fresh chickens for 5 years; having established a good relationship with her customers, in order to encourage them to continue buying from her she often extends credit when they face shortages while buying her goods. She needs this loan to purchase more fresh chicken to improve her business, and she dreams of educating her children and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh chicken to improve her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima B. is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Fatima owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) retail shop. While not her only means for generating revenue, the shop is her main source of income. Fatima has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fatima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Fatima from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital for a neighborhood variety store.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila es una socia dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali Ella tiene 60 años, es viuda y madre de tres hijas mayores de edad quienes la apoyan.
Lila se dedica al alquiler de motocar y a la venta de gaseosas. Forma parte de el Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace dos años donde se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que comprò abarrotes para vender al por menor.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles que utilizará para dar la cuota inicial de un motocar. La meta de Lila es tener una bodega bien surtida y hacerla conocida.
texts.en:
Lila is a dynamic and hard-working member. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is a 60 year old widow. She has three grown daughters who help her. Lila rents out a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), and she sells soft drinks. She has been part of the Las Rosas Communal Bank for two years. In the bank she is known for her punctuality. With the first loan she received for 300 PEN she bought groceries for retail sales. She currently needs a loan for 900 PEN to make the initial payment on a motocarro. Lila’s goal is to have a well stocked convenience store and to make it well known.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make first payment on a motocarro

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Amada P.   domiciliada en el Barrio Fátima de C.D.E. Ella ya formo parte del comité de Mujeres emprendedoras, decidió contactar con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “San Cayetano”  están  iniciando el Primer Ciclo   con 15  integrantes , es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras,  ellas tienen distintas actividades  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor.
Las Señoras Retiran un crédito de gs 300.000 gs para la compra de mercaderías para la posterior venta.>p>
1
Teodora Martínez
 Venta de Empanadas.

texts.en:
This group was started by Señora Amada P., who lives in the Barrio Fátima neighborhood of Ciudad Del Este. She already was a part of a group of women business owners, but she decided to contact her friends and neighbors to form a group in her region. The group known as "San Cayetano" is beginning its first business cycle with 15 members. It is a group of very responsible and hardworking women. They have different activities, and others are taking on new jobs. The women are taking out a loan of $1025 to buy merchandise for later sale. 1 Teodora Martínez Sells empanadas 2 Liz Vázquez Sells vegetables 3 Nancy P. Sells cleaning products 4 Olga Fernández Sells food 5 Teodora C. Sells eggs and chicken 6 Ladislaa O. Sells plastic wares 7 Ramona S. Sells vegetables 8 Erenia B. Sells vegetables 9 Vicenta S. Sells fruits and vegetables 10 Porfiria M. Sells fruits and vegetables 11 María Clara S. Sells clothing 12 Amada P. Sells food 13 María Fermina S. Sells fruit 14 Cecilia González Sells food 15 Jorgelina González Sells drinks

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple goods: Rice, flour, sugar, meat, pasta, milk, eggs, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Barv

texts.en: Barv T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She makes and sells banana cakes at the local market to earn a living. She makes about US $5 profit every day. Her husband is a cow dealer. He eventually earns US $6 a day. This couple has four children, two of whom are in school. Barv T. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 for her husband to purchase cows to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cows to resell.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 31 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa. Guillermina se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos y para hacer muchas cosas más. La socia se dedica a la venta de comida en el paradero final de los carros de la empresa de transportes “Tupac Amaru”. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Guillermina nos cuenta que requiere el préstamo para la matricula del colegio de sus hijos  y para comprar más insumos como arroz, verduras y carnes.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La socia en la foto esta cargando a su hija Ruth de 6 meses de nacida.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. She belongs to the “Las Hijas de Maria” Communal Bank, of the Arariwa Association. Guillermina gets up very early to do her household chores, including preparing breakfast for the children, and many other things. She sells meals at the final bus stop of the Tupac Amaru transport enterprise. She has dedicated herself to this business for 2 years, and things have gone well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Guillermina needs a loan to pay her children's school fees, and to buy more business supplies, such as rice, vegetables and meat. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, also, she promises to meet the corresponding payment schedule. In the picture, she is carrying her 6-month-old daughter Ruth.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING HER CHILDREN'S SCHOOL FEES AND BUYING RICE, VEGETABLES, AND MEAT FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
La señora MARIA MAXIMINA tiene 76 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DECIDIDAS. La socia es analfabeta y tiene 7 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y panca de choclos en la puerta de su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles empezó a vender gaseosas y cervezas.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará alfalfa y pancas de choclo al por mayor, los mismoas que venderá a sus vecinos y también a los establos.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y asi mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 76 year old and lives in the Del Provenir district in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the “Mujeres Decididas” (Women of Decision) communal bank. She is illiterate and has seven adult children. She sells alfalfa and corn stalks from her home. Her first loan of 300 PEN allowed her to begin selling soft drinks and beer. She will use the money from this loan of 800 PEN ($300) primarily to buy alfalfa and corn stalks to sell to her neighbors and to the stables. She hopes to increase her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alfalfa and corn stalks

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia C., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Salvador C., a foreman/contractor, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Olivia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.

Now, with your help, Olivia would like to apply for a 12,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy groceries needed to replenish stock in her product inventory.

Olivia dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She wants them to be comfortably well off.

loans.use: To buy groceries to replenish stock

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M. is from the town of Balibago 1st, Tarlac. She is 47 years old. Marilyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: José Wilder

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Ciudad de Dios del distrito de San José, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno desde hace cuatro años, el cría vacas para extraerles la leche y venderla a un acopiador que a su vez provee de este producto a la principal empresa de productos lácteos del país. Adicionalmente siembra pastos para alimentar a sus animales. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que sostiene a su familia, por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar a su negocio adelante.

José desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de forraje de tal manera que tenga una buena producción y sus animales tengan el alimernto que necesitan para producir leche de calidad. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes.

José es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es poder instalar un establo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José, 31, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Ciudad de Dios neighborhood of San José, Lambayeque province, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised cattle for the last four years; he raises dairy cows for milk production which he sells to the area milk consolidator who, in turn, delivers the milk to the country’s main dairy products producer. In addition, he farms fodder to serve as animal feed for his herds. This business is his family’s only source of income so he always gives the best of himself to insure that his business progresses. José wants to provide his crops with proper care so that his crop yields will be good and his animals will have the food they need to produce high quality milk. This is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy fertilizers. José is a responsible and hard-working father. His greatest wish is to set up a stable. He has collaborated previously with our institution and has repaid his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his fodder crops.

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en: Nyamjav is 23 years old and lives with his parents and three siblings in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rented yard. His mother works at a local hospital. His father operates a game business at a local market. Two of his siblings are university students. One of his siblings is a secondary school student. Presently, Nyamjav operates a taxi service business with a Korean car, which he owns. He transports his customers to and from many different areas. Nyamjav has been operating his business since 2009, after leaving his job as a guard. Nyamjav is a very hardworking and optimistic person. He has many plans for the future and says, “I would like to keep operating my taxi business and, with my earnings, I would like to purchase my own plot of land with a house and yard.” He is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug (~  930 USD) loan to repair his car and to purchase tires, paint and an engine for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Durabank Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Durabank”, actualmente se encuentra en el X ciclo y está conformado por 16 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa sede Cusco.       

Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo a las ventas de joyería, venta de colocaciones de vidrio templado, venta de aves de corral, etc. y otros socios brindan servicios que están ligados al transportes terrestre como por ejemplo atención al cliente, lavado de buses, administración de agencia de viajes terrestres, auxiliar contable,  mecánico automotriz, llamadas de celulares, limpieza del hogar y lavado de ropa. 

Belén tiene 42 años y su principal actividad económica se dedica a la venta de boletos turísticos. Hace 14 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender cosméticos. 

Ya son 3 años que Belén participa en el banco comunal y le ha va muy bien gracias a su puntualidad y responsabilidad. Belén requiere el crédito para comprar más cosméticos. 
 	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

(Los socios Walter, Mariela y Gabina aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía, ellos se fueron rápido el día del desembolso y se les tomo la foto en otra reunión).
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Durabank” is currently in its tenth loan cycle and consists of 16 hardworking and enterprising members who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and provide a better future for their children. The members meet every thirty days at the offices of the microfinance division of Asociación Arariwa, which has its headquarters in Cusco. Some of the members’ business activities include selling jewelry, tempered glass, poultry, and other items. Other members provide services directly related to the land transportation industry that include attending customers, washing buses, making travel arrangements, accounting, automotive repair, mobile phone service, housekeeping, and laundry. Belén is 42 years old and earns a living selling tour tickets. She has been in this business for 14 years and has done very well. Belén also has a side business selling cosmetics. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for three years and has performed well due to her punctuality and responsibility. Belén needs a loan to buy more cosmetics. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, historical center, and landscapes, making it one of the most charming cities in southern Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa R., 39 years old, is from the village of Canituan , Cagayan de Oro City. She is married and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living Jesusa manufactures and sells hollow blocks in the local community. Jesusa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Jesusa joined HSPFI in 2008 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI which she invested in her business. Jesusa is requesting her 6th loan, for 20000 PHP, which she will again invest in her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 39 años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijos, Ineas de 9 y Yefer de 7 años de edad. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Hace 19 años, Víctor no tenía capital para invertir en un negocio, pero gracias a la ayuda de su familia pudo establecerse en la cultivo de cacao. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones para que le faciliten la extracción de su producto. En la actualidad ya tiene segmentado su mercado, es por ello que la producción de éste fruto le esta generando buenos ingresos económicos. Pero él es consciente que le falta mucho por crecer, es por ello que tiene un plan ambicioso, para que pueda cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, que es comprar terrenos para cultivar otros productos que tengan mucha demanda. Sus productos son vendidos a los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente conforme por el buen trabajo de su grupo comunal. Con el dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en comprar terrenos con el propósito de cultivar cacao, para que así pueda abastecer a sus compradores potenciales.
texts.en:
Victor, 39, is single and has 2 children: Ineas, who is 9, and Yefer, who is 7 years old. They live together in the community of Manitea Alta, located in the beautiful Cuzqueñan rainforest, where they have their own house made of wood. Nineteen years ago Victor did not have capital to invest in a business, but thanks to the help of his family he was able to establish himself in the cultivation of cocoa. At times he receives help from his family, but at harvest time he hires and supervises workers who help him with the harvest of his product. Now he has found a niche in the market, and for this reason the production of this fruit is generating a good income for him. But he is aware that there is much that he lacks to be able to grow. For this reason, he has an ambitious plan, so that he will be able to meet the needs of his customers. His plan is to buy land to cultivate other products that are in high demand. His products are sold at a collection center in his own community. This is his 4th loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments according the payment schedule. In addition, he feels good about the work with his communal group. With the money he requests he will buy land with the objective of cultivating cocoa, so that he can supply his potential buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lands to cultivate cocoa

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: Madame Mareme D. est une ancienne sociétaire  de la caisse de Ouakam ou elle est membre depuis 8 ans. Elle est  veuve et parent bénéficiaire  qui évolue  dans le commerce et la vente de produits de mer depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité  pour avoir des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (besoins de subsistance quotidienne). Elle sollicite un crédit  de 25 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de produits de mer destine  à augmenter son stock pour mieux préparer l’hivernage.
texts.en:
Ms. Mareme D. is a former associate at the Ouakam branch office, where she has been a member for eight years. She is a widow and a recipient parent whose business has involved selling seafood products for over ten years. Mareme chose this business to have the revenues enabling her to provide for her family (basic daily needs). She is requesting a loan of 25,000 francs meant for buying seafood products for increasing her inventory, so as to prepare for winter.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering funds

loans.name: Ulongoni Group

texts.en:
Esther L., age 38, is married with four children, ages 19, 17, 12 and 8 years. She has a tailoring business where she sews tablecloths and bedsheets as well as selling small snacks.  She works daily from 7am until 6pm and she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $192.

This will be Esther’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a big roll of material for her business and has paid back the loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to open a shop and start selling fabrics and sarongs. 

Esther will share this loan with her loan group, Ulongoni, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other responsible in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Esther is second from the left in an orange dress.

loans.use: To open a shop and start selling fabrics and sarongs.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma C. is from the village of Manukan. She is 62 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Guillerma owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Guillerma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Guillerma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Guillerma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. sells yogurt and other ice creams at Takoradi. Emma has received senior high education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver.

Emma has been selling yogurt for some time now. She responsibly helps her husband in providing the basic needs of her child. Her loan will be used to buy more yogurt and other ice creams for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more yogurt and other ice creams for sale

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn M. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 27 years old. Rubelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rubelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rubelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

Rubelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rubelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rubelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Janice Romana

texts.en:
Janice Romana T. lives in the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For more than three years, she has made a living by buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She makes about 4,300 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Janice Romana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy more products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yadira Cecilia

texts.es: Yadira 	T. es una mujer de 69 años,  de estado civil  casada y con  5 hijos en las edades de 31 a 43 años. Ella ciudad de Cartagena ella tiene un negocio de vender mercancías variadas desde su vivienda, el cual inició comprando artículos plásticos económicos para amas de casa,  que  repartía entre sus amistades, familiares y vecinos,  y que le dieron su primera utilidad. En la medida en que fue creciendo su negocio  fue añadiéndole cosméticos y medicinas y compró su primera vitrina. En la actualidad  su negocio permanece surtido y exhibe mucho de sus productos. Este es su quinto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, durante 4 años de estar vinculada a esta organización;  con los anteriores ha logrado fortalecer su negocio e incursionar en otras líneas de productos  y mejorar su infraestructura, pues desde que compró vitrinas mantiene mayor control y mucho orden en sus  mercancías. Con su credikiva comprará cosméticos, sombrillas, colonias y medicinas que no requieren prescripción médica, con esta inversión logrará nuevas utilidades y  la oportunidad de seguir creciendo, porque  su sueño es tener un almacén en donde toda la familia tenga la opción de emplearse y de ser muy productivos.
texts.en:
Yadira T. is a 69 year old woman.  She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 31 and 43 years old.  She lives in Cartagena and sells different kinds of merchandise out of her home.  She stared by buying inexpensive plastic items for housewives that she would sell to her friends, family and neighbors and this is how she made her first profit.  Her business grew to such an extent that she added cosmetics and medicines and bought her first showcase.  Currently, her business is stocked and displays many of her products.  

This is her fifth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo during her 4 years of association with this organization.  The previous loans have enable her to strengthen her business, venture into other lines of products and to improve its infrastructure.  Also, since she bought her showcase she has been able to maintain more control and organization of her merchandise.  

With her Kiva  loan she will buy cosmetics, umbrellas, cologne and over-the-counter medicines.  This will help to increase her profits and give her business the opportunity to continue growing because her dream is to have a store where everyone in the family has the option of working and of being very productive.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, umbrellas, colognes and over-the-counter medicines

loans.name: Deysi Mavel

texts.es: Deysi Mavel C. de 57 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, junto a su esposo quien trabaja como taxista y junto a tres hijos. Deysi posee un comedor, en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales los comercializa con las personas del lugar. Debido a que cuenta con una ubicación muy buena, por el hecho que esta rodeada de escuelas y fábricas, posee muchos clientes quienes a diario asisten a su negocio a consumir sus platillos. Deysi solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar verduras, arroz, frijoles y maíz, carne, pollo y otros productos más, los cuales son muy necesarios para la elaboración de comida. Para ella es de mucha importancia poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que la ayuda que le brinda a su esposo es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Deysi Mavel C., aged 57, lives in the municipality of Soyapango with her husband, a taxi driver, and their three children. Deysi owns a restaurant where she serves breakfast and lunch to local people. Because of the excellent location—her restaurant is surrounded by schools and factories—she has many customers who come every day to her restaurant and have a meal.

Deysi applies for a loan to buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, meat, chicken and other ingredients, which she needs to prepare her dishes. As far as she is concerned, it is very important to improve the working conditions of her business, because the assistance she gives to her husband is most useful for providing for the household.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, one of whom is in school.    Farida has a business selling sugar cane. She has been in this business for six years and she works 7 days out of every week. Farida sells her products in a market at retail. Farida has requested a loan of 500,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugar cane. The main business challenge(s) for Farida include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration for her business are to start growing sugar cane herself. Farida lives in a home that she rents without electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and food

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugar canes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D., from the city of Gala Ozamiz, is 45 years old, married, and has 10 grown children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan in the amount of 10000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo de 40 años, era comerciante ambulante de queso y maní pero como no tenía mucha rentabilidad en esta actividad económica decidió retirarse y comenzar una que pueda trabajar conjunto a su esposa (aparece en la foto). 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio esta actualmente trabajando con ayuda de su esposa en un puesto de comida que los dos pusieron para poder mantener a sus tres hijos de 19, 15 y 17 años. Vende comida desde las 05h00am hasta las 13h00pm en un puesto. Una de las complicaciones de vender comida en la calle es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde tiene el negocio de comidas. 

Marcelo ya tiene 20 años casado con su esposa por eso quiere seguir trabajando junto con ella en un negocio mutuo por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, sillas, mesas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local para su negocio de comidas y seguir con ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 40 years old and he once was a merchant who sold cheese and potatoes but since his sales were not very good he decided to stop. He wanted a business that he and his wife could work together (she is in the photograph).

They live in an urban region called Suburbio. He works together with his wife running a food stall that they both own. They support their three children, aged 19, 15, and 17. He sells from 5am to 1pm from their stall. One of the challenges their business faces is the crime that their district suffers.

Marcelo has been married for 20 years with his wife and he wants to keep working with her on their business. He wants to purchase rice, chairs, and tables for their business. In the future he wants to have a restaurant and to keep earning the income enough to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and rice.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly P. (who we see here in the photo) is 53 years old and has been married to her 52-year-old husband, Mr. Soeurng Sam, since 1979. They have eight children -- five sons and three daughters. Four are married and live on their own; of the other four, two have full-time jobs and the other two attend school. The family lives in a village approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital. 

Ly and her husband are rice farmers, and Mr. Soeurng Sam supplements the family income by selling cows and other farm animals. He buys his animals from districts located far from his home and sells them to middlemen who come to his house to buy them. She is applying for her first loan, for $1,000, to allow her husband to buy more livestock to resell.

loans.use: To expand her husband's livestock-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Andrea Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí conocimos a Andrea, tiene 20 años de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres en la cual viven cinco personas más. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace dos  ciclos, es la tesorera del Banco  y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha podido ayudar para sacar su negocio adelante, el mismo que le sirvió para sus estudios ya que además es egresada en la universidad, ahora espera realizar la tesis y obtener el título de tecnóloga en computación.

Es una jovencita luchadora que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cinco días a la semana unas cuatro horas por dia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, nos cuenta que lo mas vende son los perfumes y las cremas,  lleva  dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a esto pudo seguir con sus estudios.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Sus sueños son obtener su titulo y un trabajo en su especialidad.
texts.en:
The Virgin of Guadalupe communal bank gets together every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. This location is known for its traditional culture as well as for being a few minutes from two of the province's best beaches--San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Andrea, who is 20 years old. She lives in her parents' house along with 5 other people. She has been with the communal bank since it started two cycles ago. She is the treasurer of the bank. She likes it because with the loans she has been able to help her business move forward. They have also helped her with her studies, since she works hard in the university. Now she wants to write her thesis and obtain her degree in computer technology.

She is a hardworking young person who, in order to obtain her own resources, sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and lady's accessories). She works five days a week for four hours each day. She leaves her products on loan and collects them each week or every two weeks to get what her customers want. She receives her products at her house. She tells us that she sells the perfumes and creams the most. She has been doing this activity for two years, and thanks to that she was able to continue with her studies.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other products. Her dreams are to obtain her degree and a job in her major.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Cruce Jaén ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Guillermo se dedica a brindar servicio de mantenimiento de vehículos en un local ubicado cerca a su domicilio, donde ofrece su servicio de enllante, limpieza, entre otros a todos los vecinos y comerciantes que visitan la zona. El ya tiene siete años dedicándose a esta actividad contando con clientela fidelizada y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea realizar comprar herramientas que utiliza para la reparación de los vehículos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Guillermo es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus amigos, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 41 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the rural Cruce Jaen settlement, located in the Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area that also has quite a bit of commercial activity.  It is part of the Lambayeque province, located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Guillermo has a business providing auto maintenance and repair services in a place that is located close to his home.  There he offers his customers tire services, vehicle cleaning, and other services.  His customers are neighbors and tradesmen who visit his area.  He has already spent 7 years in this line of work, and so has a regular customer base.  Thanks to this business he is able to pay for his family's expenses.

He wants to buy tools for repairing vehicles.  To do this he is requesting, for the first time, a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.

Guillermo is held in high esteem by his friends; they consider him to be a responsible person who has a strong desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy tools for his business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim is a married woman, and she and her husband have one child. She works as a seamstress in a garment factory. In addition, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She sells some of the rice she grows for a profit, and keeps the remaining portion of the rice to feed their family.

Her husband, Mr. Sorn, is a fish breeder. Because her husband’s business has been doing so well, she would like to help him expand the business. Therefore, Mrs. Lim is asking for a loan to be able to dig more ponds for breeding fish.

loans.use: To expand fish breeding operations

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos Arturo  y su esposa tienen un taller de confecciones hace 30 años y aunque fabrican todo tipo de prendas de vestir su especialidad es la linea femenina,  porque allì esta concentrado su mayor mercado. Entre èl y su esposa han distribuìdo el trabajo, mientras Carlos Arturo se encarga de las compras de materias primas e insumos, de la definicion de los precios de venta y la negociación de sus productos en el mercado, su esposa esta dedicada totalmente a la producciòn, arte que aprendiò por  tradicion familiar y con la cual se ha identificado esta pareja, concentrando sus utilidades en lograr que sus tres hijos, que ahora estan en las edades de 35 a 40 años, sean profesionales. Su meta mas adelante es contratar una operaria para aumentar la producciòn, la venta y las utilidades , pues la competencia es fuerte especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con la ropa importada y ellos deben dedicar mas tiempo a aumentar sus posibilidades productivas, aunque en el momento  la afrontan produciendo uno a uno y respondiendo a cada cliente de acuerdo con sus condiciones personales y a la personalidad que desea proyectar. Con su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo,  lograrà comprar  telas botones accesorios en mayor cantidad, porque esta preparando nuevos diseños que ya tiene encargados por sus buenos clientes y con ello garantiza  su éxito en las ventas
texts.en:
Carlos Arturo and his wife have owned a dressmaking workshop for 30 years.  Although they make all kinds of clothes, their speciality is women's clothes because that is their biggest market.  Carlos Arturo and his wife share the work between them.  While he is in charge of buying raw materials and supplies, setting sales prices and negotiating their products in the market, his wife works exclusively on the production side of things.

Carlos' wife learned her art by family tradition and the couple have become identified with it.  They used the profits that they made in their business to ensure that their children, who are now between the ages of 35 and 40, became professionals.  Their future goal is to hire a worker to increase their production, sales and profits as competition is strong, especially as regards imported clothes.  As a result, they must spend more time increasing their production possibilities.  However, right now they face their competition by producing their products one by one and responding to each customer in accordance with their personal situation and the personality that they want to project.

This Kiva loan is Carlos' first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy fabric, buttons and accessories in larger quantities because they are preparing new designs and already have orders for them from their good customers.  This will guarantee that their sales are successful.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons and accessories in larger quantities

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie G. is from Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 22 years old. Rosemarie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing engine. This will be the third loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine.

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun is a widow with five children, two of whom are laborers. The others are studying in the local public school. She was born in 1965. She cuts leaves of palm trees to make rooves for sale and she is a tailor and a farmer.  She owns a very small piece of land where she grows rice to support for her own family. Although she tries to work hard, she can earn little income.  

To improve this condition, Mrs. Chanthoeun is applying for a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza, de 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor de 65 años y sus 2 hijos menores Mario de 22 e Isaac de 16 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Esperanza sabe que en estos tiempos conseguirá trabajo es muy complicado, por eso ha decidido incursionar en una actividad distinta, ella prepara comida y la vende, en forma ambulatoria en los mercados e instituciones del asentamiento humano Pachacutec, donde es muy querida y reconocida por los años que tiene trabajando en esta actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es interactuar con sus clientes y ver que disfrutan de la comida que les preparó, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la comida, puesto que es bastante lo que prepara. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y pueda así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP y al igual como hizo con los otros crédito espera pagarlo a tiempo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más tapers para llevar a más personas la comida que prepara.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 54 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 65 year-old Víctor, and her two dependent children, 22 year-old Mario and 16 year-old Isaac, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Esperanza knows that it is very difficult to get a job these days.  For this reason, she decided to set up in her own business.  Esperanza prepares and sells food as an itinerant street vendor in markets and institutions in the Pachacutec settlement where she is very well liked and well known because she has been in this business for years.

What Esperanza most enjoys about her work is interacting with her customers and watching them enjoy the food that she has prepared.  She has been in this business for 15 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her food since she prepares quite a lot of it.  Over time, Esperanza hopes that her business will grow and that she will thereby be able to improve her income.

This is Esperanza's seventh loan from MFP and she hopes to repay it on time as she has done with all her previous loans.  She plans to use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more plastic containers for distributing the food that she prepares to more people.

loans.use: to buy more plastic containers for the food that she prepares

loans.name: Sisters United Group

texts.en:
Monica is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 34 years ago in Freetown city, Monica is married and has three children.  For 15 years now, Monica has been selling plastic bowls, cotton cloths, slippers and more. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 2,000,000) to expand her business; she will buy plastic bowls, cotton cloths, slippers, etc., in large quantities to add to her business. 

This is not the first loan that Monica and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their previous SMT/Kiva loan, their businesses expanded both in size and quality. With this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, cotton cloths, slippers, etc., in large quantities

loans.name: Lucy Magali

texts.es:
Lucy es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos y actualmente vive con su familia.  Vive en una comunidad en la misma ciudad de Chepén en el departamento de La   Libertad..

 Lucy se dedica a la venta por mayor y menor de  frutas en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Chepen, ella cuenta con un pequeño puesto, en dicho mercado.  Ella cuenta con 11 años de experiencia  en el rubro tiempo que le ha permitido conseguir clientela  fijos para su negocio.

Lucy está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 para que pueda invertir en su negocio, y de esta manera ampliarlo y ver crecer sus ingresos, para que poco a poco alcance una mejor calidad de vida.

Lucy es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 32-year-old mother who has two children. She currently lives with her family in a community in the city of Chepén in the Department of La Libertad.

Lucy sells fruit in bulk and in small amounts at the supply market in the city of Chepén. She has her own stand at the market. Lucy has 11 years of experience in this type of work and it has allowed her to attract regular customers to her business.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can invest in her business. This will allow her to expand and increase her earnings so that she can gradually improve her quality of life.

Lucy is a hardworking woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur.
