loans.use: to purchase more fruit.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells eggs, bread, biscuits & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lilibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.en: Oscar, Brenda and Martina, who all reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “Esperanza En Cristo” solidarity group in June 2011. Oscar has worked for many years as a mason and is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 to install a floor in the house he is building for his family. Brenda earns a living by selling homemade baked goods and Martina runs a small business making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and rebar.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Doña Irma vive en la comunidad de San Pedro, pero vive en uno de sus barrios que esta muy alejado del pueblo, camino una distancia grande para poder salir de su casa al centro, y lo hace ya que para llegar al barrio no hay un transporte al menos de que se pague un taxi especial, que ninguna persona lo hace ya que es demasiado caro un servicio de esos, la comunidad es bonita ya que es abundante en milpas y cosechas, toda la gente tiene su terreno y aprovecha el agua de una grandisima presa para poderlo regar, la gente de este lugar tiene sus animales, mucha gente tiene sus borregos, puercos, pollo que no hacen falta nunca y tambien reces.
La señora Irma tiene puercos ella cria puercos para poderlos vender y tiene 5 años que lo viene haciendo nos dice que las dificultades por las que pasa para engordarlos es el alimento, ya que son un poco delicados hay que procurar tenerles limpio para que no coman cualquier cosa que vean y les puedan hacer daño, tambien hay que desparacitarlos y esten mas sanos, las metas de doña Irma es tener mas animales quiere arreglar un corral para tener mas puercos, tener borregos y si se puede con las ganancias tambien comprar reces para tener un ganando completo, doña Irma vive en union libre desde hace 14 años, tiene 35 años de edad y tres hijos que estan estudiando vive en casa propia y su esposo trabaja como chofer, pero quiere salir adelante por su familia y puedan mejorar la vida que lleva actualmente.
texts.en:
Irma lives in the community of San Pedro but in one of the neighborhoods that is very far from the town.  She travels a long distance to be able to leave her house and get to the center of town and she has to do this because there is no transport service available unless she pays for a special taxi but no one does this because it’s a service that is way too expensive. 

The community is pretty because there is an abundance of corn fields and crops.  Everyone has a field and takes advantage of water from a huge dam to water them. People in this place have their animals.  Many people have sheep, pigs and chickens and there’s always someone around who has cattle.

Irma raises pigs to sell.  She’s been doing this for five years and she tells us that the difficulties she has in raising them is the feed because they are a bit delicate and one has to strive to keep them clean and that they don’t eat whatever they see that can hurt them.  They also have to be freed from parasites so that they’ll be healthier.  

Irma’s goals are to have more animals.  She wants to arrange a corral to hold more pigs and to have sheep and if profits allow, buy cattle to have a complete herd of livestock.

Irma has been living in a common law relationship for the past 14 years.  She is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.  She lives in her own house and her husband works as a driver but she wants to get ahead for her family so that they can improve the life they currently live.

loans.use: to raise pigs to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 3 children. 

Ana has a retail shop where she sells fish, like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Ana is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods & snacks. She  is also engaged in buying & selling shelled corn. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for the store.

Helen is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for the store.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: Yrma tiene 57 años, es una mujer valiente y emprendedora, es viuda y es madre de dos hijos que ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia cada uno, ella vive junto a ellos en su casa propia que pudo comprar con bastante esfuerzo. Yrma se dedica a la venta de ropa, este trabajo lo hace en su casa durante tres años, felizmente tiene la ayuda sus hijas, a vender sus prendas entre amigos y familiares. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar otras actividades, además de poder trabajar junto a sus hijas ya que como es viuda no le gusta mucho tiempo estar sola. En su negocio tiene clientes buenos y siempre son puntuales como ella. Espera poder mantener su negocio ya que le da lo suficiente como para que pueda vivir tranquila. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP0, está tranquila de pertenecer al grupo ya que se siente cómoda trabajando con personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ropa para seguir con su trabajo junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Yrma is 57 years old.  She is a brave and enterprising woman.  She is a widow and has two children who are now adults and have their own families.  They live with her in her house that she as able to buy with a lot of hard work.  Yrma has been selling clothing out of her house for three years and she is happy that she has the help of her daughters.  She sells her clothing to friends and family.  What she likes most about her job is that it leaves her time for other activities as well as being able to work with her daughters as she is a widow and doesn't like to spend a lot of time alone.  She has good customers who are always punctual.

She hopes to be able to keep her business going as it gives her what she needs to live a peaceful life.  This is her ninth loan with MFP.  It gives her peace of mind to belong to her communal bank as she feels comfortable working with responsible people.  With the amount requested she will buy clothing so that she can continue her work with her daughters.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying meat, dairy products, soda and fruit so that she can continue selling her delicious food

loans.name: Lorenza Vanessa

texts.en:
Lorenza Vanessa is married with 1 child.  She is 23 years old, and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Lorenza has been running a piggery to earn a living for the last two years.   She has requested  loan of 4000 PHP to purchase pigs.
Lorenza Vanessa has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita and her husband aim to improve their status of living and to educate their children. She is now 38 years old and has four school-aged children. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting rice for sale. They also own and operates a rice milling business (rice processing)  in their village to generate additional income. Sometimes, they experience financial difficulty due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, but they work hard and strive harder to satisfy their needs and to support the education of their children. 

They aimed to continue operating their rice milling business to earn additional income but, due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask a for loan of PHP22,000 to buy rubber roll, diesel oil and a fan belt for their rice mill business. She believes that, through this loan, they will strengthen the business and makes it a viable source of income. They hope that, in the future, they will become financially stable and their children will earn degrees.

loans.use: to buy Rubber roll, diesel, oil and a fan belt for their rice mill business.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gazelle

texts.en:
Gazelle is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. 
 
Gazelle has a shop where she buys and sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for three years. 

Gazelle is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of used clothing.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gazelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, de 31 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, esta casada, su esposo trabaja como ayudante en una joyería, tiene 2 hijos 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, el mayor ya esta en tercer grado de primaria, ella es comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Antes que se dedicara al mundo del comercio ,era ama de casa y dependía del salario de su esposo pero un día ella decidió que tenia que ser  mas independiente y  traer ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y tener un mejor nivel de vida ,mejorar las condiciones de su casa, comenzó a vender ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante se dedico a esta actividad durante tres años después con sus  ahorros que tenia y los ingresos de la venta de ropa y cosméticos puso la pulpería ya tiene 2 años de tenerla . 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, productos de limpieza, dulces, snacks, productos enlatados. Ya que con esta inversión de capital podrá comprar, ofrecer más productos y brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Uno de sus sueños es poder remodelar su casa, por lo pronto esta ahorrando para invertir en comprar mas vitrinas y estantes para poner en exhibición sus productos.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and lives in the city of León.  She is married and her husband works as an assistant in a jewelry store.  María has two children who are 8 and 3 years old.  Her eldest is in third grade.  María is a retailer.  She owns a grocery store.  Before she started working in the world of commerce, she was a housewife and depended on her husband's salary.  However, one day she decided that she had to be more independent and bring in some income so that she could provide for her children, enjoy a better standard of living and improve the condition of her home.  She started selling clothes and cosmetics as an itinerant street vendor and did that for three years.  Then, with the savings she had and the income she made from selling her clothes and cosmetics, she set up a grocery store, which she has had for two years now.

María needs this loan to buy basic grains, soda, cleaning products, sweet treats, snacks and canned products.  With the investment of this capital, she will be able to buy more products, sell more products and offer her customers a better service.  One of her dreams is to remodel her house.  Right now she is saving up so that she can invest in buying more display cabinets and shelves to display her products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, cleaning products, sweet treats, snacks and canned products

loans.name: Sasagara Group

texts.fr:
Rosette est une commerçante âgée de 35ans qui habite la localité de Mumuri de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (farine de manioc et poissons secs appelés «  ndagala ») depuis 3 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et Sylvestre et mère de 4 enfants dont 2étudient a l’école primaire. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires (farine de manioc et ndagala)  à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir a ses multiples besoins. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Sasagara»
texts.en: Rosette is a 35-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Mumuri, in Gitega Province, in the middle of the country. For three years, she has been doing commerce in grocery items (cassava flour and a dried fish called ndagala). She is also a farmer. Rosette attended school and reached the 6th grade. She is married to Sylvestre and is the mother of four children. Two of the children are in primary school. The Kiva loan of 100,000 Burundi francs that Rosette obtained has enabled her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of grocery items (cassava flour and ndagala) to resell in order to make a large profit. Thus, she can meet her many needs. She is a member of the community group "Sasagara".

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy a large amount of grocery items (cassava flour and ndagala) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Florence has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years; in addition, she operates a grocery. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal and vegetables like onions and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal and vegetables like onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth de 47 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 20 años. Allí tiene un negocio donde se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, calzado y bolso, entre otros artículos a lo que siempre está dispuesto a venderles a sus clientes cuando estos se lo solicitan.  El negocio inició hace 2 años cuando la sobrina viajaba a Panamá y traía  mercancía para la venta.  Aunque Ruth anteriormente trabajó en una empresa, aprovechó esta oportunidad y se dedicó a ser independiente, dándole curso librea su espíritu emprendedor y para resolver la atención de su pequeño hijo, cuando este nació. Al principio fue su sobrina quien le dio mercancía para que la vendiera,  y apoyara a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, hasta entonces a cargo de él.  En sus primeros paninos, obtenía la mercancía a consignación  en un periodo de 4 meses,  hasta que logró concentrar su propio capital y generar mayor independencia en sus compras. Sus principales clientes están ubicados en el barrio donde habita y en las comunidades aledañas, así mismo son empleados de empresas públicas y privadas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará vestidos y calzados para damas e infantil, aprovechando que al final de año, sus clientes actualizan su vestuario y se preparan con vestidos nuevos para estar felices en las fiestas familiares de navidad y año nuevo.
texts.en:
Ruth, 47, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and two children who are 9 and 20 years old.  She has a business there selling clothing, shoes and purses, among other articles; she’s always ready to sell to her customers when they request it.

The business started two years ago when a niece would travel to Panama and bring back merchandise to sell.  Although Ruth used to work for a firm, she availed herself of this opportunity and decided to become independent letting her enterprising spirit fly.  This also allowed her to watch after her newborn son.  At first it was her niece who gave her the merchandise to sell and help her husband cover household expenses which up to then had been entirely his responsibility.  In her initial ventures she’d get the merchandise for four-month consignments until she gathered her own capital and was able to become more independent with her purchases.  Her main customers are located in the neighborhood where she lives and in adjacent communities; they are employees of public and private enterprises.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she plans to use to buy dresses and shoes for women and children taking advantage that at the end of the year her customers tend to renew their wardrobes and buy new dresses to happily spend the Christmas and New Year festivities.

loans.use: to buy dresses and shoes for women and children.

loans.name: Dénis

texts.fr:
Denis est  un homme âgé de 47 ans. Il est mariée å une revendeuse de friperie. Il a 4 enfants.
Denis travaille comme revendeur depuis 2005. Il vend des chaussures pour femmes au marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Denis a requis son 4ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures pour femme. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Denis voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Denis is a 47 year old man. He is married to a retailer of used clothing. He has four children. Denis has worked as a retailer since 2005. He sells women's shoes at the market. He purchases the products in Lomé. He works alone. At the moment, he has no difficulties. Denis has requested his fourth WAGES loan to purchase shoes. He wants to reinvest in the business. In the next years, Denis would like to increase the size of his business. He says that with the profits, he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: Buy women's shoes

loans.name: Analou

texts.en: Analou is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина - вдова.  Она имеет свой небольшой бизнес - продает женскую одежду и колготы в киоске на одном из городских рынков. Валентина начала заниматься этим бизнесом 15 лет назад. За это время она приобрела опыт, рассширила свой бизнес. На данный момент у нее две торговых точки. Бизнес идет хорошо.
Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10,000 гривен на закупку зимней одежды. Валентина надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и сделать небольшой ремонт у себя дома, где она живет со своим сыном и невесткой.
texts.en: Valentina is a widow.  She has her own small business and sells women's clothing and stockings at a kiosk at one of the city's markets.  Valentina became involved in this business 15 years ago.  She gained experience and expanded her business during this time.  Currently, she has two retail outlets.  The business is going well.  Valentina is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase winter clothing.  She hopes to make an additional profit and make minor repairs at home, where she lives with her son and daughter-in-law.

loans.use: to expand the selection of winter clothing

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ms. Ty is taking a loan out for her  son Mung, a student who is studying at Hanoi College for Informatics and Technology. His tuition duration has lasted for 5 years. He will graduate in 2013 with an engineering degree. With the hope of finding a good job, he is studying hard to absorb knowledge.

During his studying, he is confronted with a lot of difficulties in paying fees and buying other supplies. That is why his mother wants to borrow a loan of 7,290,000 Vietnamese dong to solve them.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and other supplies

loans.name: Tuku

texts.en:
Tuku is a 30-year-old young lady from the region of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She passed eighth grade. After that, she got married and so could not continue her study. Now she is a housewife who looks after her husband and children and manages the household work. Her children are going to school and are in fifth and seventh grade. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, wood, mud and bamboo).

Tuku's husband earns a living for the family by selling perfumes, lotion, powder, cream and other cosmetics. He is the only source of income for the family. For the last five years, he has been earning well and sustaining the business. He purchases these products from the wholesale markets and sells to his retail customers. His neighbors are his customers. But, with the growing expenses of his family, he also wants to expand his business.

With an aim to cater to their customers smoothly, Tuku has taken a loan from BJS for her husband's business. She wants to buy more cosmetic products with the loan. She hopes to have more income for the purpose of improving the general living situation of her entire family. In the future, she wants to establish a cosmetic store for them in the town.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for their existing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of the business.

loans.name: Hikmet

texts.en:
This single man was born in 1978 in Khaladj village, Salyan region .
Hikmet has a small grocery store where he sells products. He has had his store for 10 years.
He requests a loan of $1000 to increase the variety of products he sells.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products

loans.name: Khnom Gul

texts.en: Khnom Gul was born in 1965.  She lives in Kabul with three members of her family. She practices animal husbandry and raises cows, sheep, and goats in her house. She took loan from AFS to expand her business and purchased three cows. Her sales of milk,cheese, and butter at the bazaar covers her familys financial needs. Three months ago she lost two of her cows. Therefore she took a loan to replace those  cows.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep

loans.name: Khurshud

texts.en: S. Khurshud lives in Fatalikend village in Saatli. He is 44, married and has 5 children. He is the owner of a small farm where he is breeding calves for meat purposes. He is a very successful businessman and to broaden his farming he needs a loan of 900 USD to purchase more calves.

loans.use: Purchase of two calves

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Boris has operated a sheets and textiles sales kiosk in the central market of Pavlograd, Ukraine. Energetic and enterprising, Boris is known among his clients and fellow entrepreneurs for successful and stable business growth. He operates his business with integrity and skill and is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. 

Currently, Boris is requesting a loan for $1000 to open a new vending facility. The additional business location combined with Boris’s work ethic and experience will enable him to expand his business, increase his income, and employ an additional worker. As his business continues to grow, Boris looks to the future with plans to purchase an apartment for his daughter.

loans.use: Open new vending facility

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
RUFINA prepares and sells traditional food from her region both on request and as a hired caterer for weddings, birthday parties, graduations, etc. in her community. She is 29 years old, has four children and is a member of the Santiago 4 group along with Dioselvina H. H. (perfume and cosmetics sales). Rufina will invest the money in kitchen utensils to be able to prepare meals more efficiently, and Dioselvina will use the loan to buy more products for her display.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

RUFINA se dedica a preparar y vender comida típica de su región, ya sea a pedido o contratada como cocinera para eventos como bodas, cumpleaños, graduaciones entre la gente de su comunidad. Ella tiene 29 años, cuatro hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 4 junto con doña Dioselvina H. H. (venta de perfumes y cosméticos). Rufina invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina para agilizar la preparación de los alimentos y Dioselvina en la compra de más productos para su exhibición.

loans.use:
SALE OF TRADITIONAL FOOD

VENTA DE COMIDA TRADICIONAL

loans.name: Léa Assoupi

texts.fr:
Born November 21, 1979, Ms. Léa Assoupi K. is single and takes care of her one child and two other people. She is a trained hairdresser, a career she chose after she left middle school. Unfortunately, she does not have the means necessary to open her own hair salon. She thus has to work out of her house, which, for better or for worse, allows her to get by. Her goal today is to open a hair salon in the Hédzranawoé market and also to sell cosmetics. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $1000. She is a dynamic young woman who has the qualities necessary to manage her own salon.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 21 novembre 1979, Madame Léa Assoupi K. est célibataire avec un enfant et deux autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est coiffeuse de formation. Ce métier, elle l’a choisi après avoir arrêté ses études au collège. Malheureusement, elle n’a pas suffisamment de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Elle est obligé de travailler à la maison ce qui lui permet tant bien que mal de s’en sortir. Son objectif aujourd’hui est d’ouvrir un atelier de coiffure dans le grand marché de Hédzranawoé et de vendre également des produits cosmétiques. Pour cela, elle sollicite un prêt de $1000. C’est une jeune femme très dynamique qui a les qualités de bien gérer son atelier.

loans.use: Opening a hair salon

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 50-year-old father of 11. He lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Mohamad owns a store where he sells chickens. This is the 8th time Mohamad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He wants to buy more chickens in order to generate additional revenues to help his son open his own business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for re-sale in his little store

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Señora Enith belongs to the communal bank called 'Nuestra Senora del Carmen' located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 51 years old. She's seperated from her husband and she has 5 children who are all grown-up. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to raise chickens for a living.

She raises chickens and then sells them at the local market. She gets up about 6:00 in the morning to go to the market and she stays there until 6:00 pm in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase more fine chickens.

Enith tells us that the support she's able to get from Manuela Ramos is very important for her because she can now work independently, take care of herself, support her children in any way, and move ahead with the help of God and with the help of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Enith pertenece al banco comunal Nuestra Señora del Carmen, ubicado en el AA.HH. Faustino Maldonado Mz. D Lt. 6, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, es separada y madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide dedicarse a la crianza de pollos finos. En la actualidad continúa con la crianza y venta de pollos finos en el mercado, se levanta a las 6 a.m. para dirigirse a su puesto de venta que atiende todos los días hasta las 6 p.m. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará más pollos finos . Enith refiere que el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos es muy importante porque puede trabajar independientemente, valerse por si misma, apoyar a sus hijos en todo aspecto y salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios y de sus seres más queridos.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
K. Komil is 65 years old. He has raised three children.

Komil is selling fruits and vegetables like onions in the market. He is very experienced and knows many secrets for how to store the fruits and vegetables so that they are fresh and do not lose their condition. The business is successful generating the main income for Komil.

Today he requests 150.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing onions for selling. Komil has been the client for IMON for many years and has a positive credit history. And today he thanks all and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase of onions for selling.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela O. is a fishmonger. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells it to her costumers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 39-year-old married woman from Tojšići, a small village near the town Kalesija. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 700 KM.

Fatima does agricultural work and cattle breeding as an additional source of income. She has two children, 12 and 14 years old. Fatima will use this loan in the amount of 600 KM to buy chickens to fatten. She intends to then sell the chickens and earn enough money to provide education for her older son.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Cossy Muhairwe's Group

texts.en:
Cossy is leads a group with five members. She is a 35-year-old widow with five children, ages 17, 16, 15, 14, and 13. All of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban within a slum area.

She has had a hair salon in her home for the last 14 years. She stocks hair oils, synthetic hair, and other salon accessories for her clients to buy. Although there is a market for her business, she must deal with the challenges of price fluctuations of her stock and noisy surroundings because she resides in a slum.

Her children dropped out of school after the death of their father, but Cossy is able to care for them and has been able to send them back to school. She managed to move to a bigger house and started rearing goats in the village. She plans to invest more in her children’s education and to buy a plot of land where she can construct a house.

Cossy has successfully paid back more than four loans.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Salome Balan has a business selling basic consumer goods from her house. She started the business four years ago.

The idea for her enterprise stemmed from the fact that there is a school next to her home. She takes advantage of being able to sell her products to the boys and girls that attend said school, in addition to neighbors who also buy her merchandise.

This business has been a great help to her and her five children. Her husband works in construction and farming.

She will use her loan to obtain more products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Salome Balan, tiene un negocio de productos de consumo diario en su casa, este negocio ella lo inicio hace 4 años. La idea de su negocio fue, que existe una escuela de niños y niñas a la par de su casa, y ella aprovecha a vender sus productos con los niños y niñas de dicha escuela, así como personas vecinas que le compran también sus productos. Este negocio ha sido de gran ayuda para ella para ella y sus hijos, tiene 5 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en la industria de la construcción y agricultura. Su préstamo lo utilizara para tener más productos en su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Haika

texts.en:
Haika is 24 years old, married and has two young children. She went into business as a seamstress in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and earns about $80 a month in profit from her sales.

In the past, Haika has successfully repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania that she used to expand her business. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy more material which she will use to make items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to make items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tanko

texts.en:
Tanko is 48 years old and runs a small local restaurant. He is married, blessed with 11 children, and has used the income from his business to pay for five of his children to graduate from high school. Every day, Tanko prepares and sells local foods like fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and eaten with various kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Tanko says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and he needs a loan to enable him meet these higher costs . He plans to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

He is a member of a loan group called the Asempa Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay their loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Choo

texts.en: Mrs. Choo C., 42, is married and has two children. She works selling various kinds of grocery products and runs a small pharmacy selling different kinds of medicines. She can earn about $10/day of income. Her husband is a Tuk-Tuk (a motorcycle with an attached passenger cart) driver transporting people to different locations in his town, making about $5/day of profit. For the entire family, every day she spends around $2.50 on food, $0.30 on utilities, and $1 on her children's tuition. Mrs. Choo C. has gratefully asked for a loan to expand her business by purchasing more products and medicine to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more products and medicine

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea P. is the village bank president in Hanchey village in Kampong Cham province. She is 60 years old and she is a farmer. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy fertilizer for her field. She has one child who is twenty-five years old and works at a garment factory.

This village bank is comprised of 24 villagers. 10 of these villagers will be paying monthly installments on their loans. The other 14 villagers have end-of-term loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow the borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra B. sells cosmetics and artificial hair extensions. Barbra has received junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children; her husband is a businessman. Barbra has been selling cosmetics and hair products since 1999. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her sale of cosmetics and hair products to meet increasing demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: expand her sale of cosmetics and hair products to meet increasing demand

loans.name: Mavziniso

texts.en: V. Mavziniso is a dynamic and ambitious 45-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. For 15 years she has had a small business processing dried apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers. The demand for her goods has grown, allowing Mavziniso to contribute significantly to the household. Now Mavziniso requests 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for the term of 12 months. She is going to use the loan for purchasing dried apricots to process and resell. Mavziniso hopes to continue supporting her children so they will be able to receive an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots to process and resell

loans.name: Belmira

texts.es: Belmira tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, vive con su única hija a quien ama mucho. Se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás, le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y sabe que dar un trato amable es primordial para mantener contenta y fiel a su clientela. Este negocio le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar turístico y las personas que lo visitan no dejan de comprar los exquisitos platos que Belmira cocina. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, por lo que sigue comprometida con su grupo y con la institución para ser responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más sillas y mesas para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Belmira is 30 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her only daughter whom she loves very much. She sells regional food, an activity which she began to be involved in 2 years ago. She likes her work because she is able to have contact with lots of people and knows that friendly customer service is paramount for maintaining a happy and loyal clientèle. This business is profitable because it is located in a tourist area and the people visiting don't hesitate to buy the delicious dishes that Belmira cooks up. This is her fourth loan from MFP, and she remains committed to both her group and the institution to responsible and timely repayment. With the money which she is requesting she wants to buy more chairs and tables to give her customers a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture to equip her restaurant

loans.name: Petrona Concepcion

texts.es:
Petrona Concepción P. Gonzáles tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es soltera, ella tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes una mujer de 20 años cursa el 1 año de la carrera y el niño de 6 años no estudia ya que tiene problemas de aprendizaje, sus propósitos son de mantener la actividad económica que hasta los momentos a sido el soporte para su familia ya que en sus intereses esta el sacar adelante a su hijo, sus deseos son de proporcionarle a sus hijo una educación avanzada ya que es su mayor prioridad para que el día de mañana pueda valerse por si solo y no tenga problemas para enfrentar situaciones sus sueños son de comprar una finca en donde pueda obtener ganado y este a su ves pueda darle una producción de leche y así mantener a su familia ya que este seria un buen ingreso.


La actividad económica a la que Petrona se dedica es costurera, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante ya que ofrece su mercadería a sus amistades y vecinos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, Doña Petrona inicio este negocio cuando tenia 19 años de edad ya que necesitaba urgentemente un ingreso por lo que en ese tiempo ella misma pagaba sus estudios por lo que además en este transcurso del tiempo era una persona soltera al paso del tiempo cuando termina sus estudios de costura decide establecer un negocio que seria su medio de trabajo por lo que a la edad de 25 años ya estaba casada y tenia hijos razón que la impulsa a responsabilizarse por su familia ademas que su esposo la abandono y sus ingresos disminuyeron y empieza a realizar trajes para niños y sus vecinos compraban sus trajes por lo que decide realizar trajes para damas y caballero por lo que fue muy difícil ya que no podía descuidar a su hijo quien era enfermo por lo que tenia que estar al pendiente de su trabajo y de su hijo pero Doña Petrona no se desanimaba por muy difícil que fuera la situación pero logro sus objetivos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo el destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima ya que tiene que trabajar en trajes para damas, caballeros y niños y se siente agradecida con las organizaciones hermanas y con la fundación león 2000 que se encargan de dar apoyo.
texts.en:
Petrona Concepción P. Gonzáles is 46 years old. She is single and has 2 children. Her oldest daughter is 20 years old and is in her first year of university. Her younger son is 6 years old and is not in school because he has learning difficulties. Petrona's goal is to continue her work, which has supported her family. She also wants to help her son achieve and provide an advanced education for both of her children. Her biggest priority is to support herself and not have any difficulties facing future situations. Her dream is to buy a farm where she can raise cattle and sell milk so she can support her family with this income.

Petrona works from her home as a seamstress and sells her merchandise to her friends and neighbors. She has owned her business for 15 years. Doña Petrona began her business when she was a single 19-year-old woman and urgently needed a source of income to pay for her studies. Once she finished her sewing classes, she decided to start a business which would become her source of employment. When she was 25 and married with children, she became responsible for her family when her husband abandoned her and her household income decreased. She began to make children's clothing. Her neighbors purchased her creations and she decided to start making clothing for men and women. It was very difficult because she needed to take care of her sick son. She was responsible for both her job and her son, but she did not give up despite the difficulty of the situation and achieved her goals.

This loan will provide business capital for her to buy raw materials for the men's, women's and children's clothing. She is thankful to La Fundación León 2000 and its sister organizations responsible for providing her with support.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín tiene 28 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a su fábrica de ladrillos desde hace 8 años, se asoció con su hermano para juntos trabajar en esta ardua tarea, la cual les toma todo el día si quieren producir una considerable cantidad de ladrillos. La dificultad más grande es cuando es época de lluvia, ya que retrasa la producción y a veces se corre el riesgo de perder el trabajo realizado cuando los ladrillos no cocidos se desmoronan por estar por largo tiempo húmedos, pero afortunadamente solo son dos meses en los que se tiene estas dificultades lo cual es superable. Es la tercera vez que Agustín tiene un préstamo con MFP,  aprendiendo mucho durante este tiempo con su trabajo en su banco comunal y seguirá coordinando con todos para seguir creciendo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de arena (una camionada) y palizadas que son el combustible para el horno, invertirá todo el dinero del préstamo además de parte de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Agustín is 28 years old and lives in his parent’s home. He has been making bricks for 8 years, and works with his brother on this arduous tasks. It takes him all day to produce a considerable number of bricks. His greatest difficulty comes during the rainy season, as this delays his products and at times he risks losing his work when the unbaked bricks are exposed to humidity for an extended period of time. Fortunately there are only two months to the rainy season, which is endurable. This is the third time Agustín has a loan with MFP, he is learning a lot during this time with his work in the communal bank and he will continue working with everyone to continue growing. The money will be invested in buying a truckload of sand and combustible fuel for his oven. He will invest all the money from the loan and add part of his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make bricks

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar A. says hello to all Kiva lenders. She owns and operates a cafe, where she works as a cook. She already received a loan in the amount of $1,000 in February 2007, which she used to diversify her cafe's menu. As a result of the loan, which she successfully repaid, she increased the number of her clients, which made her very happy.

She is now applying for a second loan because her cafe does not adequately accommodate her customers. In particular, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $2,500 (2,000 AZN) in order to expand her cafe and to purchase tables and chairs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her cafe and to purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Kate May Carolina

texts.es:
La microempresaria Kate May Carolina N. Martínez tiene 60 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos todos mayores de edad y con 6 nietos los que conviven con ella y su marido. Doña Kate se dedica al negocio de venta de ropas y calzados desde hace mas de 15 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro comercial Bluefields ubicado en una zona de comercio de esta localidad.

Con este negocio doña Kate ha podido sacar adelante a su familia a quienes les ha brindado educación, alimentación y protección como madre de familia. Este es el segundo crédito con Kiva, el primero fue cancelado en tiempo y forma. Hay que señalar que esta microempresaria ha sido cliente de ADEPHCA desde hace más de 10 años y siempre ha pagado sus cuotas a tiempo.

En esta ocasión  ella esta solicitando se le financie para comprar:

10 Unidades de Trajes de mujer los cuales compra a US 17 cada traje, 12 unidades de Short azulón los cuales compra a US 10 cada short, 12 unidades de  pantalón jeans los cuales compra a US 10 cada pantalón, 12 unidades de trajes de baño los cuales compra a US 8 cada traje de baño y  24 unidades de camisetas los cuales compra a US 6 cada camiseta.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepeneur, Kate May Carolina N. M., is 60 years old. She is married and has 3 children, all grown, and 6 grandchildren, all of whom live with her and her husband. Dona Kate has earned a living selling clothing and footwear for more than 15 years. Her business is located in a commercial district of the city of Bluefields.

The business has given Dona Kate the means to pull her family up and provide them with schooling and other needs. This is her second Kiva loan. The first was repaid on time and in accordance with the loan terms. It should be noted that this micro-entrepeneur has been an ADEPHCA client for more than 10 years and has always paid her loans on time.

Now she's applying for a loan to buy:

10 women's suits, each of which costs US$17; 12 pairs of blue shorts, each of which costs US$10; 12 pairs of jeans, each of which costs US$10; 12 bathing suits, each of which costs US$8; and 24 t-shirts, each of which costs US$6.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Safrohon

texts.ru: Сафрохон 41 год, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Муж работает, а Сафрохон занимается предпринимательством. Старшие дети учатся в школе, самая младшая в этом году заканчивает 2 класс. Сафрохон торгует детской одеждой и привозит ее с оптовых рынков сама. Имеет собственный прилавок на центральном рынке и чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара решила получить займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Safrohon is 41 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is working and Safrohon is a business woman. Her older children are studying at school and her youngest daughter is graduating from second grade this year. Safrohon sells children's clothing which she brings herself from the wholesale markets. She has her own vendor space at the central market and decided to apply for a loan at Kiva to increase the assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice B. is a resident of Candari, Pandan, Antique and a mother to three daughters. She is 31 years old and married to Johnny B., a jeepney conductor. Her eldest daughter is a high school student while the youngest is a kindergarten pupil. She is a new ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) member.

She has a general store and the goods are put inside their house since she doesn't have a stall for it. Now that she joined ASHI, she proposes an amount of 5,000 pesos as her first loan cycle as additional capital for her general store and for the construction of a stall near their house so that customers will not find it hard going in-and-out of her house.

As her children grow, she is preparing for their needs in school. She wants her children to finish schooling and find jobs.

loans.use: Aditional capital to pay for stock for general store business.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao K. (pictured) is 37 years old and lives in the Pursat Province. She and her husband earn a living raising pigs in a stall behind their house and selling them for slaughter six months after they begin raising them. Besides the pig-raising business, they always cultivate rice during the farming season, which is approaching. The couple has been married for years but they do not have children. Sao K. will use the loan to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia N. is sixty-four years old. She is a widow with six children who are currently working. She is a petty trader who sells cassava and cocoyams in the local market. She needs the loan to buy more stock to scale up the business.

Cecilia wants to buy more baskets of cassava and cocoyams to increase her inventory. She hopes to double up on her savings. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for some time now and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Kossiwa Cécile

texts.fr:
Faute de moyens, cette femme a abandonné les études pour apprendre la coiffure. Après son apprentissage, elle a ouvert son propre atelier qu’elle a nommé «  LA PATIENCE ». Elle a associé à ce métier le commerce de produits de beauté. Elle a remarqué que le commerce de produits de beauté marche bien, elle veut l’agrandir et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 mèches, 15 tissages, 5 Curly et divers.
Elle est célibataire et subvient à ses propres charges grâce aux revenus de cette activité.
texts.en:
Due to a lack of means, this woman abandoned her studies to be a hairdresser. After her apprenticeship, she opened her own business, which she called "La Patience" (The Passion). She has been involved in the business of selling beauty products. She has noticed that the business of beauty products is going well and she wants to increase this business and is requesting a loan from WAGES for 25 hair extentions, 15 weaves, 5 for curly hair and a variety of items.

She is single and will support the needs of those she cares for with the revenues from this business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, weaves, curly hair and a variety of other items

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta B. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Marietta is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marietta owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipments

loans.name: Maria Auxuliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora S. B. tiene 45 años. Es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Doña Maria inicio este negocio con mucho esfuerzo por lo que trabajo desde muy joven anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de planchar ropa y lavar, en diferentes lugares ofreció este servicio por medio de sus propios clientes quienes la recomendaban por que desempeñaba de buena forma estas labores. Pero lamentablemente solo pudo realizar este trabajo por 2 años, debido a que tenía atender a sus hijos. Por lo que decide comenzar con la venta de ropa y dedicarse solamente a este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de Maria es poseer su propio negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora S. B. is 45 years old. She is a hard-working woman. She is a single mother of five children. She has been involved in the sale of clothing for over thirty years. Ms. Maria began this line of business with hard effort when she was very young. Prior to this, she used to offer laundry and ironing services to her customers, who in turn, recommended her highly due to her work ethic. Unfortunately, she was only able to do this for two years since she had to care for her children. This is why she became involved in the sale of clothing. The credit she is requesting is for working capital to purchase materials for her business. Maria’s dream is to have her own store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en: Juliana is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Juliana is the leader of a trust bank group called Grace. The members of the group are all hard working. They are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, provision selling, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They procure their stocks from Kumasi and nearby towns. They have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they desire to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Juliana is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is already 43 years of age, she is married to a farm laborer named Macario S., they are blessed with five children, they are; Rex - 20 years of age, elementary graduate, followed by Ronald - 17 years old, he is also an elementary graduate, next to him is Rommel - 12 years old, grade four student, Dario - nine years old, grade two student, and their youngest is Sta. Maria – one year old. They are harmoniously residing at Barangay Casalatan Cauayan City, part of Cauayan City forest region. 

	Vegetable vending is her business for almost five years. She is earning around PHP120 in her every vending activity. She only sells twice a week because she doesn’t have enough capital to utilize for the regularity of her business. In this regard, Delia wanted to borrow loan from KIVA amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional capital for the development of her vending business. She hopes to improve the business because her family relies from her business incomes.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora Ana Patricia Q. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso en la sala y cocina. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
La señora  Ana Patricia  va hacer madre soltera,  pronta tendrá a su primer hijo y desea que tenga una mejor casa donde pueda vivir y darle le seguridad.
Ella planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabaja como encargada de una tienda departamental.
Ana Patricia Q. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntualmente.

loans.use: Colocación de vitropiso en la sala y cocina

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is 23 years old and single. Misbah owns a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as meat, flour, pasta, rice, fruit, vegetables, oil, canned food, dairy products, bakery products, and beverages. Nowadays, his micro-enterprise generates a good income with which he can support himself.

Misbah is requesting a loan of US$ 3000 to increase his merchandise inventory to satisfy the demand of his customers and offer them better service and a greater variety of products. He appreciates your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: Increase his merchandise stock

loans.name: Suiun's Group

texts.en:
Suiun, the leader of this group, comes from the rural town of Kant. She has a family consisting of four members, having raised two sons aged twenty three and nineteen respectively. All members of Suiun’s family have different jobs. Suiun’s husband works at the public assistance service of Bishkek city as a leading specialist; her eldest son works in a furniture salon “Shatura” as a furniture maker; her other son works as a waiter in a café and is enrolled in college – he is getting tuition by correspondence. Suiun works as a teacher at an elementary school. Besides that, she manages to look after some cattle. The fact is that long ago, before their marriage, Suiun’s husband already had some livestock. Suiun and her husband have made best use of their opportunities and have achieved great success in increasing the population of livestock and in improving the quality of their living. The livestock allowed them to meet various needs like providing education for their sons, buying convenience goods for the house and making repairs to their home, etc. For the last twenty-five years, raising livestock has been an extra occupation and an extra source of income for the whole family, which every member of the family has shared concerns about. Suiun wants to continue dealing with cattle as it allows them to have quick and large amount of money whenever they need it. Therefore, she has applied for this loan to be able to buy two calves. Suiun’s partners are Tolobek, Gulzat and Sveta: Tolobek, 48, has three children and his wife is a teacher. To make a living, Tolobek works as a stoker at a railway station. He needs a loan to buy a calf to raise. Gulzat, 36, has two children and her husband works in construction. Gulzat is a teacher at an elementary school. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy a milk cow. Sveta, 41, is the mother of four children and her husband is a taxi driver. Sveta is a photographer, providing photographic services at weddings. Obtaining this loan would enable Sveta to buy a printer, which she needs in her work. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
T. Uranchimeg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest son currently works as an assistant at a local grocery shop, her two daughters and youngest son all attend a local secondary school, and her husband is employed as a security guard at the local market.

Uranchimeg operates a shoe making business in her town with the help of a friend. She started her shoe repair business in 1993. After years of successful operation and gaining experience, she broadened her business activity and started to produce both European and Mongolian shoes. Today she is very experienced and skillful in her trade and her product quality is on par with many of the leading shoemakers in Mongolia. Uranchimeg's business is very important to her and has provided financial security for her family. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business in the near future and support her children's school tuition payments. She says, "I hope to have my own working place in the future and I want my children to inherit my business when they get older." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase rubber and other materials used in making Mongolian traditional shoes. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase rubber and other materials

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria es una socia activa, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, Región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 45 años, es madre de cinco hijos(tres mayores de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al ensamblado de motos. Hilaria se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas de la región, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò utensilios para su negocio.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de productos al por mayor para la elaboraciòn de la comida.
La meta de Hilaria es llegar a tener un restaurant propio y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilaria is an active member. She lives in the District of Campo Verde, in the Ucayali region. Hilaria is 45 years old, and has five children (three of them are adults) and she has the support of her husband, who earns a living assembling motorcycles. To make a living, Hilaria sells typical food dishes from the region in the afternoons. She has been a member of “Las Nazarenas” Community Bank for the past year. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, which she used to buy utensils for the business. She has now asked for a loan of 800 new soles. She will use the money to buy food products at wholesale. Hilaria’s goal is to own her own restaurant and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy products to prepare food dishes

loans.name: Pio

texts.es: Se trata de un cliente recurrente de la Suc. es casado posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar tiene 1 hija el mismo es microempresario es propietario de un Comercial ventas de ropería, mercería, bazar, ventas de articulos de primera necesidad denominado Los amigos cuenta con 5 años de antigüedad e rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos el mismo solicito para compra de mercaderias para estas fiestas que estaría trayendo de la ciudad de Puerto Rico Argentina que es de menor costo y le estaría dando mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Pio is a returning client. He is married, has his own home with all of the necessary comforts, and he has one daughter. He owns a store that sells clothing, general merchandise, and basic necessities called "Los Amigos." The business is 5 years old and this type of business allows him to have a very good customer base and a good income. He is requesting a loan to buy products for the festivities that would be brought from the city of Puerto Rico in Argentina, because there the cost is lower and this would give him a better profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: clothing for women and men and drinks from Puerto Rico. Argentina

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 44 years old, is a rice grower and a piggery owner in Norala, South Cotabato, Minadanao. She has been helping her husband till their farm to be able to have an abundant harvest. Aside from rice, she is also raising pigs. The piggery and farm is what she hopes could provide her enough income to buy an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. 

She needs additional capital of 15,000 Philippine pesos to grow her business. The loan will help buy farming necessities as well as additional piglets and feed for her small piggery.

loans.use: Farm supplies and feed

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn S. lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is 43 years old and is married with four children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory and the other three are students in the local school.

Mrs. Thorn S. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Kheav, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field they use to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, her husband is a fisherman who is able to make a small income to support the family.

Mrs. Thorn S. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy a motorbike for transportation and to support the workplace.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Mercedes del Socorro B. Q., ella tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, lleva 7  créditos con CEPRODEL, estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 Ella trabaja en un salón de belleza ubicado en Altagracia colegio divino Pastor.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, zinc, cemento etc. para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación en la  vivienda en la que habita, esto es para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes del Socorro B. Q. is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. She has taken out seven loans with CEPRODEL that have been used to make improvements to her home. Mercedes works at a beauty salon located in Altagracia near the Divine Shepherd High School.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials such as iron, zinc, cement, and other items. She will add another bedroom to her house that will provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to add a bedroom

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily A., 60, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Jose A. and they are blessed with five children. She helps her husband earn income to ensure their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her variety store while also operating a tricycle business.

Emily has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 17,000 loan. This amount will be used to buy groceries to maintain stock in her expanding business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide enough for her family for them to be satisfied and content in their life.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries to maintain stock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old, married to a civil servant, and is blessed with four children. She is a hardworking and friendly woman. Florence is determined to lift her business and family above poverty, and has a good relationship with Kiva partner, LAPO.
Florence sells sarongs, shoes and jewelry of various colors and shapes. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs, shoes and jewelry to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en:
Virgillo E. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. He is 25 years old. Vergilio is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vergilio owns & operates a business providing transport  services to the local community members. With the use of his Motorela(A motorela is a motorcycle that is encased with a carriage with two row-seat enough to transport 6-8 passengers at a time), Virgilio is able to generate income for his family. Vergilio has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, E. joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergilio is requesting a   loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vergilio from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. K., a 25-year-old woman living in Siem Reap Province, earns a living by selling ice blocks. K. is married to Sarith, age 23, who assists her in this business. They live with three teenage children who are attending school. K. has been building her house for months, but the construction is stalled due to lack of tools. Therefore, K. would like a loan of US $400 to buy additional housing tools to continue building.

loans.use: To buy additional housing tools to continue building

loans.name: Panamá Group

texts.es:
El grupo Panamá está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Melba Alicia Obregon quien desde hace seis años instalo una pequeña farmacia la cual con el crédito piensa invertir en diferentes productos de gran demanda.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Linda Ruth Márquez García quien tiene un negocio variado desde ropa, cosméticos, plásticos etc. y Janeth Esmeralda quien es propietaria de una pulpería la cual piensa surtir con el crédito.
texts.en:
The Panamá group is comprised of three hard-working women. One of them is Melba Alicia Obregon. She set up a small pharmacy six years ago. She plans to use the loan to invest in different products that are in great demand. Her colleague in the group, Linda Ruth Márquez García, has a business selling various items like clothes and plastics, etc. Her other colleague, Janeth Esmeralda, is the proprietor of a mini-market. She plans to stock her store with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Hope Development Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
Working hard at achieving her set goals in her five-year-old farming business was to B. Esther, a means to an end in her narrow circumstances. With her hard work ethic in tow, her business took a favorable turn.

This 38-year-old married mother of six boisterous children broke new ground with this determination. Before Esther got to this place of vantage in this business, she was a pump attendant at a local petrol (gasoline) station in her locality. She also ekes out supplementary income from a business selling art crafts.

By and large, Esther’s profits, too, have gained momentum as she has steadily, over the last four years, been making profits totaling up to 150,000 shillings a month. With this loan, she anticipates she will be in position to purchase more poultry and poultry feed for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and poultry feed for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plantain bananas and avocados

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 23 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán, está acompañada tiene un hijo de cinco años, y se dedica a la confección  de hamacas.
 La madre y el compañero de vida le colaboran en la elaboración de hamacas, tiene cinco años de establesido este negocio, y las comercializa en San francisco Gotera, San Miguel y Delicias, buscando las zonas de mas comercio para obtener más ingresos, con el negocio ella solventa las necesidades de su familia, ha demostrado ser una  persona emprenderá.
Actualmente Roxana necesita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como son hilo de seda de diferentes colores, continuar con la elaboracion de hamacas, ayudando a generar trabajo para su grupo familiar, obtener ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Las aspiraciones son algún día tener casa propia, fortalecer su negocios.
texts.en:
Roxana is 23 and lives in the town of Delicias de Concepcion, in the Morazan department. She has a partner and a son, age 5. She makes hammocks. She and her life partner work together to make the hammocks. This business has been established for five years, and they sell in San Franciscio Gotera, San Miguel and Delicias, looking in the most commercial in order to obtain more income. With this business, she covers her family's necessities. She has proven herself to be an enterprising person. Now Roxana needs a loan for the purchase of basic material such as silk thread in different colours to continue making hammocks. This will help her to generate work for her family, obtain income and improve her family's quality of life. Her dreams are to one day own her own home and strengthen her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of silk thread of different colours

loans.name: Ihingiro Development Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
B. Denis, hardworking and reserved 41-year-old married father of five children, has been operating a pork butchery business in Katojo trading Centre in Rukungiri district for over five years. He buys pigs from the surrounding villages which he slaughters and gets ready for selling to his genuine customers who have supported him this long.

Denis’s business has grown to the extent that he has been able to have his children undergo education. In a month, he reveals he makes close to 200,000 Ugandan shillings and also makes some additional income through his side-business.

Denis’s drawback is having a small amount of stock in his business. Therefore, he would like to use this loan to restock his business by buying more animals for his daily butcher job. His future plans are to expand his business and improve his sales revenue.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to butcher and to stock his bar

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 28 years old, married and has a 4-year-old child. Evelyn owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her wishes for the future are for her business to grow and to have a stable income. 

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.
