CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sister

texts.en:
Sister A. sells cloth at Takoradi and has been in this trade for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy extra cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to reinvest in her business.

Sister has been through senior high school. She is married to a sand winner (a person that excavates sand) and has three children. She responsibly supports her husband in providing the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy extra cloth to sell

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum K. is 53 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than three years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and from fishermen.

Chhum K. is a single mother who is blessed with eight children, three of whom are married and the others are single. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a goldsmith.

Chhum K. is applying for a loan in order to replace her old motorcycle that often breaks down.

loans.use: To replace her old motorcycle that often breaks down

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida S. is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Florida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Florida owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Florida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 40 years old and is married with three children. He owns a shop where he sells a large quantity of foodstuffs such as sorghum, maize, peas, etc. He has been in this business for about seven years and his business hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Jean de Dieu needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand the size of his business place and, in addition to that, to purchase an additional quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, wheat, peas, etc.

If he is successful, Jean de Dieu will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to create many sources of income and create more jobs for the people in his community.

loans.use: To expand the size of his business place and buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, wheat, peas, rice, etc.

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en: Mrs. Aljane L. presently has a direct selling and videoke business. She is also receiving a monthly allotment from her husband who is an overseas seaman. She is 30 years of age and blessed with one child who is still an infant. She is from the Barangay of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Aljane’s been in her business for three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Just this year, Aljane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, she is now requesting a first loan of 20,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her direct selling business and for full payment of her installed motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, advancing her children’s education and possibly expanding her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her direct selling business and for full payment of her motorcycle

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven E. is from the town of Banga. He is 33 years old. Joven is married and has an 8-year-old child. To make a living, Joven owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joven hopes to improve his yield so he can earn more.

Joven joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He said he likes the policy and the micro insurance program. Joven is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Foi Plus Group

texts.en:
“Foi Plus” is a group of 9 owners of small businesses, chaired by Monique. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Monique has been selling second-hand clothing for years. Over the years, her business has prospered through determination and hard work, and she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business.  

After she joined one of Hope’s groups called “Foi Plus”, her business prospered thanks to the five different Hope loans she received, which she correctly repaid. Through her sales, Monique makes about $100 per week. 

She plans to use the coming loan from Hope to increase her inventory by purchasing one more bundle of second-hand clothing to resell at profit in order to increase her income.  Monique has points of sale within her community.   She dreams one day to open a large clothing business in Kinshasa. 

Monique is 45 years old, married, and a mother of nine children between the ages of 7 and 27. Six of them attend school. She is also taking charge of her younger sister.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita P. is 44 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Punta, part of the municipality of Panaon, Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Adelita plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Adelita has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Adelita joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Adelita successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Adelita is requesting a new loan, her third from GDMPC, of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca K. moves around in her locality to sell cloths at Abura. Rebecca has been in this cloth business for fifteen years. She is responsible for her own well-being. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more cloth to be able to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth to resell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, D. 59 años, está casada con Sebastian, D. 73 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 D. ellos: Mállela D. 7 y Mayveli, D. 4 años D. edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). DesD. hace 15 años, está trabajadora mujer tuvo una excelente idea. Cada día pasaba frente a la catarata más reconocida del Perú “Tirol”, y pensó que podía poner un negocio D. venta D. comestibles, entre bebidas, dulces y artesanía; es entonces que reunió todas sus fuerzas en construir una choza pequeña, pero adornada con motivos D. la localidad. Por mucho tiempo tuvo buenas ganancias, “yo bauticé la catarata con negocio, pero después apareció la competencia”, afirma. Pero como ya es conocida, Teodora, aún sigue deleitando a los visitantes, con cocos, golosinas, cervezas. Ahora, a pesar D. los problemas que tiene en la rodilla, ella quiere dar un paso más, pues está planeando abrir una tienda más granD. y acogedora. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva D. su banco comunal, está segura que encontrará el éxito y tranquilidad D. los demás integrantes. Por ello con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado comprar diferentes bebidas para surtir su negocio, y si el dinero le alcanza remodelará la pequeña choza turística que tienen en la catarata.
texts.en:
Teodora is 59 years old and married to 73 year-old Sebastian.  They have 9 children but only live with 2 of them: 7 year-old Mállela and 4 year-old Mayveli.  They live together in their own home which is located in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (in the Peruvian central jungle).

Fifteen years ago, this hard-working woman had an excellent idea.  Every day she would pass by in front of the best-known waterfall in Perú, the "Tirol", and she thought that she could set up a business there selling food, drinks, sweet treats and handicrafts.  She gathered together all her strength and built a small hut decorated with local motifs.  For a long time, she maD. good profits, "I baptized the waterfall with my business but then the competition arrived" she tells us.  However, as she is already well known, Teodora still continues delighting visitors with coconut, candies and beer.  Now, in spite of the problems that she has with her knee, she would like to take one step further as she is planning to open a larger and more welcoming store.

This is Teodora's fourth loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she is certain that she will find both success and peace amongst the other members of the bank.  She is requesting this loan to buy different drinks with which to stock her business and, if the money reaches far enough, she will re-model her small tourist hut that she has by the waterfall.

loans.use: To buy drinks to stock her business and to re-model her hut

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie, 23 years old, is married and supports her family by operating 2 businesses: fishing and selling fish. She lives in San Remegio, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,600. Jenelie is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jenelie hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos lacteos, ella vende quesos y leche en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos lácteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos lácteos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlota belongs to the “MUJERES EN ACCION” communal bank, which is located in Anta district, of Anta province, in the department of Cusco. 

She is 30 years old, has two children and lives with her partner. In addition to her normal daily chores, she has a business selling dairy products. She sells cheese and milk at the Huancaro market in the city of Cusco, working from 09:00 to 20:00. It is thanks to this business that she is able to provide for her children. Carlota wants to expand her business selling dairy products and has requested the loan to buy dairy products wholesale. 

Carlota is very pleased with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy dairy products wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Luna Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Francisca N. miembro del grupo mujeres de la luna que se encuentra en jalapilla en el estado de Veracruz, en la fotografía se ve a todo el grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de elotes y esquites que inicio hace 15 años. Sus vecinos la catalogan como una persona responsable, al momento de solicitar este prestamo ella se siente satisfecha, ella tiene 40 años, estudió hasta cuarto año de primaria, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Quiere este crédito para la compra de elotes e insumos. Beatriz J. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 30 años, estudió la secundaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 3 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercancia de temporada de calor.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the business location of Señora Francisca N, who is a member of the group called Mujeres de la Luna (Women of the Moon). It is located in Jalapilla in the state of Veracruz. In the photo, the whole group can be seen. Francisca sells elotes (roasted corn) and popcorn, a business that she began 15 years ago. Her neighbors consider her a responsible person. At the time she applied for this loan, she felt satisfied. She is 40 years old and went to school up to the fourth year of primary school. She is single and has no children. She wants this loan to buy corn and other consumables. Beatriz J. is the president of the group. She is 30 years old and attended secondary school. She is married and has 3 children. She sells clothing, a business that she began 3 years ago. She is applying for the loan to purchase clothing for the hot season.

loans.use: To buy and sell corn on the cob and other food items

loans.name: July

texts.es: July, es una mujer trabajadora de 26 años. Junto a su esposo Eloy y sus 2 hijos, viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan la libertad. El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer, es la “agricultura”, hace 5 años que comenzó alquilando un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas, pagando anualmente su alquiler. Con la adquisición de este terreno, inició la siembra de papa y arveja, los que  cuida, fertiliza y cultiva en compañía de su esposo. Los dos; vende lo cosechado en el mercado mayorista del lugar; pero las semillas de papa los comercializan en el mismo caserío. Ahora están trabajando arduamente para poder adquirir sus propios terrenos y así minimizar costos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia responsable. July, cosechará en los próximos meses varios sacos de papa; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, para esparcirlos en sus terrenos agrícolas después de la cosecha.
texts.en:
July is a hardworking woman who is 26 years of age. She and her husband Eloy have two children. They live in a rented house located in the village of San Juan La Libertad. July works hard as a farmer. Five years ago, she started renting two hectares of farmland and continues to pay rent on an annual basis. With the acquisition of this land, she started planting potatoes and peas. She cares for, fertilizes, and cultivates her crops with her husband. The two of them sell their harvest at the local wholesale market. However, they sell potato seedlings in their village. Now they are working hard to acquire their own land so that they can minimize their costs.

July belongs to the Communal Bank “Capital Semillera” (Seed Capital). This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is a responsible member. Within the next few months, July will be harvesting several sacks of potatoes. For this reason, she will use this loan to buy two bags of seeds so that she begin planting peas on her land after this harvest.

loans.use: Purchase two bags of seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Roza's Group

texts.en:
Roza D. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 55 old and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons; both of whom are engaged in farming. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, the family cultivates agricultural products. Selling part of their harvest, they earn 5000 soms per month. Roza and her husband are also engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan they will purchase more cattle for breeding.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Dom

texts.en: Dom P. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. P. produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning an income of $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $45 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be P.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 32 years old and married with two children.

Vicky earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vicky has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Thun T., 40, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. T. produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 4 per month. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
La Señora Raimunda V. tiene 56 años D. edad, es viuda desD. hace 4 años, ella vive en Cochabamba sola con un hijo, Raimunda vive en la zona D. Maica Central, en una zona agrícola del departamento D. Cochabamba. 

La sra. Raimunda es una señora que dedica a la producción D. leche cruda y venta D. quesillos, en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, no esla primera vez que solicita un credito con ayuda D. Kiva, por lo que esta muy agradecida y contenta. ella se dedica al cuidado D. su ganado vacuno, la producción D. leche y la posterior elaboración D. sus quesillos y con ayuda D. su hijo. 

La Señora Raimunda esta convencida que su esfuerzo dara muy buenos resultados, que sus sueños D. que su hijo salga bachiller y estuD. un carrera se haran realidad, porque ella es una mujer muy emprendedora.

La señora Raimunda nuevamente desea un credito para la compra D. forraje para su ganado vacuno, siempre aprovechando que es mejor comprar en candidad que comprar en pequeñas cantidades. La Señora Raimunda desea que le vuelvan apoyar y confiar en ella comolo han hecho en la anterior oportunidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Raimunda V. is 56 years old and has been widowed for four years. She lives with her son in the District of Maica Central, a farming community within the Department of Cochabamba.

Sra. Raimunda is a woman who engages in raw milk production and the sale of cheeses at the market in the city of Cochabamba. This is not the first time she has requested a loan through Kiva. For this reason, she is very grateful and pleased. Raimunda takes care of her cows, gathers the milk they produce, and uses it to make cheese with the help of her son. She is convinced that her effort brings about good results. Her dreams incluD. seeing her son graduate from high school and study for a degree. Raimunda is an enterprising woman because she wants to see those dreams become reality.

She is seeking a new loan in order to buy fodder for her cows. Raimunda always takes advantage of buying in quantity as opposed to buying in small amounts. She has decided to return for assistance and hopes that she will receive it just as she did on the previous occasion.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Agustín; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería metalica y también es maestro de construccion,el hace estos trabajos en forma independiente construyendo algunas casas y haciendo trabajos de carpintería metalica como puertas, ventanas y estructuras metalicas,el socio quiere refaccionar y mejorar su casa.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como pintura, cemento y arena.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Agustin is a member of the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" ("Working Mothers") communal bank. The bank is Located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

He is 55 years old, married with 6 children. Alongside his daily activities he runs a metalwork business and he also works as master builder. He works independently, building some houses and doing metalwork jobs such as doors, windows and metal structures. He would like to renovate and improve his home. He is requesting the loan to buy building materials such as paint, concrete and sand.

The partner is happy for the loan and committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy building materiasl such as paint, concrete and sand.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: For the past eight years, Georgina has been processing palm oil to sell at Abrafo in Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She has been through senior high school. She also knows how to sew. Georgina uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Georgina will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to produce more oil to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to save towards the secondary education of her children. She is showing the palm fruits she put in the pot, ready to be boiled.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and iron for construction work

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes  tiene como actividad la venta D. Vidrios; dobles, espejos y catedrales,  en la Zona Villa el Carmen la Ciudad D. La Paz, esta actividad que realiza es la fuente principal D. ingresos para ella  y su familia, tiene dos hijos que están en Colegio D. la misma zona, el esposo es Cerrajero en marcos D. aluminio para puertas D. vidrio, el trabajo lo realizan juntos durante  diez años  trabajando D. esta manera, es una persona muy dinámica y emprendedora , en esta oportunidad solicita crédito para incremento D. capital comprando variedad D. vidrios D. esta manera busca lograr y  mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar D. su familia. Ojo en la foto se encuentra en compañía D. su esposo.
texts.en:
Lourdes sells glass; double paned, frosted and mirrored, in La Paz’s Villa del Carmen zone.  This activity is the main source of income for her and her family.  She has two children who go to school in the same area.  Her husband’s a metal worker specializing in aluminum frames for glass doors.  They have been working together for ten years.  She is a very dynamic, enterprising person.

On this occasion she asked for a loan to increase capital buying an assortment of glass.  She hopes to improve her family’s wellbeing this way.

Please note: she appears in the photo accompanied by her husband.

loans.use: to buy double paned, frosted and mirrored glass.

loans.name: Jorge Juan

texts.es:
Jorge ha aprendido su labor gracias a su experiencia, el trabajo como mecánico y presta el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de carros.

El quiere poder tener mas repuestos y mejor herramientas que le faciliten su trabajo, además así puede ofrecerle a sus clientes otros servicios y además así mejora su calidad de vida y la de su familia, así todos son mas felices en su familia ya que su calidad de vida mejora notablemente.
texts.en:
Jorge learned his trade through experience. He is a mechanic who provides maintenance and auto repair services.

Jorge wants to have more parts and better tools to facilitate his work. In addition, he hopes to offer his customers other services so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family. Everyone in his family is much happier since their quality of life has improved dramatically.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and better tools for performing his job.

loans.name: Jaon

texts.en: Joan is 34 years old, single and has four children who range in age from two to 18. She owns a home in the town of Hioma, Uganda and has for the last three years earned a living by selling cosmetics. She started her business with 2.5 million Ugandan shillings but her business is now worth more than six million. Her main challenge is high rents, which is why she is determined to eventually own her own store. She is applying for this loan to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and is a married woman with a 22-year-old child. She is a farmer who tills the land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, where her family also lives. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. They grow rice and vegetables to sell. Jane does her best to help keep their crops healthy. She also runs their sari-sari (convenience) store business where she sells items like toothpaste, shampoo, spices and other various products.

Jane has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizers, 2 quarts of herbicides and buy more items to sell at her sari-sari store. Jane hopes to have a progressive life.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizers, 2 quarts of herbicides and buy more items to sell at her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira de 52 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, la cual pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad comercial, agrícola y ganadería.

Elvira desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenga pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Elvira es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente.
texts.en:
Elvira, 52 years of age, lives with her husband and children in her own home.  It has only electrical service, and is located in the district of Cayaltí, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  This zone is characterized for its commercial, agriculture and livestock activities.

For several years, Elvira has dedicated herself to raising and selling sheep.  Her corral is located outside her house and is appropriate and ample.   She gives her sheep balanced feed and natural grasses for optimal growth, so she an offer them in the various area marketplaces and obtain a good profit to meet her family’s daily expenses.

She has requested a loan of 1200 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  With the income she obtains, she will cover her loan and improve her family’s standard of living.  Elvira is a very hard-working and responsible person, and all she wants is for her family to succeed and improve financially.

loans.use: buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Bunsim

texts.en: Bunsim, 42 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a single mother and has three children, all of whom are working, each earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on housing rent, $20 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her son and daughter to use for traveling to work. In the future, she wants to repair her house to make it better for living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son and daughter to use for traveling to work

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Chhorn is a 24-year-old young man who currently lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Ream province. Chhorn makes a living by cultivating various crops on his farmland that he inherited from his grandparents. He is married with a single child. Chhorn and his wife work in the same business and they make a profit of about $6.50 USD per day to meet the family’s financial expenses. After the rains fall and the land is suitable for production, Chhorn will take out a loan to purchase potato seeds to sow on his existing farmland and to buy insecticides, which he will use to protect his crops. Chhorn hopes that with the increase in income, he will be able to buy extra farmland and buy a plowing machine to use in his business as well.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and buy insecticides.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a widow and a mother of four children: one daughter and three sons. Her daughter is in the 10th standard while her elder son has passed his 10th standard recently. Her youngest son reads in the 5th standard. 
Her husband was a driver and provided transport services to passengers. Two years before his death he purchased a rickshaw, which he drove to generate income.  The earning responsibility came down on her elder son's shoulders. He drives his father's rickshaw and continues his business to generate income for the family. 
Currently, the rickshaw needs repair work.  Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah.  With the loan, her son will fully repair the rickshaw so he can drive it without any problems and will earn a good income as well.  Shahnaz is hopeful that her son's financial position will be improved after the loan investment.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Josefa Nuvia

texts.es:
Doña Josefa sigue con el comercio de venta de ropa y zapatos, carteras de dama, con varios años en las ventas, sus ventas las hace al contado y al credito, su esposo sigue trabajando en operaciones de comunicación, dos de sus hijos cursan el año escolar y un bebe de cuatro meses. Lo que sus  ventas las hace en su casa, y muchos por encargos.
Sus prestamos han sido, para compra de productos, y mantener al cliente sastifecho con la variedad. Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, sera para la compra  ropa de dama, pantalon de vestir, carteras, cosmeticos, por docenas, y poder tener mejores ventas, ya que tiene mas gastos por su hermoso bebe. y que es atraves de estos prestamos,  mantiene  el equilibrio de su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefa continues selling clothes, shoes and women’s purses; she has several years in sales.  She sells on credit and for cash.  Her husband continues working in communications operations.  Two of her children are in school and she has a four-month-old baby.  Her sales take place at home and many are based on prior orders.

Her loans have been to buy merchandise to keep her customers satisfied with the variety.  This new loan will be to buy women’s clothes, dress pants, purses, cosmetics by the dozen to improve sales because she has more expenses now due to her beautiful baby and it’s through the loans that she maintains her business stability.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Martha Santos

texts.es: Martha. de 35 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos,ella se dedica a la compra y venta de banano por mayor,desde hace 10 años en el marcado de su comunidad,le da gracias a Dio porque le a ayudado en su negocio y con la ayuda de el ahora sus hijos tambien venden chocobananos y distribuyen en tres escuelas,doña Martha esta solicitando este credito para la compra de banano y asi venderlos a un buen precio,ya que esta conciente de que le falta capital para trabajar  asi seguir con su negocio.el sueño de ella es que sus hijos tengan su propio negocio y asi superarse poco a poco.
texts.en: Martha, 35, has five children.  She buys bananas at wholesale to resell in her local market; she’s been in business ten years.  She thanks God because He has helped her in her business and with His help her children now also sell ‘chocobananos’ [chocolate covered bananas] at good prices because she’s aware that she lacks working capital to continue with her business. Her dream is that her children have their own businesses to get ahead little by little.

loans.use: to buy bananas at wholesale for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Enena

texts.en:
Enena is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door in her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pedro Ibar

texts.es:
Pedro empezo con un taller de cerrajeria hace 20 años atraz. Pero el desempeño de su negocio le ayudo a abrir una nueva fuente de trabajo vendiendo mariscos. Su espoza y su hijo mayor le ayuda por las mañanas en la venta de pescado  y por la tarde se dedica a su taller de cerajeria.

El negocio gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningun problema con la delincuencia aunque vive en un barrio peligroso.Con el prestamo quiere comprar marisco para tener mas ingresos en su nuevo negocio

Su nueva meta por alcanzar es hacer la loza de la casa y que su negicio de venta de marisco y el taller de cerajeria crezca con la ayuda de Dios y su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro began in business with a locksmith's shop some 20 years ago. Then carrying out this business helped him open a new source of work, selling seafood. His wife and elder son help sell fish during the morning and Pedro works in his locksmith's shop afternoons.

Thank God, the business has had no problems with delinquency, although he lives in a dangerous barrio. With this loan Pedro wants to buy shell fish to sell in order to have more income from his new business.

loans.use: to buy shell fish to sell.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 44 años de edad, convive con Edgardo, su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos: de 24, 22 y 19 años. Esta hermosa y unida familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo. Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora, pasa mucho tiempo cuidando sus cultivos de café, cítricos (naranjas y limones), plátanos y paltas. “El trabajo es cansado pero trae sus recompensas al vender mis productos“, comenta. Hace 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad junto a su pareja. Este trabajo los mantiene unidos, ya que sus hijos también ponen la mano para ahorrar en el pago de mano de obra y contrata de personal.
Los martes y jueves vienen compradores a su localidad, y en los días restantes se encarga de preparar sus plátanos en cajas de madera.  Felicita está muy contenta con los frutos de su esfuerzo. Una de sus metas es ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos con mayor producción y ventas. Y ya dio el primer paso con la siembra de palta y cítricos. “No me puedo quejar, mis cultivos salen bien, el café con buenos granos, las naranjas dulces y jugosas, por eso los vendo rápido”.
De esa manera espera brindarse una mejor calidad de vida, dándose algunos gustos como paseos familiares y diversión.  Éste sería el préstamo número 10 que obtendrá de MFP. Por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Menciona que le agrada su trabajo dentro de su banco comunal por ser solidario.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10  bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de café. Calcula que gastará como 1200 soles.
texts.en:
Felicita is 44 years old and lives with her partner Edgardo.  The couple have three children who are 24, 22 and 19 years old.  This beautiful and united family live in their own home which is located in Puente Paucartambo community.  Felicita is a very hard-working woman who spends a lot of time caring for her coffee crops, citrus fruits (oranges and lemons), bananas and avocados.  "The work is tiring but it brings its rewards when I sell my produce", she says.  Felicita has been in this business together with her partner for 15 years.  The work keeps them united as their children also lend a hand so that they save on paying laborers and hiring staff.

On Tuesdays and Wednesdays, buyers come to Felicita's town and on the other days of the week she prepares her bananas in wooden crates.  Felicita is very happy with the fruit of her efforts.  One of her goals is to expand her farmland so that she can produce more and make more sales.  She has already taken her first step by growing avocados and citrus fruits.  "I can't complain.  My crops do well.  My coffee beans are good and my oranges are sweet and juicy which means that I sell them quickly".

In this way, Felicita hopes to provide herself with a better quality of life, enjoying some pleasures such as family outings and entertainment.  This will be her 10th loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her monthly repayments.  She says that she enjoys her work within her community bank because everybody is supportive.

Felicita will invest her mon ey in buying 10 sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee crops.  She calculates that she will spend 1,200 soles.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Malakiya yambio, South Sudan, for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mahoudjro 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUDJRO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Yvette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yvette est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Yvette a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Yvette est mariée à un certain Georges. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Yvette vend depuis quatre ans, divers produits vivriers (maïs, haricot etc..) dans une boutique située dans sa région. Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Yvette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDJRO 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahoudjro 1 group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, in order to elevate the level of their business. 

The representative of the group, by the name of Yvette, is the one who has her hand raised on the photo. Yvette is 31 years old and lives in Bénin. Yvette stopped school at the primary level. Yvette is married to a certain Georges. The couple has four dependent children who are all in school. Yvette lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the diverse family needs together.

In order to take care of the diverse family responsibilities, Yvette has been selling a variety of food products (corn, beans etc.) in a shop located in her region for four years. Yvette gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. 

In seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her turnover and her income, Yvette is requesting a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Mahoudjro 1 group. The first two loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food products (corn, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 39 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer.

She established her own small business to help support her husband and to generate income for the family. Maritess works in agriculture, raising pigs to sell commercially. She has been active in this business for 4 years and has generated a good return to date. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC and applied for a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase feeds for the pigs' growth and nourishment. In the near future, she plans to reinvest a portion of the income generated back into the business for expansion.

loans.use: purchase feed for the pigs' growth and nourishment.

loans.name: Leanne Grace Group

texts.en:
Leanne Grace is 37 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. 

Leanne Grace has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to be used in purchasing a secondhand motorcab for her business. 

Leanne Grace has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leanne Grace hopes to expand her business. 

She is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing a secondhand motorcab for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of the business

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is a 28-year-old single man living in Sumgayit city. When he started his business two years ago he sold food items, but now sells household and kitchen items. Elshan is applying for a loan to increase the variety and amount of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his trade goods inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Mimose

texts.en: Mimose F. is 30 years old and working to support her three young children by operating her own clothing store, which she has owned for more than two years. The savings she earns from her business goes to improve the health, living conditions and education of her children, 5-year-old Dariana F., 4-year-old Yulina and 2-year-old Arismendy. Mimose is requesting this $200 loan to purchase men and women's clothing to restock and increase her inventory. Her business is growing and she has shown that she can increase sales with a larger supply of product. This loan will not only improve her capital, but will decrease the number of trips she needs to make away from her family  to the regional market to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Juan Francisca

texts.es:
Hi. I'm Juana Francisca and my main source of income is retail trading. I depend on a small pulperia (a traditional grocery store that sometimes sells prepared foods) located in the center of my neighborhood. I've built the business over the last 2 years and it allows me to contribute to paying family expenses. My business has a very good customer base because it's strategically located. I currently need more supplies because the busy season is approaching and sales will increase considerably. Thanks to this business, our children are able to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Juana Francisca, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con ñuna pequeña pulperia ubicada en el centro de mi cumunidad, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para aportar con los gastos de mi familia y cumplir con los proveedores. Mi negocio cuenta con muy buena clientela ya que l a ubicación es estrategica, actualmente necesito surtir mas ya que se aproxima la buena temporada y las ventas mejoran considerablemente, gracias a este negocio nuestros hijos pueden estudiar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
I have been in business for a little over a year operating a small restaurant. My elderly parents live with me and we count on income from the restaurant to get by. I want to invest in the business and buy some tables and chairs. That's why I'm asking for a loan of $1000.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo más de un año que empecé con la venta de comida preparados. El negocio es la fuente de ingreso desde hace un año con migo viven mis papas que son ya personas mayores de edad así que están a mi cargo y para sacarlos a delante, quiero invertirle mas al negocio como comprar sillas y mesas . Solicito un préstamo de $1.000.00 Dlls. para la comprar de mobiliario.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati is 35 years old and the mother of a 12-year-old daughter. She has a small shop where she sells some snacks and household goods. She earns up to $10 per day. Her husband, S., is a driver who earns $10 per week. She requests a loan of $125 to buy more goods for her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Allah

texts.en: I am Allah R.. I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of them are done with their studies and are currently working, while the others attend school. I work at someone’s house as a maid, and my husband operates a fruit cart. Now we require a loan of $350 to add new varieties of fruit to our cart. Earlier we took loans for this business, which turned into better profits.

loans.use: Buy fruit in bulk

loans.name: Damarys Group

texts.es:
Damarys is the name chosen by the members of this association because this word includes the word "lady" in their slogan. These women have all the intentions to move on in life with their families.

There are 18 members, they've been around for just 1 year in the Centro Focal de Villa Adela community. Among the many things they do, they purchase and sell local fabric-created arts/crafts such as blankets, skirts, dresses, hats, and even shoes! They sell them in their own stands and others around fairs, hoping to get buyers that way.

This association needs the money in order to improve the quality of their products, taking into consideration the raw material that they are going to use. Sometimes the materials they use do not meet quality standards needed in order to compete with other local vendors. They want to get a steady income in order to support their family and pay their bills.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Damarys es el nombre que escogieron las socias de esta asociación, haciendo referencia a las Damas que componen la misma, mujeres que tienen la intención de salir adelante por ella y por sus familias. Son 18 integrantes, con una antigüedad de apenas un año dentro del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, y dentro de sus muchas actividades a las que se dedican estas socias, se encuentra la compra y venta de artesanías en tela, confeccionan todo tipo de prendas de vestir para señoras de pollera, sombreros, mantas, mantillas y hasta calzados, que venden en algunos casos en puestos propios, otras se dedican a deambular por las ferias, dejando sus productos a los distintos puestos de venta. Esta asociación precisa de dinero para poder mejorar la calidad de sus productos, tomando en cuenta que la materia prima con la que realizan sus productos en muchos casos no reúnen las condiciones de calidad necesarias para competir en un mercado saturado y donde todos luchan por conseguir un comprador que les asegure un ingreso mensual para hacer frente a sus deudas y las responsabilidades de ser madre de familia.

loans.use: This organization needs the money to improve the quality of their products, taking into consideration that the raw materials they  use sometimes do not meet the quality standards needed to compete with the current market.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Meet 29 year-old Rehema D.. She is single with one child, aged five.

In 2004 Rehema established herself as a seamstress. She now requires a loan in order to purchase material and sewing accessories, which she will use to sew new items for sale. Rehema thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase material and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. prepares palm oil to sell. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She wants to increase production but lacks funding.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more oil palm fruit, which is the major raw material for the oil production.

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruit for oil production

loans.name: Cecundina Vicenta De

texts.es:
Cecundina is 50 years old and is in the business of buying and selling potatoes, which she she has been doing in the area of Gran Poder for the past 17 years. She has lived with her family in the Villa Juliana neighborhood for the past 11 years. Her son does bodywork and painting for cars and has 4 years of experience.

Her business is her own and she developed it with the help of her huband, their sales are at the wholesale level. Although is a lot of competition, Cecundina and her husband have a great deal of experience and in addition, give preferential treatment to their clients, which allows them to be able to count on loyal customers.

This current loan request is to to buy potatoes to sell at wholesale. Cecundina does not have an unfavorable credit history and is considered a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Cecundina de 50 años de edad se dedica a la compra y venta de papa, misma que la comercializa en la zona del Gran poder desde hace más de 17 años atrás. Cecundina vive junto a su familia en la zona Villa Juliana desde hace más de 11 años atrás, su hijo se dedica a la chapería de autos y cuenta con 4 años de experiencia.

El negocio es propio y lo desarrolla con la ayuda de su esposo, ya que la comercialización se la realiza al por mayor. Si bien existe competencia en este rubro, Cecundina y su esposo cuentan con mucha experiencia además que dan un trato preferencial a sus clientes lo cuál les permite contar con clientela fija.

La presente solicitud será para la adquisición de papa, para poder comercializarla al por mayor. Cecundina no tiene malos antecedentes crediticios, por lo que se la considera una persona responsable.

loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Shumkor

texts.en:
Shumkor M. is 54 years old. He is married and has three children, one of whom is still under his care.

Shumkor has been a farmer for ten years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He grows wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other crops. Each year he grows enough for the family and sells the surplus. The business is the main source of income, but keeping it afloat requires considerable effort and outlay.

Shumkor needs fertilizer and seeds to plant. He’s asking for a loan of $600 US dollars. Shumkor hopes that with this loan he can increase the quantity and quality of his yield and earn greater pofits. The loan will be repaid in 9 months. Shumkor and his family are counting on your help. Shumkor thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea is a member of the Banco Comunal Azucenas.

She is 48 years old, married, has six children, and lives in simple house maD. of local materials in the Asociación Las Rosas. She and her children work as artisans using alabaster to make religious artefacts and useful items like candlesticks. Their workshop is in their home. Timotea’s son is responsible for the designs of the products which they sell on a stall in the crafts market in Ayacucho. With this new loan, Timotea is planning to buy a knitting machine that she will use to make sweaters.

She needs a loan of 1200 in order to buy a knitting machine.

Timotea’s dream is to expand her business, to export her products directly, and to have this new enterprise succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Timotea es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Timotea es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Timotea vive en la Asociación Las Rosas su vivienda es D. material rustico, Timotea junto a sus hijos realizan trabajos artesanales en piedra D. Huamanga (alabastro) como iglesias, utilitarios entre otros, su taller esta en su misma casa y su hijo es el que se encarga D. los diseños, sus productos son vendidos en un puesto del mercado artesanal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Timotea con el nuevo préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar una maquina D. tejer para confeccionar chompas.

Timotea necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. una maquina D. tejer.

Los sueños D. Timotea son ampliar su negocio, exportar sus productos directamente, que le vaya bien en el nuevo negocio que emprenderá.

loans.use: Timotea is requesting a loan of 1200 soles that she will use to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Fuente De Bendición Group

texts.en:
Reina Maria D. L. is a 21-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children (ages 4 and 2) in a small community in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She opened a small stand selling seafood products and snacks one year ago. She recently came to Esperanza because she lacked adequate capital to buy enough products for her stand. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing fish, crab, shrimp, and oil to expand her inventory further. It is Reina´s hope to continue to growing her business so that she will be able to help support her young children and proviD. them with good health care and education.

Reina is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Fuente D. Bendición. In English, this means `source of blessing´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of Reina, the Fuente D. Bendición group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy fish, crab meat, shrimp and oil

loans.name: Coral Lisseth

texts.es:
Coral Lisseth is married common-law and is 26 years old. She took a 6-month course in computers and informatics but she didn't continue with the program because she became pregnant. She has a new born and they live in the district of La Esperanza in the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad quarter.

To help herself financially she started selling cosmetics 2 years ago to her friends and she takes orders from the city of Chimbote as well. She was referred through a friend to the community bank Mar Y Cielo II and she has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year. With the first loan, amounting to S/.300.00, she purchased necklaces, perfumes, creams, and colognes etc.

This loan, amounting to S/.1,500.00, will be repaid in a term of 6 months and she will invest the funds in the purchase of more necklaces, perfumes, creams, and colognes.

In the community bank where she is a member she is the treasurer and she keeps the books and makes sure that the other members make their payments on time.

She feels that she has a good client base because she provides excellent customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Coral Lisseth, es conviviente, tiene 26 años, estudió la carrera de computación e informática durante 06 meses, no continuó estudiando porque quedó embarazada, tiene 01 hijo recién nacido, vive en Distrito de La Esperanza en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 02 años, vendiendo productos cosméticos a sus amigas y siempre viaja a Chimbote llevando estos productos según el número de pedidos. Por medio de una amiga participa en el Banco Comunal “MAR Y CIELO II”, tiene 01 año trabajando en Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró productos cosméticos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 que cancelará en 06 meses tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de collares, perfumes, cremas, colonias, etc. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece ocupa el cargo de tesorera cuya función es llenar libretas, ver que las socias paguen puntualmente. La empresaria sueña con tener un salón con vitrinas, donde se pueda ofrecer perfumes, relojes, carteras, joyas, y piensa construir su casa con el tiempo. Ella considera que tiene clientela debido a la amabilidad y la forma de tratar a los personas.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Sabahi

texts.en:
Sabahi is 30 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 15 and 1. She also takes care of 3 other people, ages 24, 28, and 30. She has run her own grocery since 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Sabahi is now looking for a loan to buy more grocery items to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to improve her business

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima has been selling udi in Zanzibar for one year. Udi is an object that Muslims burn for religious purposes and that produces a fragrance, much like incense. Halima sells udi both retail and wholesale. Because Zanzibar is nearly 100 percent Muslim, this is a successful business for Halima. She is hoping to take out this loan to expand her inventory and increase her profit. She is currently able to earn approximately $85 each month.

Halima is 36 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 14, and 17. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Nadharia, Mayasa, Mwatumu, and Asha.

loans.use: To buy udi

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Wiracocha Village Bank. Wiracocha means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is 50 years old and married with two children. She and her husband buy and sell products from the jungle like peanuts, sesame seeds, annatto and palillo (a condiment). Justina has a small store in Ayacucho and another in a rented space in the city of Hatun Rumi. Her husband travels to the jungle to buy these products. After cleaning and storing her products, Justina sends them to the city of Lima, and she also sells the products in the city of Ayacucho.

Justina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy peanuts and sesame seeds. Justina dreams of opening a processing plant to add value to the products she sells and dreams that her children will finish their studies and grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua. Justina es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Justina junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de productos de la selva como ajonjolí, maní, achiote y palillo, Justina tiene un almacén en la ciudad de Ayacucho y en la ciudad de Hatun Rumi el cual es alquilado, Su esposo viaja a la selva para poder comprar de los productores luego de almacenar y limpiar los productos los envía a la ciudad de Lima y Justina se dedica a la venta en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Justina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maní y ajonjolí. Justina sueña con tener una empresa de transformación y darle valor agregado a los productos que comercia y que su hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Justina would like to buy peanuts and sesame seeds to sell.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Hello from Aline U. in Kigali town in Rwanda! This entrepreneur is 31 years old, married with four children. Aline started her business when she was 14 years old, selling avocados and fruits like oranges, passion fruit, lemons, etc., carrying the basket on her head.

This entrepreneur has seen her business grow over the past years and she is now selling food items. She buys beans, rice, and sorghum in tons (many kilograms) and keeps them in her warehouse where she sells them at an increased price when they are in short supply and during the planting season. Besides the business, she also plants beans for both home consumption and for sale.

She is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Frws to increase her food stocks and be able to make money to pay for her children’s school fees next year; they study in secondary schools. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her stock of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ol Bin Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fourteen people from the Phum Saeprammuoy Village in the Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Sam Ol B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Kung Samut, is a construction worker who generates little income to support the famiL.. Mrs. Sam Ol B. is 28 years old and the mother of three children who are all construction workers. Although these famiL. members try to work hard, they still cannot support the famiL. well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sam Ol B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business, and she also hopes to increase her income in order to provide a better life for her famiL..

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Tanto el padre como la madre de  María eran comerciantes, así que ella se crió en un ambiente de  negocio. Ha trabajado toda su vida, primero con sus padres, y luego mientras estudiaba contabilidad dedicándose a la vez de cuidar al bebé de un senador. Seguidamente se dedicó por unos ocho años a la venta de chompas, bordados, y productos de macramé producidos por ella misma, y hoy en día esto es todavía parte de sus negocios.

Tras casarse, María trabajó junto a su esposo vendiendo papa rellena (plato típico peruano) por las calles, y cuando él expresó el deseo de estudiar mecánica ahorraron juntos para contratar un profesor que le enseñara el negocio. Después de unos años sacaron un préstamo para que su esposo pudiera empezar su propio negocio de mecánica. 

Por otro lado, María continuó en sus negocios independientes. En casi trece años de matrimonio sus negocios han sido variados, trabajando en todo lo relacionado con  macramé (zapatos, carteras), hasta vender papa rellena por las calles.

Desde hace tres años ha estado trabajando en su actual negocio - la crianza de pollos y cuyes para venderlos cocinados de acuerdo a los pedidos. Además, se dedica a la venta de ropa y tejidos que va ofreciendo a tiendas en Lima y a sus amistades. Con su esposo ahorran las ganancias de sus negocios para mejorar poco a poco su hogar y el nivel de vida de toda la familia.

Está muy feliz de las oportunidades que le dan los préstamos, ya que le permiten acercarse a su objetivo: un futuro mejor para sus tres hijos de once, siete y dos años.
texts.en:
Both Maria’s mother and father worked in sales, so she grew up in a business environment. She has always worked, first with her parents, then, while studying accounting she worked as a babysitter for a senator’s baby. After that she worked for 8 years selling sweaters, embroidery and macramé products that she made herself. Today this still makes up part of her business. After she got married, Maria worked with her husband as a street vendor selling a typical Peruvian food called papa rellena (mashed potatoes stuffed with ground meat). When her husband expressed his desire to study to become a mechanic, they saved their money to pay for a teacher. A few years later they took out a loan so her husband could start his own business as a mechanic. Maria continued with her own business. In almost 13 years of marriage she has had a variety of jobs, working with everything related to macramé (shoes, wallets), and selling food on the street. For the past 13 years she has also worked in her current business—raising chickens and guinea pigs to sell cooked-to-order. She also sells clothing and textiles that she offers to stores in Lima and to her friends. Maria and her husband save the money they earn from their businesses to slowly improve their home and their quality of life. She is very happy with the opportunities these loans have given her because they allow her to work towards her goal: a better future for her children, who are 11, 7, and 2.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for her animals

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 47-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. BilA. has owned a grocery store for fifteen years. He also sells vegetables. BilA. requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that BilA. has requested a loan.

His clients are people from his area. BilA. decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita G. is a 55-year-old married mother of five.  Three of her children have finished school, and her youngest daughter attends college.  Her husband is a laborer.  Lucita plans to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her "sari sari" shop.  "Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds," and these shops sell an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities.  The stores are usually operated out of the owner's home, are neighborhood watering holes, and retail in small units—selling single cigarettes, for example.  Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.  Lucita learned the sari sari trade from her mother, and had a store before that was destroyed by a typhoon. She hopes to fully rebuild and expand her operation, and use her income to support her children and grandchildren's education.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a small general store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is fifty six years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are currently in senior high school. The other is out of school and working. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. 

Mary works to support her husband financially. She is a trader in cosmetics. She procures cosmetics such as body sprays, powder, creams, etc. She hawks to sell her products in her community. Mary also treks to other markets to sell on the market days. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure varieties of cosmetics in bulk. Mary is hopeful that she can help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure cosmetics

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 35 years old and living in the village of Cabisera 5, Centro, San Isidro, Isabela. She and her partner are not yet married but they have been together for more than 20 years and he is the father of their two children. Their son Dan is 18 years old and a high school undergraduate while their youngest is a high school student.

Juvelyn is a fish, meat, and chicken vendor in her village. She uses their tricycle as transportation in selling her products inside and outside of the village. For the continuous growth of her business, she is now requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 as business capital. She wants to satisfy her customers' needs. She believes that through her business she can continue to send them to school even for a two year course.

She strives hard to make her business grow and generate more income. She knows successful people keep moving forward and she always keeps herself motivated.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling meat, chicken, and fish.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is a very modest lady. She believes in hard work. Her husband handles a livestock business. He sells buffaloes to customers. Hamidan baji helps him by taking care of the buffaloes.

Hamidan baji is a 53-years-old married lady and a citizen of the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its sweetmeats and for its festivals. Hamidan baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to complete customer's orders and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Venibeb

texts.en:
"I started farming when I was a small kid. My father taught me everything from sowing the seeds to harvesting the grains. I learned also some techniques to achieve better yield in my crops. Now, that I am married to a farmer, I work my very best to help him in the farm and provide all their needs", says Venibeb B., 32-year old mother of two children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate. The loan will really help him improve his harvest and his income for the family as well.

Through CEVI, he is able to sustain his livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients not just loans. They also include training and insurance coverage as part of their services.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Abraikul

texts.ru: Абрайкул Раджабов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абрайкул 10 лет работал по специальностью, трактористом. Теперь как 10 лет занимается земледелием, т.е. выращивает бахчевые растения и рис. Клиент просит кредит, чобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горючее для посева рисовых плантаций.
texts.en:
Abraikul R. lives in the Rumy region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Abraikul worked for 10 years in his profession as a tractor driver. For 10 years he has been working in agriculture, growing melons and rice. The client is asking for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer and fuel to plant rice plantations.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace started her fish sales two years ago at Sefwi where she lives. She is now 30 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school.

Grace prepares her goods and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish. Because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She takes delivery of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region and wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales. That will produce increased income to support her children’s education and her business growth.

She would be grateful for your assistance. It is her dream to save more to build her own house so that her children would not grow to suffer that much.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
“Margaritas” es un grupo de  trece señoras  y pertenecen al Centro Focal “German Busch”, todas tienen  negocios pequeños como la venta de juguetes, otras cuentan con un taxi conjuntamente con su esposo y requieren el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento a su movilidad y la mayoría se dedica al   tejido de alfombras  y  mantas, por ejemplo Maria Antonia C. de 34 años de edad, confecciona alfombras  hace 10 años, creando siempre nuevos diseños y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la lana. 

Su presidenta es Maritza S., cuenta que “Margaritas” es un grupo muy unido y son solidarias entre ellas.
texts.en:
Margaritas is a group of thirteen women and part of the German Busch "centro focal". All of the women own small businesses selling merchandise such as toys. Others operate taxi businesses with their husbands and need loans to maintain their vehicles. Most of them, though, work at making and selling woven textiles such as rugs and blankets. For example, Maria Antonia C., 34, has been making rugs for 10 years, always creating new designs. She needs a loan to buy wool and other raw materials.

The president of the group, Maritza S., says that Margaritas is a close-knit group whose members look out for one another.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and services for a range of businesses.

loans.name: Mukama Talemwa Nagobi Rebecca Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca is twenty three years old and is married with two children. She has operated a spare-parts shop for over five years. She is using the loan to buy shop items – that is, spare parts for bicycles – in much more volume.

Being so encouraged, Rebecca’s future hope is to enlarge her business and obtain another shop aside from the one that sells spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for bicycles in much more volume

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 29 years old and is married with two children.  She and her husband work together making and selling charcoal.  They live in the city of Pucallpa. 

Doris has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a year and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  She plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in purchasing wood to make charcoal.  

Doris and her husband have large ovens for making charcoal 40 kilometers outside of Pucallpa, along the highway which links the city to the capital, Lima.
