Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings and small plants for a farm

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in Ndeeba, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (granddaughters). She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills and school fees.

Hadjah has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for six years, and works seven days a week. She sells her produce at the market, both wholesale and retail. She sells to all categories of people both women and men.

Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She buys her bunches of bananas from villages in the Masaka and Mbarara districts.

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a delivery van.

Hadjah decided to join MCDT SACCO because its people are honest and it gives out timely loans.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey V. is from the town of Banga. He is 23 years old, married and has a 2-year-old child. Junrey owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Junrey also tills a small parcel of land where he plants and harvests rice crops.

Junrey joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Junrey is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies

loans.name: Fortunato Jesus

texts.es:
Fortunato de 56 años, es vendedor al po mayo y menor de arroz y pollos de criadero, su esposa se encuentra fuera del país mientras que el esta en su casa con sus hijos. vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

El trabajaba en una fabrica de construcción pero debido a que necesitaba esta mas tiempo con sus hijos. Compro arroz y pollos para criarlos y después venderlos. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer vendiendo los quintales de arroz y sus pollos de criadero. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz y balanceado de pollos para tener mejor ingresos. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y seguir con salud.
texts.en:
Fortunato, 56, sells rice at wholesale and retail and chickens from his coop.  His wife is living outside the country, while he lives in his home with their children.  He lives in a neighborhood called "Paraiso" on the outskirts of the city that has dirt roads and mountains.  

He used to work in a factory, but since he needed more time to be with his children he bought rice and chickens to raise and later sell.  He works every day from the early morning hours until evening, selling hundred-pound bags of rice and the chickens from his coop.

With the loan he wants to buy rice and nutritionally balanced feed for his chickens to increase his income.  In the future, he wants to stay healthy and see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy rice and chickens

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha N., age 51, is a poultry farmer in a residential area in Nairobi. She raises and sells chickens to the local people. She has been in this business for two years now and she says that the business is profitable. Her primary challenge is the lack of sufficient finances. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Tabitha's husband is a self-employed welder. They have three daughters and two sons, all of whom they hope to educate to the university level.

She will use her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more chickens to meet the high local demand for chicken. She hopes to diversify to a real estate business in future. She describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Moses Mbila

texts.en:
Moses Mbila, 34 years old, is married to Mercy Mumo and together they have one daughter who is seven years old. He lives at Tala and his hotel business is in Gikomba Estate in Nairobi, which is surrounded by slums. He has been running this hotel business selling snacks, tea, and meals for 6 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 10,000. His wife Mercy Mumo is aged 30 years and she is a businesswoman. 

Moses was introduced to KADET LTD by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office. After getting this loan, he intends to buy more chairs and tables for his hotel and also improve on the quality of service he has been giving his customers to target a higher class of people. The customers served by Moses are happy and contented by his delicious meals.

Moses intends to use the generated profit generated to open other hotels in other markets and add more workers for efficiency. Moses is hard-working and loves his business.

loans.use: Improve his hotel business and buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 32-year-old business lady who does dairy farming. She has been practicing dairy since 2006 with a good market for her products. 

She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a cow, a loan guaranteed by Jirani Mwema Shg. 

Faith is married and is a mother of two. She describes herself as polite and patient and also practices subsistence farming. She dreams of being a competitive and successful dairy farmer. Since she joined Faulu, her living standard has improved.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Narynkul

texts.en:
Narynkul A. is 57 years old, married, and has six grown children. Her husband, Jumabek, is a pensioner and helps her in the household. Four years ago, in order to find means of subsistence and to make some savings for old age, Narynkul decided to engage in cattle breeding. 

Using her starting capital of only 2,000 KGS, Narynkul decided to start her business in cattle breeding and bought bull calves. She concentrated all her efforts on supporting and expanding her household and managed to raise her capital to 40,000 KGS.  Now, Narynkul wants to take out a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy three bull-calves and four sheep for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from this investment, Narynkul plans to develop her farm by means of livestock breeding. In the future, she dreams to open a small shop with meat products. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and sheep

loans.name: 6 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro  surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 12º ciclo, es un comité antiguo opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007 , tienen un ahorro de 4.530.134  G. 
 La Directora General es la Sra. Jiner A. Barrios es casada con 2 hijos. 
Su marido es empleado en un taller mecánico y ella utiliza esa posibilidad llevando desayunos y almuerzos a los empleados del taller donde trabaja su marido y también fabrica y vende sabanas en su casa.
 Cuenta la Sra. Jiner que el crédito que recibe de la Fundación lo utiliza para la compra de mercaderías comestibles para la venta de las comidas que hace, ella se encuentra muy agradecida ya que gracias a el crédito que recibe puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
 Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas como ser :   librería, modista , venta de pollos, venta de huevos, venta de cosméticos, y venta de comestibles.
texts.en:
This group from the San Pedro neighborhood emerged as a result of promotions conducted in the area. It is currently in its twelfth loan cycle and has been a longstanding committee of Fundación Paraguaya since 2007. The members have accumulated savings of 4,530,134 PYG.

The group’s General Director is Sra. Jiner A. Barrios. She is married and has two children. Her husband is employed at an auto repair shop. Jiner takes advantage of this opportunity to deliver breakfast and lunch to the employees of the shop where her husband works. She also sells bed sheets from her home.

When Sra. Jiner was interviewed about the loan she received from Fundación Paraguaya, she indicated that she would use it to buy ingredients for preparing the food that she sells. She is very grateful and says the loan she received will improve her income and help her family.

All of the women in the group engage in various productive businesses such as managing a bookstore, sewing, selling chickens, selling eggs, selling cosmetics, and selling food.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe Del Carmen tiene 29 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada. Inicio hace más de 8 años ya que debido a la falta de empleo que tenia no podía sacar adelante a su familia pues por esto que decide establecer su propio negocio. El motivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como perfumes, lápiz labial, cremas, ropa interior  entre otros pues se acerca una buena temporada festiva y quiere aprovecharla.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Del Carmen, 29, sells general merchandise.  She buys used clothing to sell.  She started over 8 years ago because due to the lack of employment opportunities she was unable to support her family and this is why she decided to open her own business.

The reason for the loan request is to buy supplies like: perfumers, lipsticks, creams and underwear, among others, because a good, festive season is approaching and she wants to take advantage of it.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
53-year-old Linda is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice crops. She says she has been exposed to farming since she was a child because both her parents were farmers. Linda earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from growing and selling rice. Aside from farming, she also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells various kinds of products.

Linda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Linda is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Byron Jose

texts.es:
El Senor Byron M., es originario de Rio Abajo, Pueblo Nuevo, Municipio de Esteli, casado, tiene 2 hijos.
No pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos, se vio obligado a dejar la escuela y apenas logro terminar su primaria.
Inicio joven en la agricultura, en la siembra de Granos Basicos y Tabaco. Actualmente se dedica a la siembra de Hortalizas como Tomate. Inicio con algo que tenia recogido de ahorro y con un cunado.
Realizo este Prestamo, para la compra de insumos para la compra de Tomates.
Espera obtener buenos ingresos durante esta semana santa; para poder seguir creciendo poco a poco para poder independizarse y no necesitar de su cunado.
texts.en:
Byron M. is originally from Rio Abajo, Pueblo Nuevo, in Esteli. He is married and has 2 children.
He was unable to finish school because of a lack of financial resources, and was obliged instead to drop out right after he finished 8th grade.
He started farming when he was young, growing staple grains and tobacco. Currently he is planting produce such as tomatoes. He had a little money saved when he started, and the help of a brother-in-law.
He has requested this loan to purchase supplies for buying tomatoes.
He hopes to turn a good profit this Easter, to keep growing his business a little at a time and not have to depend on his brother-in-law.

loans.use: Tomato farming

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa V. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Marissa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of providing multi-purpose cab services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She also buys and sells silver jewelry, like necklaces and bracelets. Marissa has been engaged in her businesses for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Marissa is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the cab service. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the cab service

loans.name: Rosa Syoner

texts.es:
Rosa, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jhon (34), que es chofer,  y de sus tres pequeños hijos; además esta a la espera de un nuevo niño; juntos buscan  progresar cada día.  

Desde hace cuatro  años se dedica a la venta de ropa, le  ofrece su mercadería a conocidos, que le hacen pedidos de acuerdo a la época. En la actualidad está ofreciendo uniformes escolares y también vende  lo que esta de moda; la ventaja de su negocio es que comercializa  la ropa a concesión, es decir que sus clientes se comprometen a pagarle después de un tiempo. Le gusta su trabajo porque obtiene considerables ganancias, que le permiten ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, y además puede comprarse sus gustos. Lo que le disgusta es que a veces sus clientes se atrasen en los pagos y esto le atrase en la compra de nueva mercadería. Como es una mujer emprendedora tiene muchos planes para el futuro entre ellos tener una tienda de ropa en un lugar fijo.

Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mas cantidad de uniformes, pues se acerca la campaña escolar y ella quiere obtener mejores ganancias. 

Es la sétimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Jhon (34), who is a driver, and their three small children.  She is also expecting another child and together they all want to get ahead day-by-day.

For four years now she has been selling clothing to merchants who submit their orders depending on the season.  Now she is offering school uniforms and also selling fashion clothing.  The advantage she has in her business is that she can sell clothing through concession, meaning that her customers can pay on a credit basis.

She enjoys her work and obtains considerable earnings that enable her to help out with household expenses and buy whatever she needs.  She does not like it when customers are delinquent in their payments which delays her purchases of new merchandise.  Since she is very enterprising her future plans include having her own clothing shop somewhere.

Rosa plans to use the loan to buy more uniforms because the school year is about to begin giving her more income.

This is her seventh loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She would not want to disappoint the people who have helped her continue working in order to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy uniforms

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 13 people, each of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's living standard. Chanthy, the village bank president selected by the other members, is a 52-year-old widow with five children, one a wedding beautician, another a garment factory worker, another a print laborer, and remaining two students in the local public school.

Chanthy is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land upon which she grows rice, selling part of the crop and using the rest to feed her family. Wishing to begin an additional business, Chanthy is requesting a loan to buy some piglets to breed.

loans.use: to buy some piglets

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 32 years old and married with two children.

Jenalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jenalyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (general) store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jenalyn aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 39 years old and married with three children aged between 11 and 16. She is a farmer in Kisii Town in South Rift Kenya. For the last 20 years, she has been producing maize, bananas and milk and selling them to the local market. Her family relies solely on farming for its well-being.
Alice has made a loan request of 45,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Alice believes that the acquisition of a new dairy cow will improve her family's income and generate income to educate her children. She wants to increase the number of dairy cows in her farm. Alice also believes capital for business remains the greatest impediment to farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is from the town of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Marites is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Marites is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Viky Karen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karen, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y de 1 año, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en Picoaza en una distribuidora. Tiene tres años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que fue una amiga del banco quien la incentivó para que se dedique a estas ventas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las charlas sobretodo las de salud.

Su sueño es tener un almacén con local propio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the "Mujeres de Lucha" community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known as being a commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of its people.

Here we meet 20 year-old Karen who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 5 and 1.  Her eldest child is in elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Karen is a housewife who, in order to make her own money, also sells clothes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs.  She works every day and makes her sales door to door.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  Her Avon products are delivered to her home and she buys her clothes from a distributor.  Karen has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.  She tells us that it was a friend from her community bank who encouraged her to start selling these products.

Karen will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and all kinds of clothes.  This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank which she likes because of the talks, especially the health talks.

Karen's dream is to have a store located in her own premises.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Marquise

texts.fr: Marquise est née le 10 décembre 1975. Marquise est mariée à Pierre un chauffeur et à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Marquise vit seule avec ses enfants et assure les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de dix ans que, Marquise mène comme activité la vente de potasse et du bissap au Bénin. Marquise s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à se prendre en charge et à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Marquise sollicite pour une première fois l’aide financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Marquise was born on December 10, 1975. She is married to Pierre, a driver, and has three children, who are all in school and in her care. She lives alone with her children and ensures that the various household expenses are covered. For nearly ten years, she has been running a business selling potash and hibiscus in Benin. She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. This business generates revenues that help her to support herself and to cover family expenses. With regard to boosting her business further and increasing her profit, Marquise is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to buy hibiscus leaves and some potash

loans.name: Sociedad 12 De Abril (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril está formado por 1 hombre y 9 mujres que son amigas, vecinas y trabajan en un mercado de la ciudad, esto  les ha  permitido aportar  a  la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Blanca vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 20, 16, 11, 9 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y es quien le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio, su tercer y cuarto hijo estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Blanca es comerciante de frutas y verduras en un mercado de la ciudad hace 20 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde en su puesto propio. Cuando hay partidos de fútbol  vende confitería en el estadio.

En el banco comunal esta hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia. 

En esta ocasión nos acompaña en la foto la Señora Karina, es la promotora de crédito de Banco Comunal, está sentada entre las socias con una blusa blanca.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sociedad 12 de Abril", is made up of 1 man and 9 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors who work in the city's market. This has helped them to earn an income for their home and to provide for their families. They live in different locations in the city of Cuenca. This city is irrigated by 4 rivers which is the origin of the name Santa Ana de los 4 Rios, meaning Santa Ana of the 4 Rivers. Its historical centre was named as a national cultural heritage site in 1999. The people retain their culture and traditions.

Blanca lives in the sector of Totoracocha in the city of Cuenca. She is 39 years old and she is the single mother of 5 children, aged 20, 16, 11, 9 and 3. Her eldest child works and it is he who helps her financially. Her second child is in high school, and her third and fourth child is in primary school in the city. She does not own a house of her own, which is why she rents.

Blanca has been a fruit and vegetables merchant in the city's market for 20 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening from her own stand. When there are soccer games she sells confections in the stadium. 

She has been with her communal bank for 2 years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of fruits and vegetables for her business.

Her dream is to have a house of her own.

At this time Karina is pictured with our group. She is the communal bank credit agent. She is seated among the members, wearing a white blouse.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Davlatbi

texts.ru: Давлатби проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Давлатби занимается торговлей. Она арендует помещение, где открыла продуктовый магазин. В этой области она более 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сахара, молочных продуктов, конфет, консервированных продуктов и хлеба.
texts.en: Davlatbi lives in the Dangara district.  She is 51 years old, married and has three children.  Her oldest son is working in Russia.  Davlatbi is involved in retail sales.  She leases a space, where she opened a food store.  She has been in this field for over 7 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sugar, dairy products, candy, canned goods and bread.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, dairy products, candy, canned goods and bread

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila  is a single woman who struggles day after day to provide food for herself and her family. Two years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. She sells raised cattle in the local central bazaar and her monthly income is 400 USD.

Slowly the number of her cows increased and with the increase, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.  

Naila is going to purchase three baby calves. She is a second-cycle borrower of AqroInvest and she repaid her first loan successfully.

loans.use: to purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Mrs. Sot is a 23 year-old woman who has been living in Kompong Speu Province. She has worked for a local organization as an internal staff and she receives a formal salary monthly. She is married to Mr. Moul, 38, who is employed as a policeman in his community, and he also receives a formal salary every month. Mr. Moul always shares his responsibility with Mrs. Sot and uses his income to help pay the whole family’s expenses. Beside her job, Mrs. Sot has raised a lot of chickens and she had hopes to sell them to buyers three or four months after she begins raising them. Unfortunately, the chickens are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Sot has requested a loan of $300 that she will use to buy many sacks of chickens feed to fatten her chickens.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of chickens feed to fatten her chickens.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha has two children, six and three years old. She works in a garment factory, and her husband is a security guard. Their income is $6 a day. Every month she must spend $30 on food, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses.

Chantha is requesting a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. Her work in the factory is very tiring, so she plans to raise animals at home to sell instead when she has saved enough money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is married with one child aged one and half years and lives with his family in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. He has been farming for the last 4 years producing and selling tea and milk to the local market.

Gilbert is requesting a 41,600 KES loan with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his family livelihood and he hopes he will also generate enough income to put up a modern dairy unit for the animals.

Gilbert, like many farmers, notes that the fluctuation in milk prices and also animal diseases are the major risks in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira is the leader of this group. She is 63 years old and married to a retiree. Together with her husband, Saira breeds cattle. They started this business 35 years ago and, with the profits gained from reselling cattle, Saira was able to pay for her children’s education. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase two tons of coal for the winter season. In the future Saira wishes to build a new house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two tons of coal for the winter season

loans.name: Qalib

texts.en:
Qalib  is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. Qalib has worked with livestock for 10 years. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells sheep and sells meat. 

Qalib is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to enable him to purchase more sheep. This will allow enable him to increase the meat produced and will provide income security to the family. His current profit per month is about 350 USD, and he would like to increase it to 500 USD. 

The income will enable Qalib to provide for his family, take good care of his animals and supply his neighbors and permanent vendors with quality meat. 

This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking businesswoman. She is 28 years old, married, and blessed with one child. For the last year, Esther has been managing a retail shop where she sells cereals to earn a living. Previously, she sold clothes. 

Esther is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy beans and maize. Within the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize

loans.name: Yervand

texts.ru:
Ерванду 44 года. Он проживает в деревне Тсовагюх (Tsovagyugh), Севанского региона, со своей женой и 14 летним сыном.  
Ерванд окончил Ереванский сельско-хозяйственный институт. После получения диплома экономиста, он 8 лет проработал экономистом в Севанском филиале одного из Ереванских банков. С 1998 года Ерванд работает спасателем в МЧС. 
Параллельно со своей работой Ерванд разводит коров, кур и пчел. У Ерванда на ферме есть одна корова, 2 быка, один теленок, 30 кур и 14 ульев. Он производит мед на продажу. Благодаря прибыли от пчеловодства и своей зарплате, Ерванд содержит свою семью.     
Ерванд получал кредит от организации Нор Оризон 5 раз и всегда выплачивал  кредит своевременно. Сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 700.000 драм для приобретения нескольких новых ульев и обязательных лекарственных препаратов для своих пчел.
texts.en: Yervand is 44 years old.  He lives in the Tsovagyugh village in the Sevan district with his wife and a 14-year-old son.  Yervand graduated from the Yerevan agricultural institute.  After receiving his economist diploma, he spent 8 years working as an economist at the Sevan office of one of Yerevan's banks.  Since 1998, Yervand has been working as a rescuer for the Emercom of Russia.  Parallel to his work, Yervand breeds cattle, chickens and bees.  He has one cow, two bulls, one calf, 30 chickens and 14 beehives at his farm.  He produces honey for sale.  Thanks to the profit from beekeeping and his salary, Yervand supports his family.  He received five loans from the Nor Horizon organization and always repaid them on-time.  Currently, he needs a loan in the sum of 700,000 dram to buy several new beehives and necessary medicine for his bees.

loans.use: to buy several new beehives and necessary medicine for his bees

loans.name: Agileo

texts.en: Agileo has been in the produce business for six years and has also been able to buy a milling machine. He dreams of buying an ox and starting a poultry farm and piggery despite his current challenges of bad debts and fluctuating prices that hinder his profits. Agileo needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Félix Angel

texts.es:
Félix tiene 46 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, la cual pertenece a la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace varios años que Félix quiere hacer unos cambios en su casa, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con una parte más de la propiedad que le heredaron sus padres.

Actualmente Félix está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para  poder comprar materiales de construcción, para asi arreglar la infraestructura de su hogar y ampliar el cuarto de pila. Con esto el espera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que su deseo estar más tranquilo, que sus hijos vivan mas cómodos y tengan un techo digno.

Félix es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
46 year old Félix lives with his wife and children in a community called San Carlos that is in the second province of Costa Rica, Alajuela. It is an area that is first in the nation for its coffee and sugar cane production. It also produces staple grains (rice, beans, corn), fruit, vegetables, root vegetables, and salad greens. The most important airport in the country, Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, is also in this province.
Félix has been wanting to make some changes to his house for a number of years, as he currently holds part of the property he inherited from his parents.
Currently, Félix is requesting a micro loan of $1,000 to buy construction materials to fix the infrastructure of his home and extend the laundry room. He hopes that this will bring his family a better quality of life as his wish is to lead a quieter life so that his children can be more comfortable and have a decent roof over their heads. 
Félix is a member of the community bank of San Francisco, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. He will continue to grow personally and economically as well as participating actively in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: extend the laundry room.

loans.name: Vilma Petronila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LOS COMERCIANTES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vilma;  La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 de ellos son independientes y la socia vive con uno de ellos de 12 años de edad; la socia tiene una tienda comercial de venta de productos de abarrotes y bazar, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de gaseosas, ella tiene pensado comprar gaseosas en cajas de todo sabor para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de gaseosas en cajas para implementar el negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the 'Los Comerciantes' community bank which is located in Andahuaylillas district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Vilma is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  Four of her children live independently but she still lives with one of her children who is 12 years old.  Vilma has a store where she sells groceries and miscellaneous products.  She would like to invest her loan in buying soda.  She plans to buy crates of soda in all flavors to sell.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying crates of soda to stock her business.

Vilma is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying crates of soda to stock her business

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

She is a farmer, and she raises pigs at home. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Phalla is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more piglets to raise for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Arame est mariée, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants, elle membre du banc villageois depuis le 06/08/2009.
Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité Diamaguene.

Le petit commerce constitue son activité plus précisément la vente de poissons fumés et séchés.
Avec son nouveau prêt Arame va acheter 50 paniers de poissons séchés , 2 paniers de poissons fumés qu'elle va revendre.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices Madame va aider son mari dans la prise en charge sanitaire et scolaire de ses enfants.
mais également elle  va acheter du riz de l'huile et du sucre pour tout la famille à la fin de chaque mois.
texts.en: Arame is married, 40 years old and the mother of six children. She is a member of the "banc villageois" (village bank) since August 6th, 2009. She is part of the Diamaguene group. Local trade is her business activity, more specifically the sale of smoked and dried fish. With her new loan, Arame will buy 50 baskets of dried fish and 2 baskets of smoked fish which she will re-sell. With the help of her profits, she will help her husband in taking care of the basic health and education needs of her children; however she will also buy rice, oil and sugar for the whole family at the end of each month.

loans.use: to buy fish products (smoked and dried fish)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Gladys; en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito para comprar y abastecer su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, la socia también desea invertir en la compra de carteras y zapatos, ella desea traer mercadería para vender a sus clientes y amistades. La socia desea invertir su credito en la compra de carteras, zapatos e implementar su stock de productos de belleza por catalogos.
texts.en: The member is Gladys, and she now wants to invest her loan to increase her supply of beauty products, which she sells from catalogues. She also wants to buy wallets and shoes, so that she has merchandize to sell to her clients and friends. She will buy wallets, shoes, and increase her supply of beauty products.

loans.use: to buy wallets, shoes, and increase her supply of beauty products.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. 

Her husband runs a cell phone repair service, her elder three children are school students and the younger one is a kindergarten student. 

She started her garment retailing business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Her products are stylish, high quality and cheap. Also, she makes pendant earrings and sells them. 

Now that holiday season is approaching, she needs to buy additional supplies. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes for the new year.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the new year.

loans.name: Jose Abdubar

texts.es: Jose, necesita invertir nuevamente en agricultura, por eso solicita un préstamo para el pago de mano de obra y pago por el alquiler de una  desgranadora de maíz para procesar la cosecha que obtuvo, esto le ayudará para tener el maíz listo para el consumo de su familia y para ofrecer a la venta. El considera que la cosecha que ha obtenido ha sido abundante, producto del préstamo anterior, ya que le sirvió para darle los cuidados necesarios a esta producción.
texts.en: Jose needs to invest in agriculture again. In order to do so he is requesting a loan to pay the labourers and rent a corn sheller to process the harvest. This will help him to have the corn ready for his family's consumption and for sale. He says that his harvest has been abundant thanks to his previous loan, which he used to take care of his crops.

loans.use: to pay labourers and rent a sheller.

loans.name: Charity Wangechi

texts.en:
Charity Wangechi is a 42-year-old clothes seller from Mikindani, Mombasa. She has been selling clothes for the past four years and her business is doing well. 

This is Charity’s second business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses to sell to her customers. Charity will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and buy furnishings for her house. She also hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Lyn makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Lyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.en:
My name is Martha, but everyone knows me as Martita, I sell cometics, wallets, sashes and other items.I have had my business for five years and it has grown with my sales. Now I need to supply my business to support my children in their studies.

Use of Loan: Purchas of cosmetics, wallets, sashes, electronic devices and other items.

Me llamo Martha pero todos me conocen por Martita, vendo cosmeticos, carteras, fajas y otros. Mi negocio lo tengo desde hace cinco años el que ha crecido al igual que mis ventas, en este momento necesito abastecer el negocio para apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de cosmeticos, carteras, fajas, aparatos electricos y otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en: “Works which are done by men can also be done by women, if the heart is in it,” Faasulu commented. She is married with six children, five of whom are in school. Painting is a job you seldom see women perform, but Faasulu believes otherwise. She is very handy with a paint brush and therefore made it her business. She goes to the houses which need painting, especially new ones, and does the job herself or sometimes gets the help of her husband. That is how she spent her first loan of ST$750 up to her third loan of ST$1250, buying paints, brushes, varnish, and more. Faasulu likes doing this business because she’s not only good at it, it also gives her more money.

loans.use: To purchase more paint, brushes, varnish

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria has been selling merchandise for 20 years, she is married has two children already married. She has always liked to sell and although she had a job at a hospital, she used to sell clothes and jewelry to get some extra income and improve her family’s quality of life. Unfortunately she had an accident that disabled her and was very depressed after it, now she receives a pension which is very low, but with her savings she was able to establish her own business, where she sells bed and bath accessories, this has kept her busy and has helped her to cover her medical expenses.

Now she is requesting a loan for $750 in order to buy merchandise to help her grow her business, she promises to repay in 6 months. With your help she will improve her life, help her realize her dreams, thank you.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años Gloria se dedica a las ventas, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos ya casados. A ella siempre le han gustado las ventas y a pesar de que tenía un empleo en un hospital, ella vendía ropa y joyería para obtener un ingreso extra y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Lamentablemente sufrió un accidente que la incapacitó y estuvo muy deprimida después de esto, ahora recibe una pensión que es muy baja, pero con los ahorros que tenía logró establecer su propio negocio, donde vende blancos, así ha logrado mantenerse ocupada y para cubrir sus gastos médicos.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para hacer crecer su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de Gloria, ayúdala a la realización de sus sueños, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Buy merchandise (home products)

loans.name: Puaaelo

texts.en:
Puaaelo is one of the old members in the Sologa Mulifanua Center. She is on her fifth loan and she is still running her Samoan oil business together with an additional business of weaving fine mats.

Although the loan seems big compared to the business, Puaaelo, as mentioned before, also weaves and sells fine mats at very high prices. These fine mats are more sellable in times of funerals, weddings and other events. So when people are in need, they buy these fine mats from her. The cost of 20 inches of fine matting is usually two thousand to two thousand and fifty dollars for one. So if she can sell two to three fine mats a month, that will be more income for her.

loans.use: “Buy twenty iron roofs, nails and timber for house improvement”

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud has a sweets and carrot juice shop in the area of Borj el Barajneh, in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a 31-yearold married man with one child  who is supporting his family through the small business he owns. His freshly squeezed vegetables are a delight to the eye and to the mouth. In order to develop his shop and to generate more revenues, Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1200. This will be the 4th loan Mahmoud has gotten from Al Majmoua, and he always repays his debt.

loans.use: To purchase of goods and develop his business.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Miss Françoise A. was born on July 14, 1987 in Lomé. As she did not have the financial means to continue with her studies, she chose to become a hairdresser. Today she has finished her apprenticeship and wants to open her own hairdressing salon. She is single with one child and lives in Lomé’s Agbalépedogan neighborhood. She has to work with her friend, and for this reason she would like a loan of $600 to use to open her own hairdressing salon.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle Françoise A. est née le 14 Juillet 1987 à Lomé. Ne pouvant plus continuer ses études faute de moyens financiers, elle a préféré faire la coiffure. Aujourd’hui, elle a terminé son apprentissage et elle veut ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant et réside au quartier Agbalépedogan à Lomé. Elle est obligée d’aller travailler avec sa copine, c’est pour cela qu’elle voulait un prêt de $600 qui lui servira d’ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure.

loans.use: To open a hairdressing salon
